loans.name: Tem

texts.en:
Tem is 39 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She operates a rice cultivating business where she earns suitable income to cover her daily expenses. With a part of her income, Tem has invested in pigs and a fish-raising business to better her living conditions. She has been in the businesses for almost 20 years.

Due to inadequate financial funds, Tem is applying for a loan of 300 USD to buy feed to fatten her pigs and fish. She wants to be a successful entrepreneur and further develop her business in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy feed to fatten her pigs and fish.

loans.name: Suos

texts.en:
Suos works in the construction field to provide income for his family. He is the main income provider of his family. He is 45 years old, married and responsible for three children living together with him in Dongkor commune, a suburb area of Phnom Penh. His wife works for a garment factory to help him earn income. His priority is to provide his school-age children a further education through all his effort.

As of now, due to the lack of a family-owned vehicle, he would like to request credit from HKL, one of Kiva's partners, to purchase a used motorcycle for commuting to his workplace,s as well as for household use. His dream is to open a large store with selling many kinds of merchandise serving people in his commune.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for commuting to his workplaces, as well as for the household use.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en: Peninah is 29 years old. She sells beans, maize and peas to earn a living. He has been in the business for five years and has employed two people.To earn extra income, she does pig farming. She describes her business environment as good because she has many regular customers. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 70,000 Kenya Shillings to buy beans, maize and peas for sale.

loans.use: to buy beans, maize and peas for sale.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: La señora Alicia tiene 45 años, estudio tan solo hasta el nivel primario y se caso con el señor Víctor, tienen tres hijos donde el mayor no pudo ingresar a la universidad por su situación económica, es gracias a esto que viajo a trabajar a Brasil y actualmente colabora con los estudios universitarios a su segundo hermano, la menor esta cursando el nivel primario en una escuela fiscal de la zona donde radica. La señora vivió con sus padres a los cuales colaboró en la producción agrícola durante la niñez, una vez que se caso le dieron su herencia donde actualmente vive con su familia en la zona de Caramarca de la ciudad de Cochabamba, es una de las zonas de mayor producción de cebolla, maíz, papa y otros; como esta zona es apta para el rubro la familia se dedica al sembrado de maíz, papa y cebolla. En este mes comienza el sembrado de papa pero la señora Alicia no cuenta con efectivo para comprar la semilla y abono y es para esto que solicita el crédito. El ideal que tiene la señora Alicia es que sus dos últimos hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en: Alicia is 45 years old and studied only until elementary school. She married Víctor and they have three children. The oldest couldn't attend university due to their economic situation. Thanks to this, he traveled to Brazil and is currently helping with the university studies of their second son. The youngest is studying at a public elementary school in the area where they live. Alicia lived with her parents with whom she worked on farming production during her childhood. Once she got married, her parents gave her her inheritance where she currently lives with her family. This is in the area of Caramarca in the city of Cochabamba. It's one of the areas that has the greatest production of onion, corn, potato, and other crops as it is fit for their production. The family makes a living sowing corn, potato, and onion. During this month they will begin to sow potato but Alicia doesn't have cash to buy seeds and fertilizer. For this reason she is requesting the loan. Ideally Alicia would like to have her two oldest sons be professionals.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds, organic fertilizer, and chemicals.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a widow with two children, both of whom graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rental bills.

For the past eight months, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling retail to her neighbours and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business to hire more employees in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rio Blanco Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rio Blanco lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es María de los Ángeles quien se dedica al comercio de calzado, cosméticos y bisutería desde hace 8 años. Ella está casada y tiene tres hijos pero solo los menores están a su cargo de 8 y 11 años.
Las señoras María de la Concepción quien vende ropa usada, nueva y chinelas desde hace 7 años y Darling del Socorro vende tortilla desde hace 2 años.
texts.en: Río Blanco Group (white river) is composed of three hard-working women. One of them is María de los Ángeles who has been selling footwear, cosmetics and jewelry for eight years. She is married and the mother of three children, but only the two youngest, aged 8 and 11, are depending on her. The two other group members are María de la Concepción, who has been selling used and new clothes as well as sandals for seven years, and Darling del Socorro, who has been selling tortillas for two years.

loans.use: to buy footwear, jewels and cosmetics.

loans.name: Pio Agustin

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica en un poblado del  departamento de león, El señor Pio se dedica arduamente  a laborar como Coordinador técnico en el ministerio de educación, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace 6 años y 21 año de haber ejercido la labor de maestro de primaria, es Casado con 2 hijas a su cargo, a los  que tiene que proporcionarles  las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen, estudian el nivel universitario en la cuidad de león.
Una de las necesidades que el señor  Pio  atraviesa hoy en día es de Mejorar su vivienda, la que se encuentra en mal estado, ya que debido a esta necesidad, le `permitió tomar la decisión sabia de visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de Materiales de construcción como: Cemento, Arena, Bloques, Clavos, Piedrín, Hierro, Alambre de Amarre, perlin  y Mano de Obra, para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Telica in a village of the department of León, Pio makes a living working hard as a technical coordinator with the Department of Education. He's been doing this for a living for six years and worked for twenty-one years as an elementary school teacher. He's married with two daughters in his care and for whom he has to provide the necessary conditions for their development. They study at the university-level in the city of León.

One of the needs that Pio has these days is to improve his home which is in a bad state. Because of this he allowed himself to make the wise decision to visit Ceprodel to request a loan to buy construction materials like cement, sand, blocks, nails, gravel, iron, tie wire, purlin,, and labor in order to improve his home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement, sand, blocks, nails, gravel, zinc, iron, tie wire, purlin,, and manual labor.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala east region of Uganda. For the past two years, Jalia has been working hard to manage her small business which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Jalia has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale and will help Jalia to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Jalia hopes that in the future she will be able to own a wholesale shop. 

Jalia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Jalia's future prospects by helping her to her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Mariam is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in Kampala, a region in the eastern part of Uganda. For the past year, Mariam has been working hard to manage her mobile business, through which she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Mariam to generate greater profits and increase the capital in her business. Mariam hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Mariam's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en:
Hellen's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Hellen is 22 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past two years, Hellen has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Hellen has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities for resale, and will help Hellen to generate greater profits and pay for her own house rent. Hellen hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Hellen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Hellen's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities for resale.

loans.name: Carol's Group

texts.en:
Carol's group is comprised of 2 hard working women. Carol is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala West region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Carol has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Carol has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities for resale, and will help Carol to generate greater profits and pay her own school fees. Carol hopes that in the future she will be able to own a designing shop. 

Carol is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Carol's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: buy sugar and soap

loans.name: Abel

texts.en: Abel is a 33-year old married man with two children living in Kamwenge,Uganda. He owns a driving school which he started six years ago. His starting capital was 500,000 shillings but now it's worth 3,000,000 shillings. Although he has progressed in his business, Abel faces a challenge of high fuel and transportation costs. His dream is educating his children and expanding his business into new markets. He needs this loan to pay for the license to operate for his driving school.

loans.use: to pay for the license to operate his driving school.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce wants a loan to buy maize, beans, maize flour and tomatoes for sale. Aged 38 years, she lives in Masindi, Uganda. 

The responsibility of taking care of her four children rests on her. Her dream is to educate them to educate her children up to university level.

Joyce started by farming, sold her cassava, and started market vending. Her desire is to educate her children and move her business to permanent premises.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans, maize flour and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is 26 years old, married, and has one child. He does carpentry to earn a living. He has been in the business for 2 years has employed one person. He describes his business environment as busy because he has many regular customers. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, his living standards have improved and he hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy timber and nails.

loans.use: to buy timber and nails.

loans.name: Butunduzi Fal Instructors Group

texts.en:
Joy is a 36-year-old woman. She lives in a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda.  She is charged with the responsibility of looking after her children and her desire is to educate them through higher institutions of learning. She is a farmer with eight years of experience. Her business remains feasible although she faces the challenge of limited capital.

She is a member of a group where each member guarantees the other in order to access a loan. Joy intends to use this loan to buy agricultural inputs  such as tomatoes seedlings and sprays for the next season.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as tomatoes seedlings and sprays for next season

loans.name: Milly

texts.en: Milly wants a loan to complete the construction of her rental houses. She lives in Masindi, Uganda and is charged with the responsibility of taking care of her two children.  She is a teacher by profession and, with the money she has saved from her salary, she has been able to start building  rental houses. Her dream is to educate her children and to own a housing estate.

loans.use: to complete the construction of her rental houses.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 41 years old and married with two children. He has a taxi cab transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for 4 years and describes his business environment as good for business because there is limited competition. To earn additional income, he does farming. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Peter has been able to pay school fees for his children and hopes to buy another car (taxi) in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy tires for his car.

loans.use: To buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Bancy

texts.en:
Bancy is 37 years old and a mother of one child. She sells used clothes to earn a living; she has been in the business for 15 years and has employed two people. She as also been doing tailoring to earn extra income for the past 15 years. She describes her customers as low-income earners because they live in slums. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy used clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 60 years old and married with two children. For the past four  years, she has run a grocery store to earn a living. Beatrice describes her business environment as good because she has limited competition. To earn extra income, she is a farmer. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Beatrice has been able to educate her children.

Beatrice is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy potatoes, bananas, and tomatoes to sell. In the future, she hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, bananas, and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Nicholus

texts.en:
Nicholus is 35 years old and is married with three children. He has a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years and describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. He earns extra income from farming. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 60,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Magda Petrona

texts.es: Esta clienta es originaria de una comarca del poblado de telica  , es maestra de primaria de un Núcleo Educativo de la localidad, es beneficiada con el convenio de financiamiento con dicho Núcleo, este será utilizado para la compra de 1 Vaquilla y Gastos Escolares, su núcleo familiar son 5 personas de ellos 3 hijos los cuales estudian en el  colegio de la localidad, como docente tiene 21 años de laborar, este es el Cuarto  financiamiento Recibidos atraves del convenio, dichos créditos le han ayudado a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida, siendo de gran impacto en el crecimiento familiar junto a las actividades realizada de su marido y en conjunto para en beneficio familiar, por eso ella mantiene la fidelidad con ceprodel con quien  ha ido de la mano con el mejoramiento y condiciones familiares.
texts.en: This client comes from a region of the village of Telica. She is an elementary school teacher at a school center of the town and is benefited by the financial agreement of said center. This will be utilized to buy one heifer and to help with school expenses. Her family unit has 5 people and of them 3 are her children who study at the town's secondary school. She has worked as a teacher for 21 years and this is the fourth funding received by means of the agreement. The said loans have helped her to improve her conditions and level of well-being, having a great impact on the family growth along with her husband's work for the betterment of the family. For this reason she remains loyal to Ceprodel with whom she has gone hand in hand improving her family's conditions.

loans.use: to buy a heifer and with school expenses.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en: Pius is a forty year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. For ten years he has been distilling alcohol and this has enabled him to provide for his family. His challenge is unpredictable weather which has led to deterioration of yields of his banana plantation. He dreams of educating his children and diversifying his business to include commercial farming. Pius needs the loan to rehabilitate his banana plantation.

loans.use: to rehabilitate his banana plantation.

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
Bosco is a 35-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has owned a liquor store for ten years now. The main challenge he faces is the common bacteria that causes bananas to wilt. Bananas are his raw materials, and, in addition to crop diseases caused by bacteria, the changing seasons make it difficult to sustainably produce liquor.

In a bid to diversify his business and create more sources of income, Bosco intends to buy a motorcycle for transportation. He also dreams of educating his children. Bosco needs this loan to buy a motorcycle for transportation.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is aged 33 and has been farming in her rural home in Litein, South Rift, Kenya for 5 years. Her farm produce of tea and milk are sold within the local market.

Evaline has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy a chuff cutter. She says this will improve her animal feeding and double the milk output. She plans to venture into the transport business by buying a motorcycle .

Evaline laments costly finances and rampant drought.

loans.use: to buy a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 25 years old lady, who is single with two children. She runs a cafeteria business in Emali. She has been in the business for four years now and gets a monthly income of five thousand six hundred shillings.

 
This will be Jane’s first loan with KADET LTD, she plans to use the entire loan to purchase more tables and chairs, and with the profit that she will get, she wants to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy   tables and chairs

loans.name: Felister

texts.en:
Felister is 26 years old lady. She is single, and a mother of two children, and she has a boutique business in Kimana. She has been in this business for three years now and gets a monthly income of 9,000 KES.

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to purchase new clothes for sale. In the future, she wants to use her profits to expand her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for sale.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 30-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in motorcycle transport, where he has worked for over four years. He faces problems of price fluctuation and high fuel and transport costs. His dream is educating his children, building a permanent home, and buying land to grow crops. John needs this loan to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick has been in farming for  six years and produces mainly milk which he sells to the local market. He runs a tea retail business as well to supplement his farming income with some of the tea being sourced from his farm and some from other farmers. He is aged 28 and married with two children aged seven and three years.

He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to to help him construct a bigger and  better dairy unit for his growing number of dairy cows. He is confident his milk output will double  in the near future and he will be in a better position to meet family needs.

He laments of poor weather conditions but appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's loan terms, especially the grace period provided for loan repayment.

loans.use: To construct a bigger dairy unit in his farm

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise is 55 years old and married to Benjamin. She operates a rental houses business and has been in the business for the past five years.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the field officers and plans to use this loan amount to buy building materials to complete the construction of the rental houses. 

In the future, Loise hopes to buy a plot and build more rental houses and thereby make more income.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a thirty one year old lady who is married and has one child. She owns a retail shop. She has been in the business for ten years now and gets a monthly income of KES. 8,000. 

This will be her first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase more stock of a carton of Blue Band, wheat flour, and washing detergent for sale. 


In the future, she wants to be able to expand her business to include general merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of a carton of Blue Band , wheat flour, and washing detergent for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 38 years old, married and a father of two children. He owns a carpentry business in Emali. He has been in the business for fourteen years and gets a monthly income of thirteen thousand shillings.

This will be his first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase more timber for making furniture. 

With the profit that he will get, he wants to expand his business. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and provide better education to his children.

loans.use: to purchase more timber for making furniture.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 31 years old and married. He has two school going children.  

He has been operating his quarry business for four years now and has many customers. Stephen plans to use this loan to buy more stones so that he can satisfy his customers' demands.  

He hopes that he can expand his mining business enough to generate the necessary income to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more stones for sale

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a thirty-eight-year-old lady who is single and a mother of four children. She owns a salon. She has been in business for twelve years now and gets a monthly income of  KES. 20,000. 


This will be her first loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to purchase more beauty products for sale. 

In future she wants to be able to expand her business and improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products for sale.

loans.name: Phoenah

texts.en:
Phoenah is a thirty-year-old lady.  She is single and has one child.  She owns a salon. She has been in the business for five years now and gets a monthly income of KES. 20,000.

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire loan to purchase more beauty products to sell.  In the future, she wants to get married and expand her business.

loans.use: buy beauty products to sell

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a married man aged 33 years old and a father of two children aged five and three years old. He owns a business stall, selling general-ware goods and has been in operation for a period of two years earning a monthly income of KES 6,000.

Nicholas has borrowed a first loan of KES 15,000 and wishes to use this amount to purchase plastic plates, torches, necklaces and chains, capes for sale.  The profit amount will be used to plough back into the business. His dream is to be financially stable and own a larger stocked business.

loans.use: to purchase plastic plates, torches, necklaces and chains, capes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chairs, tables and shelves.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 37 years old and married to Sarah. They have three children. He is a banana trader and has been in the business for the past four years.

This is Julius's first loan with KADET LTD. He was introduced to it by a KADET client. He will use the loan amount to purchase bananas in wholesale for resale.

His hope is to purchase a truck to help in transporting stock to premises and distributing bananas.

loans.use: to purchase  more stock of bananas for sale.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 56 years old and single. She has six children. She is a poultry farmer and has been in the business for the past twelve years.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD . She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET client. She will use the loan to purchase more chickens for resale in her business.

She hopes to own a greenhouse and plant vegetables in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase chickens

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 56 year old single mother of five. She sells utensils and has been in the business for the past twelve years.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced by a KADET client. She will use this loan of KES 30,000 to purchase a stock of utensils for resale in her business.

Her hopes are to expand her business to a wholesale store.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of utensils.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married lady, age 30, who supports a family of four. Her two children are eight and one year old. She owns a retail shop and has been in operation for four years, earning a monthly income of KES 6,000.  

She is requesting her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET Ltd. She wishes to use this amount to purchase sugar for KES 6,000, wheat flour for KES 3,000, maize flour for KES 3,000, washing and other detergents for KES 3,000, and cooking oils for KES 5,000. 

The profits will be plowed back into the business and also used for the upkeep of her family. Her dream is to own a plot of land and prosper in business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar for KES 6,000, wheat flour for KES 3,000, maize flour for KES 3,000, washing and other detergents for KES 3,000, and cooking oils for KES 5,000.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgé(e) de 56 ans. Elle est mariée à un revendeur et a 06enfants dont 01 à l’école. L’ainé a 33ans et le dernier 18ans.
Afi travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale et de boisson locale à la maison depuis 2008.
Afi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits BB de la boisson locale et des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir et voir son activité prospérer. Elle veut voir sa famille s’épanouir.
texts.en:
Afi, age 56, is married to a reseller and has six children, out of whom one attends school. The eldest is 33 years old, the youngest is 18.

Since 2008, Afi has been reselling food staples and local beverages at her home. 

She's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy BB products (BB is a brewery in Lomé), local beverages, and food staples.

She wants to reinvest in her business in order to make it thrive. She wants to see her family blossom.

loans.use: to buy local beverages and food staples

loans.name: Doris Estela

texts.es:
Doris continúa en su negocio de ropa y se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de vestidos, faldas, blusas y ropa interior, variando los estilos y los colores para aumentar la demanda en clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior ella logro cancelar un pedido de ropa para epoca de las fiestas, con el que creció no solo en venta si no también en clientes.
texts.en:
Doris keeps running her clothes selling activity and she is currently requesting a loan to buy clothes, skirts, blouses and underwear, purchasing different styles and colors to increase her customers’ requests.
Thanks to her previous loan she was able to finish paying for an order of clothes for the past holiday season, during which she increased not only her sales but also the number of her customers.

loans.use: To buy clothes, skirts, blouses and underwear.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr:
Dédé est une femme âgé(e) de 35 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur  et a 03enfants dont 02 à l’école. Le premier a 10ans et le dernier 04ans.
Dédé travaille comme revendeuse de produits de beauté depuis 2007. Elle vend à la maison et dans sa boutique.
Dédé a requis son second  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits de beauté. Elle veut épargner, agrandir l’activité et assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en:
Dédé, age 35, is married to a reseller and has three children, out of whom two attend school. The eldest is 10 years old, the youngest is 4.

Since 2007, Dédé has been reselling cosmetics. She sells at her home and in her shop.

She's seeking a second loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy cosmetics. She wants to put money away, expand her business, and ensure that her family's basic needs are covered

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: William Alberto

texts.es:
William, vive con sus padres, no tiene hijos, él trabaja como panificador por las mañanas, en las tardes de dedica a vender el pan.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de un horno en su vivienda, este préstamo le dará la oportunidad de iniciar con la panaderia propia, aunque con poca cantidad pero tendra la facilidad de mejorar la producción del negocio en el aumento de pan.
La aspiración de William es tener una panadería fuerte, con mayor capacidad de producción, aumentando el número de clientes.
texts.en:
William lives with his parents and he has no children. He works as a baker in the mornings, selling bread in the evenings.
He is requesting a loan in order to buy construction materials to build an oven in his house. The loan will help him start his own bakery, with a low rate production at first, but with the chance to improve the production rate with the increase of the customers’ requests.
William dreams of running a steady bakery business, with a high production rate, thus increasing the number of his customers.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build an oven in his house.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, vive con sus tres nietos y un hijo, la casa en la que reside en propia, ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos, tiene 5 años de estar dedicada a la venta, de la cual ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mariscos en variedad, por ejemplo pescado fresco  y seco, almejas, conchas, camarones, esto le ayudara a mantener surtido y variedad de especies de mariscos, para tener más oportunidades de venta. 
La aspiración de María es que a través del negocio pueda comprarse a futuro un vehículo para transportar la mercadería.
texts.en:
María lives with her son and her three grandsons in her own house. She has been selling seafood for 5 years, and with her activity she has succeeded in providing for her family.
She is requesting a loan to buy a variety of seafood, such as fresh and dried fish, clam, shellfish and shrimps. This will help her keep herself stocked up and to vary the kind of seafood she sells, thus gaining more selling opportunities.
In the future, María hopes that thanks to her activity she will be able to buy a vehicle to transport her products.

loans.use: To buy fresh and dried fish, clam, shellfish and shrimps.

loans.name: Llegaremos A La Meta Group

texts.es:
El grupo llegaremos a la meta está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Margarita quien desde hace 10 años inicio vendiendo ropa interior y cosméticos y poco apoco fue surtiendo su negocio. Ella es casada y tiene cuatro niños los cuales estudian.
Las otras integrantes son Idalia Patricia  quien vende ropa desde hace 8 años y María quien tiene una comideria.
texts.en: The Llegaremos a la Meta [We Will Meet Our Goal] is made up of three hardworking and enterprising people. One of them is Margarita who 10 years ago started selling underwear and cosmetics. Little by little she stocked her business. She is married and has four children who go to school. The other members are Idalia Patricia, who has sold clothes for 8 years and María, who has a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase retail stock.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth De La Paz

texts.es:
María vive con su esposo y un hijo, es costurera, dicho negocio lo inicio gracias a su propia iniciativa y la ayuda de su familia para instalarlo en casa, trabaja todos los días de 6:00 a.m  a 8:00 p.m realiza costuras a personas de la zona y a algunos estudiantes. 
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la sastreria, telas, hilos, broches, sierres, botones, esta compra le ayuda a mejorar su trabajo y tener mas posibilidades de mejores ingresos al hogar.
Su mayor sueño es crecer en el negocio para mejorar las ganancias, crecer a su hijo y tener una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and son. She is a seamstress. She started her business on her own intitaive and with her family's help to set it up in her house. She works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. sewing for people in the area and for some students. She is asking for for a loan to buy sewing materials such as fabric, thread, fasteners, zippers, and buttons. This purchase will help her to improve her business and have the possibility of improving income for her home. 

Her biggest dream is to grow her business to improve her earnings, raise her son and own her own house.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, fasteners, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Jose Romeo

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque está iniciando el cultivo de maíz, para esto deberá pagar el alquiler del terreno, ayudándole para garantizar su trabajo agrícola.
El manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ayudo para la compra de insumos, que los aplico a su cultivo anterior, y que su cosecha fue abundante, con la que ha podido realizar ventas y mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
José is asking for a new loan because he is starting his corn crop. To do this, he needs to rent the land, helping him to guarantee his agricultural work. 

He states that the previous loan help him buy materials which he used with his previous crop. HIs harvest was abundant and he was able to sell it and support his family.

loans.use: to rent some land.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Parachichi Group

texts.en:
Rosemary, who is in her mid forties, is married with two children who are big. She has been selling fish for four years now. She works from 2.00 pm to 11.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be her eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy a sewing machine for a small tailoring business, buy a plot of land and pay household expenses. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to buy more fish. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "parachichi"  which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is a conscientious woman and married with two school-age children. She works hard to provide good education for her children. To help her husband, Sam has been operating a clothes-selling business from a rented booth in a local market of Dongkor commune, Phnom Penh. She is able to generate an average of 10.00USD per day, while her husband works for Honda Company as a driving teacher.

To improve the growth of her business, Sam would like acquire a loan through HKL to purchase a stock of clothes so she can make constant sales. Her business goal is to own another store to expand her clothes-selling business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothes.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is fifty-one years old and is a married woman with four children aged between thirteen and twenty-seven. She has had a tailoring business for eighteen years. Cirila makes slacks, uniforms and provides general alterations to clothing. She earns 6,000 PHP per month doing this business.

Cirila is requesting a loan to buy tailoring materials such as threads, cloth, zippers and buttons. She hopes for her business to grow and for her children to become successful.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials such as threads, cloth, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Ry is twenty-five years old and married with a small young kid. She works as a garment worker. She goes to work six days per weeks from Monday to Saturday, earning an average of 4.00USD each day. Her schedule starts from 7:00 am and finishes at 5:00 pm. However, she works overtime out her regular schedule when the employer needs help. 

Ry would like a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase construction supplies to fix some parts of her house and pay the workers to do the construction. She hopes to provide her family with happiness through how she uses the loan.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies and pay for workers to do the construction.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is thirty-three years old and lives in the town of Nebbi in the Arua region of Uganda. She is divorced and has three children, two of them are currently in school. For the past six years, Evelyn has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Evelyn has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities, and will help Evelyn to generate greater profits and pay part of the school fees for her children. Evelyn hopes that in the future she will be able to open a new branch of the same business. 

Evelyn is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Evelyn who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities for her shop.

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en:
Oeurn is thirty-three years old. He is married and has two children. He is a noble farmer dedicated to rice husbandry, which he grows for both the family’s sustenance and for sale. He usually generates an income of 2.50USD per day. This work is very enjoyable for him because he likes planting. 

Oeurn requires an additional amount of money to purchase cattle which he can use for for farm work and also fatten for future sale as well. In the future, Oeurn would like to open a seamstress store for one of his daughters to manage.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for farm work.

loans.name: Claudia Veronica

texts.es:
Claudia, vive con sus hijos y esposo en casa propia, administra un bazar, lo tiene desde hace 5 años, los hijos la apoyan y su esposo, para atender el negocio, pues este es un aporte importante para los ingresos del hogar.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el negocio, blusas, ropa interior, recuerdos, porta foto, entre otros que son necesarios para mejorar el inventario y ofrecer a los clientes más variedad.
El objetivo de Claudia es tener mayores ventas, creciendo en el negocio, para que su familia cuente con un mejor nivel de ingresos.
texts.en:
Claudia lives with her children and her husband in her own house. She has been running a small store for 5 years and her husband and her children help her working in the shop since this is an important source of income for the family.
She is requesting a loan to buy items for her shop such as blouses, underwear, souvenirs and picture frames among other items she needs to supply her stock, and to offer a wider variety of products to her customers.
Claudia’s goal is to increase her sales and to see her activity grow in order to provide her family with a better income.

loans.use: To buy blouses, underwear, souvenirs and picture frames.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto, administra una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, el negocio lo administra desde hace 7 años, lo fundó junto a su esposa, actualmente solo él es responsable del negocio, pues su esposa falleció hace 6 meses, el horario de atención de Rigoberto es desde las 5:00am hasta las 7:00pm.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pollo, y otros productos para la tienda, que son de primera necesidad, el préstamo le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio y con las ganancias cubrir sus necesidades.
La aspiración de Rigoberto es darle vida al negocio haciéndolo crecer, ya que depende únicamente de él para mantenerse con todos sus gastos.
texts.en:
Rigoberto runs a general store selling basin necessities, and he has adult children. 7 years ago he opened the store with his wife, but at the moment he manages the store alone, because his wife died 6 months ago. Rigoberto works in his shop from 5 am to 7 pm.
He is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, sugar and chicken among other basic necessities for his shop. The loan will help him improving his activity, and he will be able to pay for his necessities thanks to his earnings.
Rigoberto’s goal is to boost his activity making his store grow, as this is the only source of income he can count on to pay for all of his expenses.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar and chicken.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en: Florita is a 34-year-old widow from Talibon, Bohol. She is into pottery making. She has been in this business for five years. Florita earns 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month doing this business. Florita works hard to sustain her children. She requested a loan to buy more clay and painting materials. Florita hopes to start a hog-raising business to help augment her income and sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more clay and painting materials.

loans.name: Jenesio

texts.en:
Jenesio is 38 years old and lives in the town of Paidah in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has four children; three of them are currently in school. For the past eight years, Jenesio has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Jenesio has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities, and will help Jenesio to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Jenesio hopes that he will be able to start a side business in the future. 

Jenesio is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jenesio who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities.

loans.name: Ornn

texts.en:
Ornn is 40 years old. She only finished her elementary education. She is married and has been blessed with three children. She works very hard at the rice field because she aims to provide a good education for the children. She is a proud farmer of a 3-hectare rice field. She had been in this business for almost 22 years with her spouse. 

Ornn is now asking for a loan of 1,000,000 riel to pay for rented farmland so that she can start planting potatoes. She hopes this loan will be granted to her to further improve her crops and their lives as well. This is her third loan with HKL.

loans.use: to pay for rented farmland.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Kodjo est un homme âgé de 42ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse et a 03 enfants tous scolarisés. L’ainé a 14ans et le dernier a 06ans. Kodzo est mécanicien à deux roues et exerce son activité avec ses apprentis dans un atelier. Sa difficulté principale est la concurrence sur le terrain. Il est à son second crédit et veut ce prêt pour acheter des compresseurs et de la machine à air. Il veut épargner les profits supplémentaires, agrandir son activité et avoir une famille heureuse. Il a commencé en 1990.
texts.en:
Kodjo, age 42, is married to a reseller and has three school-attending children. The eldest is 14 years old, the youngest is 6.

Kodjo is a two-wheeler mechanic who runs his business with his apprentices in his workshop. He started it in 1990.

His main difficulty is competition in the field. He's seeking his second loan, which he wants to use to buy compressors and compressed-air machines.

He wants to put away the additional profits, expand his business, and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy compressors and compressed-air machines

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 28 years old and lives in the town of Arua Hill in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has two children; one of them is currently in school. For the past three years, Isaac has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Isaac has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities, and will help Isaac to generate greater profits and pay medical expenses and meet other needs for his family. In the future, Isaac hopes that he will be able to expand his family. 

Isaac is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Isaac who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en: Leonor is 51 years old and lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a farmer who primarily grows rice crops to sell. She also raises pigs to fatten and sell at the market. Leonor works hard to improve the standard of living of her family. She requested a loan to purchase farm fertilizers, feeds and vitamins. Leonor hopes to have a progressive business.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizers, feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
Toch, 50, is married. She resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $5 per day. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. Approximately, they earn $9 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Toch is requesting a loan to purchase rice to resell at a profitable price. By doing so, she will be able to earn extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and help her children get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resell at a profitable price.

loans.name: Akoélé

texts.fr: Akoélé est une femme âgée de 34ans. Elle est mariée à un mécanicien et n’a pas d’enfants. Elle est couturière de profession et exerce cette activité depuis 2004 à la maison. Sa difficulté principale est la concurrence. Elle sollicite ce premier prêt pour acheter de la machine à coudre, à plinthe et à surfilage pour mieux répondre à la demande de la clientèle. Elle veut réinvestir dans son atelier et avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Akoélé, age 34, is married to a mechanic and doesn't have children. She's a trained seamstress, and has been running this business at her home since 2004.

Her main difficulty is competition. She's seeking her first loan to buy a sewing, skirting, and over-sewing machine, in order to better meet customer demand.

She wants to reinvest in her workshop and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing, skirting, and over-sewing machine

loans.name: Nun

texts.en:
Nun is 25 years old and lives in a small village of Batey district, Kompong Cham. The region is well-known for its fertile land, and most villagers prefer the agricultural business, especially farming crops for income. Nun is a rice farmer, as are other villagers. She is industrious and pays attention to her crops to ensure high production. She is now already married and has a young kid. 

Recently, Nun's house has been under construction, but due to the lack of capital, she has applied for a loan to purchase additional construction supplies and floorboards to get her house completed. In the future, she wants to expand her business and own a wide farmland for crop cultivation.

loans.use: to purchase additional construction supplies and floorboards.

loans.name: Nouni-Djod-Nam

texts.fr: Nouni-dzid-Nam est une femme de 24ans. Elle est mariée à  mécanicien et 01enfant de 03ans. Elle est revendeuse de produits cosmétiques, des pagnes dans une boutique depuis 2010 à ses clients. Sa difficulté principale est la concurrence sur le terrain. Elle sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter des produits cosmétiques et des pagnes. Elle veut épargner son profit , agrandir son activité  et avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en: Nouni-dzid-Nam is a 24 year old woman.  She is married to a mechanic and has a three year old son.  Since 2010 she has sold beauty products and  yards of fabric to her clients from a small shop.  Her biggest challenge is competition in the area.  She is seeking her first loan to purchase beauty products and fabric.  She wants to save her profits, grow her business, and have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Nuera

texts.en:
Nuera is a 56-year-old married woman with two children, age 25 and 26. Her husband works as a collector for an insurance company.

Nuera has had a sari-sari store business for 12 years. She sells items like cooking oil, biscuits, canned goods and soft drinks. Nuera is able to provide for her family's daily needs through her business. 

She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as sacks of rice, soft drinks and medicine. Nuera hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as sacks of rice, soft drinks and medicine.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es: Wilmer está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprara inventarios de materias primas y calzado elaborado, además de mercancía variada aprovechando que su esposa y su hija comercializan estos productos y tienen muchos pedidos. Con su credikiva anterior se sintió muy satisfecho porque compró materiales como suelas, pintura, pegantes con los cuales aumentó su servicio de reparación de calzado, así mismo le alcanzó para invertir en mercancías que entre todos en su familia vendieron. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “ Kiva ha sido una gran colaboración para mi , allí he encontrado apoyo para mi negocio y me han brindado confianza”
texts.en:
Wilmer is requesting a new credikiva loan, which he will use to purchase raw material inventory and ready-made shoes, as well as assorted merchandise, since his wife and daughter market these products and get many orders. 
He was very satisfied with his previous credikiva loan because he bought materials such as soles, paint, and glues, which helped him expand his shoe repair service. It also allowed him to invest in merchandise, which his family collaboratively sold. His message to his Kiva financial backers is the following: “Kiva has been of great assistance to me. I found support for my business there, and they offered me trust.”

loans.use: to purchase raw material inventory and ready-made shoes, as well as assorted merchandise.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a married lady who is 27 years old and blessed with four children between 2 and 7 years old.

She owns a cereals store and has been in operation for two years earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

She has borrowed a loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd. This is her first loan and she intends to use the amount to purchase 15 bags of dry maize and three bags of dry beans.  

The profits will be plowed back into the business and used to repay the loan. She hopes to prosper in business and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To purchase dry maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Danaya, composées de femmes mariées et de veuves, ont en moyenne 48 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Zambougou, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments, du lait et divers articles de boutique.                                                                                                                         
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente MADJAN, troisième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter 15 kilos de céréales avec les revendeurs sur place pour ensuite les vendre sur place au village à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 7 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de céréales.
texts.en:
The women in the Danaya Group are wives and widows, are on average 48 years old, have five children each, and live in large traditional families in the village of Zambougou, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative province in the Republic of Mali).  They know eachother along kinship lines, as neighbors and friends.  They sell grain, condiments, milk, and various household items.

The women of the Danaya Group are on their second group loan.  

Madjan, the client standing third from the left, intends to purchase 15 kg of grain from the retailers nearby in order to resell them in the village to a clientele of men and women.  She plans to make a monthly profit of 7000 FCFA which she will use for the needs of her family and to reinvest in her grain business.

loans.use: to purchase grain.

loans.name: Ok

texts.en:
Ok, 58 years old, has been a hardworking farmer for almost 30 years with much experience. Despite her hardships, Ok aims to improve her rice farming business to support her only child. She wants to him to earn a degree from a university and learn enough skills to work in some type of well-paid job.

Ok is asking for additional capital to buy a motorcycle to meet her needs and better her condition. She said that to have motorcycle for household use will make is much easier to get anywhere at any time without paying transportation fees as in the previous time.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Eydys

texts.es: Eydys de 45 años, vive en la ciudad de Cartagena, con su esposo y sus tres hijos en las edades de 10 a 16 años. Su negocio es ser comerciante, actividad que inició,  cuando una amiga suya le dejaba en consignación la mercancía y ella podía devolver la que no vendía.  Así construyó su primera clientela y con sus ahorros logró reunir un capital y empezó a realizar sus propios pedidos. Ella se siente muy contenta,  porque es independiente y maneja su propio dinero. Su meta es ampliar su negocio y tener un almacén bien surtido, con todo lo que su clientela necesite. Pero su mayor desafío, es que su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para responder a la demanda y la competencia logra impactar más. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento  que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará conjuntos para damas, camisas, jeans, que son pedidos que han hecho sus clientes,  pues se acerca el día de las madres y está dispuesta a quedarles bien, para que estos puedan hacer sus regalos a un ser maravilloso como lo es la madre o a quien ocupe ese roll.
texts.en:
Eydys, who is 45 years old, lives in the city of Cartagena with her husband and three children between the ages of 10 and 16. Her business is being a saleswoman, an activity that began when a friend of hers gave her merchandise on consignment, and she could return what she didn't sell. That is how she built up her initial clientele, and with her savings she was able to get together some capital and start making her own orders. She feels very content because she is independent and manages her own money.

Her goal is to increase her business and have a well stocked inventory with everything her clientele needs. But her biggest challenge is that her working capital is insufficient to meet demand and the competition achieves a greater impact. This is precisely the reason that she has turned to her credikiva, the first financing she has done with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy women's suits, shirts, and jeans. These are what her clients have asked for, since Mother's Day is coming up, and she is ready to satisfy them so that they can give their gifts to the marvelous being that is the mother, or to whoever occupies that role.

loans.use: to buy women's suits, shirts and jeans.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 32 years old from Nakuru and is married to Christine. They have three children. 

Joseph is a tailor and has been in this business for the past 12 years. 

He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy more materials for making dresses so as to be able to serve his clients well.

He hopes to diversify into shoe selling in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more materials for making dresses.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 50-year-old woman. She is single with four children.

She has a livestock farming business in Zambezi. She has been in the business for 32 years now.

This will be Margaret’s second loan with KADET Ltd. She plans use the entire loan to purchase one-day-old chicks. She plans to plow the profit that she will get back into the business.

loans.use: To buy one-day-old chicks.

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
Yasin is a married man. He has two children and one is enrolled in school. His wife works as a business woman. He owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

Yasin operates a water selling kiosk. He has worked in this business for one year. His primary customers are neighbors. Yasin's other source of income is his wife's earnings. 

He describes his greatest business challenges as high transportation costs and poor transport infrastructure. His highest monthly expense is school fees. 

Yasin will use the KES 50,000 loan to expand the business by buying pipes. Yasin aspires to be self-dependent and make more profits in the future. He joined Yehu to get financial advancements.

loans.use: to expand the business by buying pipes.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo, composé de femmes mariées et de veuves, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de N’Tjifina, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments et de friandises.                                                                                                                         
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente DOUNAMBA, personne au milieu dans le rang des assis, compte acheter 20 kilos de mil pour la préparation du beignet avec les revendeurs pour ensuite les vendre sur place au village à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de préparation de beignet.
texts.en:
The women of the Djekafo Group are wives and widows, are on average 42 years old, have three children each, and live in large traditional families in the village of N’Tjifina in the Koulikoro Region (second administrative province of Mali).  They know each other through kinship ties, as neighbors and friends.  They sell spices and sweets. 

The women of the Djekafo Group are on their third group loan.

Dounamba, seated in the middle, intends to purchase 20 kg of flour from retailers to make beignets to sell in the village to a clientele of men and women.  She hopes to earn average monthly profits of 10,000 FCFA which she will use to tend to the needs of her family and reinvest in her beignet-making business.

loans.use: to purchase grain.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, trabaja como artesano fabricando canaletas (son hechas de aluminio y sirven para colocarlas en las cornisas de los techos para recibir el agua de las lluvias y bajarlas a través de tubos de aluminio hasta los desagues de las casas) las cuales las vende independientemente y a contratos.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de planchas de aluminio para fabricar mas canaletas y así obtener mejores ingresos para mantener a su familia.
Carlos, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos con los cuales vive en una casa en anticretico en la zona Las Lomas ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Carlos works as an artisan making gutters (these are made from aluminum and are used in the cornices of the roof to collect rainwater and bring it down through aluminum tubes to the house's drains).  He sells these on his own and through contracts.

The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of aluminum sheets for making more gutters, and so earning more income to support his family.

Carlos is married and has four children with whom he lives in anticretic housing [where the tenant pays a fixed sum at the beginning rather than monthly rental] in the Las Lomas area of La Paz city.

This is his third time working with IMPRO and his second time with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase aluminum sheets for making gutters.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 35 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past six years, Peter has been working hard to manage his wholesale shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Peter has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities, and it will help Peter to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Peter hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business more. 

Peter is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Peter who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris, trabaja como empleada en una empresa privada ofreciendo seguros de vida.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de útiles escolares para sus hijos ya que la época de colegio ha comenzado y este es un gasto extra para el cual no tiene dinero ahorrado, pues sus ingresos no son muy altos.
Doris, es divorciada y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en una casa alquilada en la zona Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Doris works as an employee for a private business that sells life insurance.

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of school supplies for her children, as the school year has begun and this is an extra cost for which she doesn't have any money saved as her income is not very high.

Doris is divorced and has two children with whom she lives in a rented home in the Achachicala neighborhood of La Paz city.

This is her second time working with IMPRO, and her first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 45-year-old man. He is married and has three children.

He operates a transportation business in Emali. He has been in the business for three years now and gets a monthly income of 2,000 KES.

This will be Daniel’s first loan with KADET Ltd. He plans to use the entire loan to service his vehicle, buy spare parts and pay for his license. 

With the profit that he will get he wants to educate his children and repair his car. In the future he wants to own a bigger vehicle.

loans.use: to service his vehicle and buy spare parts.

loans.name: Srorn

texts.en:
Srorn is married and has four children. She is 44 years old and lives in the Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham. 

Srorn is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living. She has been doing this along with her spouse for ages. 

Srorn has requested a first loan through HKL to purchase a motorcycle for use in the family. 

In the future, Srorn is determed to continually support her children until they graduate high school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for use in the family.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is a married lady, age 24, and her child is 5 years old. 

She owns a retail shop and has been in operation for four years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd., and she intends to purchase sugar, wheat flour, necklaces, scissors, maize flour, cooking oil, and washing soaps and detergents for sale. The profits will be plowed back into the business and also used to repay the loan.

She hopes to expand in business and live a happy life.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, wheat flour, necklace , scissors, maize flour, cooking oil, and washing soaps and detergents, for sale.

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Narantuya is a 44-year-old divorced woman who lives with her three children in Uvurhangai province in Central Mongolia. Two of her children go to college. She started essential goods retailing and a clothing sales business in 2006. Since her husband left, she has lived alone, taking care of her children. As she believed in herself, she made her dreams come true. She has been increasing her income and paying the two boys' college tuition fees. 

Narantuya is a brave and active woman who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by purchasing commodities in large quantities so that I can increase the business volume and save for my third son's college fees." The total amount she is requesting is 500,000 MNT to buy commodities in large amounts.

loans.use: To buy commodities in large amounts

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en: Elijah is a 25-year-old married man. He has a daughter who is two years old. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a small shop where he sells phone accessories and provides M-pesa (money transfer) services. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a fast growing slum area  and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity within the area. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy phone accessories. His business goal is to own several such small shops within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy phone accesories.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo, composées de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 28 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Zambougou, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de l’arachide et de chaussures.                                                                                                                         
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                
La cliente AMI, deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter 30 kilos d’arachide avec les revendeurs sur place pour ensuite les vendre sur place au village à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 4 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce d’arachide.
texts.en:
The women of the Djekafo Group are wives and widows, are on average 28 years old, have four children each, and live in large traditional families in the village of Zambougou, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative province in Mail).  They know each other through kinship ties, as neighbors and friends.  They sell groundnuts and shoes.

The women of the Djekafo Group are on their second group loan.

Ami, standing second from the right, intends to purchase 30 kg of groundnuts from the retailers in town in order to sell them in the village to a clientele of men and women.  She hopes to make average monthly profits of 4,000 FCFA of which she will use part to tend to the needs of her family and part to reinvest in her groundnut selling business.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo, trabaja independientemente elaborando cotillones (son gorritos, serpentinas, mixturas, hechas de papel de diferentes colores, que se usan para fiestas infantiles y otras celebraciones) y también cuenta con una tienda donde los pone a la venta.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material para la elaboración de más cotillon, papel, cartón, cartulina, goma, plastoformo, etc., y de esta forma aumentar sus ingresos para la mantención de su familia.
Arturo, es viudo y tiene cinco hijos con los cuales vive en la zona Alto San Pedro en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la décima primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la octava vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Arturo works for himself making party favors (these are party hats, party streamers, and other things made from different colored paper which are used at children's parties and other celebrations).  He also a store where he sells these.

The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of material for making more party favors: paper, cardboard, card, glue, polystyrene, etc.  In this way he can increase his income to support his family.

Arturo is a widower and has five children with whom he lives in the Alto San Pedro neighborhood in La Paz city.

This is his tenth time working with IMPRO, and his eighth with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase paper, cardboard, card, glue, and polystyrene to continue with his business making party favors.

loans.name: Javzandolgor

texts.en:
Javzandolgor is a 40-year-old woman who lives with her husband and a son in Bayanhongor province in South-Western Mongolia. Her husband is employed as a driver. Javzandolgor  worked at "Eastern Light" company as a cook from 2001 to 2010. She started a garment retail business in 2008. Also, she ran a catering service business since 2010. Now the garment retail business has been successful, due to her research on the local need on the field. She brings the supplies from a border city of China, which offers thousands of stylish choices for her. The business is famous for its quality and price. 

Javzandolgor is a hardworking woman who says, "I would like to take this loan for the business to purchase products wholesale from China." The total amount she is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to buy garments from China.

loans.use: To buy garments from China

loans.name: Akaki

texts.en:
Akaki is 32 years old. He lives in a village of Khelvachauri District with his family: his wife – Sopiko, their 5-year-old son, 2-year-old daughter and his mother. The family earns a living through their agricultural business. They have a small dairy farm with 2 milk cows. Sopiko sells milk on the local open market. Along with the above-mentioned, the family owns 0.3 hectares of land, where vegetables and fruit trees are grown. Sopiko and Akaki sell harvested products on the local open market as well. Total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris.

Akaki requested credit for purchasing a milk cow. With three milk cows the family will get 50% more milk and the income of the family will increase. Increased income will be used for purchasing needed household goods, to improve family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Hurelbaatar

texts.en:
Hurelbaatar is a 29-year-old man who lives with his wife and a son in the capital city of Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and takes care of the baby. He has been running a business repairing shoes since 2008. He owns a small counter where he runs the service. He gained many regular customers who appreciate the service he supplies. 

Now he is planning to improve the business activity by purchasing some necessary equipment for the business. Hurelbaatar is a  easy-going man who says, "I would like to purchase some necessary equipment for the business to improve the business activities." The total amount he is requesting is 3,100,000 MNT to buy shoe repair equipment.

loans.use: To buy shoe repair equipment

loans.name: Kyalo

texts.en:
Kyalo is a 41-year-old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 8 years to 16 years. He describes himself to be honest and aggressive. He operates a retail store where he sells bread and milk. He has been involved in this business for 12 years. His business is located within a fast growing slum and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the fluctuating prices of bread and its high prices. 

He will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy more milk and bread. His business goal is to be a supplier. He hopes that in the future, he will provide his children with the best education by paying school fees for them.

loans.use: to add a stock of loaves of bread for selling.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin is a single man. He describes himself to be effective. Previously, he was involved in transportation services and was a supplier of fruits. He operates a retail stall where he sells bags. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located within a densely populated residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of bags. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase bags. His dream and goal is to develop his business within five years.

loans.use: to add to his stock of bags.

loans.name: Mkambe

texts.en: Mkambe is a married woman who has nine children, six of whom are enrolled in school. She earns a living by buying and selling goats in a local market. She's worked in this business for four years and was previously employed as a farmer. Her primary customers are the general public. Mkambe's other source of income is farming. She describes her greatest business challenges as thieves  and livestock that die before reaching market. Her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped-in water. Mkambe will use this Kes 40,000 loan to buy more goats. She hope to continue expanding her business by buying more goats in the future. She joined Yehu to secure access to affordable financial help.

loans.use: to buy more goats.

loans.name: Iashar

texts.en:
Iashar is 53 years old. He lives in Khelvachauri District with his family: wife – Natela, 22-year-old son and 18-year-old daughter. Natela is a housewife. Iashar’s son works in a local security service provider company. His daughter is a student. Iashar is a worker in the village. Along with his main job, Iashar is actively involved in the family agricultural business. In particular, the family owns 0.4 hectare land, where vegetables are grown. Also they have a milk cow. Natela produces cheese and sells it on the local market. Total average monthly income of the family is 1,100 GEL. 

Iashar requested credit for purchasing a milk cow. With two milk cows, Natela will be able to produce double the amount of cheese and increase the income of the family. They plan to reinvest their increase in income for further expansion and development of the family business.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Vijay

texts.en: Vijay is 30 years old man, married and the father of two children.  For the last eight years, he has earned a living by breeding cattle. After several attempts to find job, he gave up and decided to start his business. He buys calves when they are still small, then raises and fattens them for 5-6 months before reselling them in a local livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 1,000 AZN and his business is the only source of income for his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan because people use it in everyday dishes. Vijay wants to expand his business and improve his family's living conditions. He has applied for a loan for 1,500 AZN loan to buy two calves and a cow that will produce milk.

loans.use: to buy two calves and one cow for milking.

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en:
Shahin is a 50-year-old man, married with two children.  He has bred cows for the last 10 years. When he was close to pension age, he decided to start his business. With the help of his wife, they purchased their first cattle.
