Currently he need to purchase seeds and fertilizer for the spring planting season. With this goal in mind Akmal is requesting a loan of 5000 somoni and is asking for your help. He is hoping for your support and generosity.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Abdulaziz

texts.ru: Абдулазиз проживает в районе Джиликул. Ему 42 года. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Абдулазиз занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур для продажи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается более 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Abdulaziz lives in Jilikul. He is 42 years old, married and has five children. His wife is a home maker and Abdulaziz is a farmer. He has been farming for 20 years and is taking out this loan to purchase fertilizer for his crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Asliddin

texts.ru: Аслиддин добрый и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет четверых детей. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Он работает маcтером по строительству домов, с 1994 года он работает в этой сфере вместе с отцом, а теперь начиная с 2000 года он сам самостоятельно занимается строительством. Имеет все оборудование для стройки дома. Среди знакомых и близких имеет хорошую репутацию, и является хорошим мастером в своей сфере деятельности. Аслиддин хотел бы получить займ для покупки древесных спрессованных плит (ДСП) для  потолков и полов. Он также хочет установить окна в своем доме.
texts.en: Asliddin is a kind and hard working man. He is married and is raising four children. His wife is a home maker. Asliddin is a construction contractor who builds houses, he has started this business with his father in 1994. Since 2000 Asliddin has been managing the construction business by himself and he has all the necessary equipment to erect a house. Asliddin has a stellar reputation as a house builder among his acquaintances and relatives and is a great master of his trade. He wants to take out a loan to purchase MDF boards for floors and ceilings. He also wants to install new windows in his house.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es: Yessica  de 19 años  vive muy cerca al mar, lo que le da un aire de mujer caribe, tierna, alegre,  tropical, radiante y emprendedora. Cuando ella terminó su bachillerato y se le dificultó estudiar, empezó a buscar un empleo en varias empresas  y como no lo logró, decidió emprender su propia unidad de negocio en su natal Puerto Colombia  y  hoy quiere hacerla  crecer; ella es la propietaria de un café internet que comenzó con dos computadores  y gradualmente ha logrado con su disciplina de trabajo tener 5, porque tiene una clientela, que cada día crece un poco mas. Su principal desafío es lograr reunir el capital  de trabajo suficiente, para meterle el impulso que requiere el cumplir sus expectativas de crecimiento.  Su meta mas adelante es adecuar su infraestructura, para que en sus instalaciones los clientes esten cómodos  en su privacidad y no sientan el incesante calor del Caribe, al estar en sus instalaciones, lo cual logrará con la  adquisición de un aire acondicionado, cabinas individuales y poco a poco. Hoy está acudiendo a un credikiva,  primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque necesita,  poner en marcha su sueño, iniciando con repotenciar sus computadores, comprar repuestos para sus equipos, para emprender su gran propósito comercial, que en el futuro le permitirá, mejorar la calidad en el servicio, por eso que auguramos que  esta inversión logrará el éxito esperado, en tanto va paso a paso su crecimiento,pero con mucha disciplina.
texts.en:
Yessica, 19 years old, lives very near the sea, giving her the air of a Caribbean woman, youthful, happy, tropical, radiant and enterprising. After she completed high school, it was difficult to continue her studies so she began looking for employment in various enterprises.  When she couldn't find work, Yessica decided to start her own business in her native Puerto Colombia and, today, she wants to make the business grow. Yessica is the proprietor of an internet cafe which she began with 2 computers and gradually, with her work discipline, she now has 5, plus the necessary clientele. Each day her cafe grows a little more.

Yessica's main challenge is to put together sufficient working capital to provide the impulse required to fulfill her growth expectations. Her goal for the future is to have sufficient infrastructure so that her customers can be comfortable in their privacy and not feel the incessant Caribbean heat in her cafe, which can be achieved, little by little, with the acquisition of an air conditioner and individual cubicles.

Now Yessica is applying for a 'credikiva' (Kiva loan), her 1st financing through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. She needs this to put her dream into action, beginning by upgrading her computers and buying new components for her equipment. This will initiate Yessica's grand commercial proposition, allowing her to improve service quality in the future. We expect this investment to result in the expected success, as Yessica pursues growth step by step with much discipline.

loans.use: to upgrade her computers and buy new components for the equipment in her internet cafe.

loans.name: Pablo Dario

texts.es:
Pablo es un padre de 43 años, el cual tiene 4 pequeños por los que lucha día a día con el fin de sacarlos adelante y brindarles lo mejor, su esposa, que es ama de casa, siempre trata de apoyarlo y cuidarlo para que juntos puedan mejorar su calidad de vida. Pablo disfruta mucho ver televisión en sus tiempos libres y mucho más cuando lo hace con sus hijos. Como buen peruano, Pablo disfruta mucho de los platos típicos de nuestro país, el cuál es el conocidísimo  “Arroz con pollo”.

Pablo se dedica a alquiler de 2 taxis, los cuales pudo comprar con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación de su parte, lo que lo ha llevado a mejorar y crecer como micro-empresario. El nos comenta que alquila sus carros un promedio de 10 horas diarias lo que le permite generar los ingresos que necesita para sus necesidades personales diarias.

Con un poco de apoyo, Pablo podrá realizar el mantenimiento y refacción de los vehículos, lo que le permitirá tener operativos sus 2 vehículos, ya que tienen algunos desperfectos y desea solucionarlos antes de que estos empeoren. Con esta ayuda brindada, el podrá seguir alquilando sus vehículos y poco a poco ahorrar el dinero que necesita para comprar nuevos vehículos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pablo is a 43 year old father of four little ones who he strives for daily in order to move them forward and provide the best for them.  His wife, who is a housewife, always tries to support and care for him so that together they can improve their quality of life.  Pedro enjoys watching television in his free time very much and more so when he does it with his children.  Like all good Peruvians, he very much enjoys dishes typical of our country like the extremely well known “Arroz con Pollo.”  [Chicken with Rice]

Pablo leases out two taxis that he was able to buy with much effort and dedication on his part which has led him to improve and grow as a micro businessman.  He comments that he leases out his vehicles for about 10 hours daily on average which allows him to generate income needed for his daily personal needs.

With a little support, Pablo will service and replace parts of his vehicles which will allow him to keep his two vehicles in operating condition since they have come problems that need to be addressed before they worsen.  With this help provided he will be able to continue leasing out his vehicles and gradually save the money he needs to buy new vehicles and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to repair and service his vehicle.

loans.name: Uktam

texts.ru: Уктам женат и на воспитании имеет шестерых детей. Его семья очень большая, соответственно расходы на содержание семьи также большие. Для содержании семьи он занимается выращиванием картофеля, а также откормом и продажей скота. Эти бизнесы приносят ему хорошую прибыль, и покрывает его расходы. В  продвижении бизнеса помогают дети. Уктам хотел бы получить займ для покупки корма для скота. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Uktam is married and has six children. His family is a large one and subsequently the living expenses for such a family are large as well. To support his family Uktam grows potatoes for sale and also raises and sells cattle. The farming and cattle business yields a good profits and allows Uktam to provide for everyone. Uktam's children help out with the farm as well. Currently Uktam is requesting a loan to purchase feed for his cattle. He is hoping for your help and kindness.

loans.use: To buy feed for cattle

loans.name: Makhamajon

texts.ru: Махамачон активный и трудолюбивый юноша. Он добрый парень. С малых лет он вместе с отцом занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур. В основном он выращивает лук, а также имеет виноградный сад. Махамачон в зимний период в парнике сеет семена помидора, а затем саженцы продает на рынке весной. Махамачон запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Makhamajon is an active and hard working young man. He is a good fellow. Since his childhood he has been learning farming from his father. Currently Makhamajon grows onions for sale and also has a vineyard. In the winter he also grows tomato seedlings in greenhouses for sale at the market in the spring. Makhamajon is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and he hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Yesenia Catalina

texts.es: Yesenia, de 31 años de edad, habitante de la Ceiba comarca localizada en las afueras del departamento de León, se dedica a la crianza de cerdo y siembra de maíz. Esta muy agradecida por la ayuda recibida atravez del préstamo Kiva utilizo el financiamiento para comprar cerdos de raza y reproducción con el objetivo de producir cerdos de calidad y buen peso, le ha ido muy bien tanto asi que ha logrado cancelar su credito antes de tiempo. Ahora está solicitando nuevamente este  préstamo comprar más cerdos de raza para producción, pues una de sus metas es tener una granja de cerdos reproductores de buen peso y tamaño. Siempre tiene como planes construir una galera para tener en mejores condiciones a sus animales.
texts.en:
Yesenia, 31, lives in La Ceiba, a region located on the outskirts of the department of León.  She works raising pigs and growing corn.  She is very grateful for the help received through the Kiva loan.  She used the financing to buy breeding and reproducing pigs, with the goal of producing pigs of quality and good weight.  It has gone very well for her, so much so that she managed to repay her loan before the deadline.

Now she is requesting this loan again to buy more breeding pigs for producing because one of her goals is to have a farm of reproducing pigs of good weight and size.

She always has plans to build a pen to have better conditions for her animals.

loans.use: to buy more breeding pigs.

loans.name: Noibkhuja

texts.ru: Ноибхуча женат и ответственный отец троих детей. Он очень трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек. Более 10 лет он занимается выращиванием картофеля, а также скотоводством. Отходы от выращивания сельхозкультур идут на корм скота. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес, чтобы получить желаемую прибыль. Ноибхуча хотел бы получить займ для покупки скота и корма для них. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Noibkhuja is married and has responsibility for three children. He is a very hard-working and conscientious person. For over 10 years, he has been growing potatoes and also raising livestock. He uses  crop waste as animal feed. He would like to expand his business in order to achieve his target revenues. Noibkhuja would like to obtain a loan to buy cattle and feed. He hopes for your kind help.

loans.use: to buy cattle and feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Rosaura Dionicia

texts.es:
La señora Rosaura tiene 46 años de edad y vive en una casa en anticrético vivienda que está ubicada en el barrio la terminal de la ciudad de Tarija. La señora Rosaura es madre soltera y tiene un hijo a quien cuida y ayuda en su educación,  desde hace varios años que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas. Ahora ella tiene que trabajar para poder salir adelante junto con su hijo. desde hace más de 6 años que se dedica a esa actividad siendo una persona muy conocida por sus clientes que consumen sus alimentos, la señora Rosaura quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante, pero ella nos cuenta que tiene la necesidad de comprar mesas y sillas para su restaurante ya que las que tiene son prestados. De esa forma poder  tener sus propios muebles, como ella ya tiene experiencia en el rubro el crédito será destinado para la compra de dichos muebles. Material que es necesario para la atención de sus clientes.
                                                                                                                La señora Rosaura nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para la compra de  una cocina que mucha falta le hace.
texts.en:
Rosaura is 46 years old and lives in a house in an "anticrético" arrangement [paying a fixed sum instead of monthly rent].  Her home is located in the neighborhood of the bus terminal in the city of Tarija.

Rosaura is a single mother and has one child whom she cares for and helps in his studies.  For several years she has worked in food preparation and sales.  Now she has to work to be able to get ahead with her child.  She has done this work for more than six years, being a person who is well known among her customers who eat her dishes.

Rosaura wants to have better income to get ahead, but she tells us that she needs to buy tables and chairs for her restaurant because the ones she has are borrowed.  In this way she will be able to have her own furniture.  As she already has experience in the area, the loan will be used to buy that furniture, equipment that is necessary for her to serve her customers.

Rosaura tells us that she wants to improve her standard of living.  This is why, she says, the next loan she requests will be to buy a stove that she needs very much.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Alvaro David

texts.es:
Alvaro tiene 27 años de edad, vive en la linda ciudad de Imperial, la cual es conocida por su clima cálido, por su agricultura y sobre todo porque sus pobladores irradian de generosidad.  Alvaro es muy optimista,  debido a los pocos recursos de sus padres ya no pudo culminar la carrera de ingeniería, a pesar de esos contratiempos él supo idearse la manera de trabajar para surgir, empezó trabajando en el campo, en especial el cultivo de maíz, logro ahorrar y pudo comprar una combi en la cual está trabajando actualmente, el es muy carismático y los clientes siempre se sienten a gusto cuando toman sus servicios, por ello el cree que le va bien en su negocio.

Alvaro está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo y compra algunos repuestos, lo que permitirá que su vehículo este en buenas condiciones para el transporte de los clientes y podrá tener mayor seguridad, así seguirá trabajando cada día para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Comprar otra combi y tener una empresa de transporte, para que sus padres se sientan orgullosos.
texts.en:
Alvaro is 27 years old, and he lives in the beautiful town of Imperial, famous for its warm climate, its agriculture and above all because of the generosity that characterizes its inhabitants. Alvaro is a very optimistic person. Owing to his parents’ poor economic resources, he could not finish his engineering studies, but notwithstanding this setback he succeeded in coming up with a business idea to get ahead: he became a farmer, growing maize in particular, he succeeded in saving some money and was able to buy a minibus, the same he is actually working with. Being a charismatic man, his customers always feel at ease when using his services, and for this reason his activity is going very well.

Alvaro is deeply grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their support he will be able to pay for general maintenance works on his vehicle and to buy some spare parts. This will provide his vehicle with the necessary good conditions to transport his customers, and being able to offer better security he will keep on working to make his dream come true: to buy another minibus and to run a transportation company, so that his parents will be proud of him.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance works on his vehicle and to buy some spare parts.

loans.name: Juan Cesar

texts.es: El señor Juan Cesar tiene 29 años es soltero actualmente vive con sus padres, es profesor de música trabaja en una Unidad Educativa en la comunidad de Colomi de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  ayuda económicamente a sus hermanos menores en los gastos de sus estudios, son 4 hermanos, 1 de ellos estudian en nivel secundaria y 3 en la Universidad, Juan  Cesar después de pasar clases en la escuela, por las tardes realiza la actividad agrícola juntamente con sus hermanos menores produce papa, haba, oca en su terreno de sus padres que tienen 2 hectáreas en la comunidad de  Rosario. Colomi está a 50 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba por lo tanto para ellos es muy difícil acudir a los Bancos para un préstamo de dinero; se tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona rural, Juan Cesar nos comenta necesita dinero para compra de insumos agrícolas para ampliar su producción agrícola y así tener dinero suficiente y ahorrar para los gastos de los  estudios de sus hermanos, Juan Cesar es una persona joven muy emprendedor, colaborador, y desea  ayudar a sus hermanos hasta que salgan profesionales.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Cesar is 29 years old, single, and currently lives with his parents.  He is a music teacher at a school in the community of Colomi in the city of Cochabamba.  Juan Cesar helps his younger siblings financially with their education expenses.  He has four brothers, one in high school and three attending university.  After teaching classes at the school, Juan Cesar spends his afternoons farming with his younger brothers.  They produce potatoes, beans, and "oca" (a root vegetable grown in the Andes) on two hectares of land owned by their parents in the community of Rosario.

Colomi is located 50 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.  For this reason, it is very difficult to access loans from banks.  CIDRE took the initiative to come to this rural area.  Juan Cesar says that he needs money to buy farming supplies so that he can increase production, earn sufficient income, and save for the educational expenses of his brothers.

Juan Cesar is an enterprising and cooperative young person who wants to help his siblings become professionals.

loans.use: to buy organic compost.

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es:
El señor Apolinar tiene 43 años de edad conviviente más de 23 años con su concubina,  tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo  2 hijos son dependientes que estudian, radican en Colomi comunidad Pucara a km 45 de la ciudad de Cochabamba, son agricultores con nivel de instrucción hasta la primaria.
El señor Apolinar y su esposa nos cuentan que su otro hijo falleció el año pasado por lo cual donde tuvieron muchos gastos , por lo tanto  vinieron a solicitar un nuevo préstamo para compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza) y semilla de papa aprovechando el precio bajo por la época ya que sus cultivos no están todavía como para cosechar; el señor Apolinar tuvo esta oportunidad de seguir beneficiándose con  un nuevo préstamo  para la  comprar de dichos insumos agrícolas, ahora se siente muy feliz ya que para él no ha sido fácil acudir a otras entidades Bancarias por que les pidieron muchos requisitos.                                                                                                                                                    Por último el señor Apolinar nos cuenta seguirá apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios y desea  que tengan un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Sr. Apolinar is 43 years old and has been in a common-law relationship with Sra. Severina for more than 23 years.  He has four children, but only two of them are dependents who are in school.  They live in the community of Pucara, which is in Colomi and located 45 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.  He and his family are farmers who have received an elementary school education.  

Sr. Apolinar and his wife said that they had another child who died last year, which is why they have had many expenses.  For this reason, they requested a new loan to buy organic compost (poultry manure) and potato seedlings in order to take advantage of the low seasonal prices.  They also want to buy these supplies while their current crop has yet to be harvested.  

CIDRE operates in this area by providing loans.  Sr. Apolinar has taken the opportunity to continue receiving benefits by utilizing a new loan for buying farming supplies.  He is now very pleased since he did not have an easy time accessing loans from other financial institutions that asked for too many requirements.  Most importantly, Sr. Apolinar says he continues to support his children's studies because he wants them to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings and organic compost.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bread.

loans.name: Sulma Marina

texts.es:
Sulma de 40 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos con edades de 8, 16, 20 y 23 años de edad, vive en una aldea de Morazán, Yoro.

Hace 6 años que doña Sulma estableció su propio negocio de una pulpería donde vende productos como ser: azúcar, arroz, sal, huevos, refrescos, frijoles, dulces etc.de este negocio que inicio con propios esfuerzos, obtiene ingresos que le permiten cubrir gastos de alimentación y educación a sus hijos.
Ha recibido apoyo de ODEF mediante préstamos donde ha podido mantener surtido el negocio y tener una mejor estabilidad económica familiar. Actualmente está solicitando el quinto préstamo para surtir más de productos alimenticios como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, refrescos, pan, dulce, leche, etc.
La meta que tiene es primero darle la educación necesaria a sus hijos, y ampliar el local del negocio.
texts.en:
Sulma, aged 40, is married and has four children aged 8, 16, 20 and 23.  She lives in a village in Morazán, in Yoro.

Six years ago Sulma established her own convenience store business, where she sells products such as sugar, rice, salt, eggs, sodas, beans, sweets, etc.  This business that she started through her own efforts earns her income that allows her to cover her expenses for food and education for her children.

She has received support from ODEF through loans, which have allowed her to keep her business stocked and have better financial stability for her family.

She is currently requesting her fifth loan to stock up on more food products, such as rice, sugar, beans, sodas, bread, sweets, milk, etc.

Her primary goal is to provide her children with the necessary education, and to expand her business premises.

loans.use: to stock up her convenience store business with more food products, such as sugar, rice, beans, sodas, salt, bread, sweets, milk, and other things.

loans.name: Santa Ines Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina  “Santa Inés” están en el  Segundo  Ciclo  con  18  integrantes , es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable entre ellas y realizan labores de trabajos en equipos , las mismas tienen un gran espíritu emprendedor y luchador.
Antonia es una de las integrantes, es la presidenta del grupo y nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de ropas desde hace ya un tiempo. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, como ser remeras, camperas, pantalones y demás. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la ayuda que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank called Santa Inés is in its second cycle.  With 18 members, it is a group that stands out in the neighborhood for being very close, supportive, and responsible among themselves and for working in teams.  They have a great enterprising and fighting spirit.

Antonia is one of the members.  She is the president of the group and she tells us that she has worked selling clothing for some time.  Her objective is to be able to continue working to continue helping her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy all types of garments, such as t-shirts, jackets, pants, and others.

She is grateful to the Fundación and to Kiva for the help she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy garments to sell.

loans.name: Vilma Esperanza

texts.es:
Vilma, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque quiere realizar la compra de billetes de lotería, comprara dos series para salir a ofrecer a la clientela, esto le ayudara para que su negocio no decaiga.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo para mejora el negocio, que sus ventas fueron buenas y aumento los clientes demandantes de lotería.
texts.en:
Vilma is asking for a new loan because she wants to buy lottery tickets.  She buys two series and sells them to her customers.  This will help prevent her business from failing.

She believes that her previous loan helped her improve her business.  Her sales were good and her number of customers who wanted lottery tickets increased.

loans.use: to buy lottery tickes for resale.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida, se dedica a la venta de fruta al por mayor, lo que mas le gusta es el ahorro y los préstamos que ha recibido para su negocio, ella entró a Finca Perú con mucho miedo porque nunca había sacado préstamo antes, pero se dio cuenta que todo lo que hacían solo era para su propio beneficio, es por ello que hasta ahora no se retira, gracias a Finca Perú ella se pudo comprar su terreno. Ahora el préstamo lo destinara para la compra de fruta por mayor.
texts.en: Dolores is a member of the communal bank, "Nueva Vida," [New Life] and makes a living by selling fruit wholesale.  What she likes the most is saving and the loans that she has received for her business.  She came to Finca Peru with a lot of fear because she had never taken out a loan before.  But she noticed that everything they did was for her own benefit, and that is why she has not left them.  Thanks to Finca Peru, she could buy her land.  She will use this loan to buy fruit wholesale.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits wholesale.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a 27-year-old married woman. She has three children, two of whom are enrolled in school. Her husband Bakari works as a carpenter. Mwanaisha operates a business selling fruit from home. She's worked in this business for three years and was previously employed as a grocer. Her primary customers are from the neighborhood. Mwanaisha's other sources of income include earnings from her husband. 

Mwanaisha describes price fluctuations as her greatest business challenge, and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mwanaisha will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy 2,000 coconuts. Mwanaisha aspires to be a shareholder in some organization in the future. She joined Yehu because it has good policies.

loans.use: to buy coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Kounandia Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kounandia, sont toutes des femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 41 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de N’Tjifina, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce des ustensiles en plastique, de l’arachide et de gâteaux.                                                                                                                         
Les femmes du groupe Kounandia sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente OUMOU SOUMAÏLA, première personne à partir de la droite, compte acheter un sac d’arachide avec les revendeurs de Nangola pour ensuite les vendre sur place au village à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 5 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce d’arachide.
texts.en:
The women of the group Kounandia are all married, and they average 41 years of age and three children each, all living in traditional extended families in the village of N’Tjifina, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in plastic utensils, peanuts, and cakes.

The members of the group Kounandia are on their third solidarity loan. 

This client, OUMOU SOUMAÏLA, the first person from the right in the photo, intends to buy a sack of peanuts from retailers of Nangola and then sell them locally in the village to a customer base composed of men and women. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 5,000 francs CFA that will be put toward the needs of the family. Part of it will be reinvested in her peanuts business.

loans.use: to buy peanuts

loans.name: Juan Leonidas

texts.es:
Juan, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de hamacas, como el hilo, manquillos, agujas, todo lo necesario y que le ayude a mejorar su producción.
Él considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a mejorar la vivienda para que su familia este en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Juan is applying for a new loan to buy the materials used for making hammocks, such as, thread, rings, needles - everything he needs to help improve his production. 
He believes that his previous loan has helped him to improve his family home so that his family live in better conditions.

loans.use: To buy threads, rings and needles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides and to rent land.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 39-year-old married man. He has three children, all of whom are enrolled in school. His wife's name is Ramla. Ali operates a bodaboda (motor bike) and also sells coconuts at the market. He's worked in this business for three years. His primary customers come from the community. 

Ali describes price fluctuations as his greatest business challenge, and his highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Ali will use the 20,000 KES  loan to boost his coconut selling business by purchasing 500 coconuts for sale. Ali aspires to be a dealer in the future. He joined Yehu for their good services.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is 26 years old and lives in the town of Bugokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past eight years, Denis has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells drinks made from local brew. 

To help expand his business, Denis has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more brewing materials. This will help Denis to generate greater profits and acquire more capital for his business. Denis hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Denis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Denis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more brewing materials.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 57 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 4 hijos de 20, 18, 14 y 12 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes.
Don Pedro se dedica hace 4 años a la agricultura al cultivo de plátano. El tiene una finca que le fue heredada de su padre. Don Pedro aparte de la agricultura tiene otro negocio de cría y venta de ovejos .El préstamo que solicita a ODEF de 10, 000 lempiras es para comprar un lote de ovejos para criarlos y después venderlos. El manifiesta que el precio de estos animales es muy bueno lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos.
Su meta es seguir aumentado sus ingresos y trabajar lo propio como hasta ahora lo ha hecho.
texts.en:
Pedro, age 57, is married and has four children, ages 20, 18, 14, and 12.  He lives in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes.

Pedro has been growing bananas for four years.  He has a farm that he inherited from his father.   Besides the agriculture he has another business of raising and selling sheep.

The loan he is requesting from ODEF for 10,000 lempiras is to buy some sheep to raise and later sell.  He says that the price for these animals is very good.  This will allow him to increase his income.

His goal is to continue increasing his income and to continue working in the same way that he has heretofore done.

loans.use: to buy some sheep to sell.

loans.name: Estebana

texts.es:
Estebana, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de alimento para los cerdos y arreglar el corral, su compra será en concentrado, lamina y madera, esto le ayudara para mantener bien su negocio.
El efecto que tuvo de su préstamo anterior fue positivo, porque logro comprar materiales para realizar la milpa, ya que esto le ayuda para tener ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
Estebana is applying for a new loan to buy pig feed and to repair her pig pen. She will purchase concentrate feed, metal sheeting and wood which will help her to keep her business well maintained.
Her previous loan turned out positively because she managed to buy the materials needed to carry out her milpa-style farming, and this helped her to earn more for her family.

loans.use: To buy concentrate feed, metal sheeting and wood.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 40 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Arua region of Uganda. She is married and has six children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, Florence has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which sells chickens. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chickens for resale, which will help Florence to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business more. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy chickens for sale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, a 34-year-old business woman, lives in Juba where she is the married mother of four children between the ages of 13 and 2. Three of them go to school. Her major challenges include limited income and home expenses.

Rose has operated a food store for seven years, and has one employee. Having learned about Finance Sudan through clients and outreach and promotion by the loan officers, she is requesting a loan of 4000 SDG to purchase more eggs, tomatoes, onions, green peppers, etc. Within the next five years she hopes to expand her business and build a house for the family.

Rose says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support and wishes God's blessing upon the company.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs, tomatoes, onions, green peppers, etc.

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar is 57 years old. He lives in Keda District, in mountainous Adjara, with his wife, Izolda. Nodar and Izolda earn a living through agricultural business. Their family agricultural business is their only source of the income. In particular, the family owns 0.9 hectare land, where fruits and vegetables are grown. Nodar sells harvested fruits and vegetables to local greengrocery retailers. Along with the aforementioned, the family has a vineyard. Nodar produces wine and sells it in the village. The family also has a milk cow. They sell milk in the village. The family's total average monthly income is 400 Laris. 

Nodar requested a loan to purchase saplings of wine-trees. He will plant additional wine-trees. After three years the family will get more harvest of grapes and Nodar will be able to increase production and sales of wine. It will increase the family's income. Increased income will allow Nodar and Izolda to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase saplings of wine-trees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock for her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to lease land.

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es:
María, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, pues considera que con su ayuda irá creciendo en la producción de las tortillas, comprara maíz, gas, cal, leña, que son los materiales para mantener todo listo para elaborar las tortillas.
El préstamo anterior le permitió comprar los materiales para mantenerse en el negocio, cambiando sus ventas, porque son más favorables y le generan más ingresos.
texts.en:
María has decided to apply for a new loan. She plans to use the support from the loan to increase her production of tortillas, and to purchase corn, gas, lime and firewood. These materials will allow her to have everything ready to make tortillas.

Her previous loan helped her to purchase materials for keeping up her business and allowed her to increase her sales to help her generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase corn, gas, lime and firewood.

loans.name: Joseline Patricia

texts.es:
Joseline, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque considera que de estos préstamos ha logrado superar su situación con el negocio, comprándose un pedido de lociones, cosméticos, para la venta, surtiendo de nuevos productos.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo para mejorar el negocio, aumentándole las ganancias, con las que ha podido continuar estudiando en la universidad.
texts.en:
Joseline is applying for a new loan because she believes that these loans have helped her to overcome her situation with her business, by purchasing lotions and cosmetics and suppling new products.
The previous loan helped her to improve her business and increase her earnings, which has allowed her to continue studying at university.

loans.use: To buy lotions and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Bolingo 2 (#1) Group

texts.en:
Godefroid, age 39, is married with four children. His youngest child is two years old and his oldest is 18 years old. He has a business selling phone cards. Cell phone contracts are rare in Congo. Most people buy their phone from a local provider, and then purchase minutes to put on their phone as needed. A phone is "recharged" with minutes by buying a phone card from a vendor and typing the code into the phone. Godefroid will use the loan to buy more phones cards from the local cell phone providers. He has had this successful business for five years. His strategy is to sell his cards in busy, crowded, and high traffic areas.

Godefroid has received three previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. He has a very good repayment record. He would like to build a permanent shop for his business one day. He uses the profits from his business to keep his children in school. He hopes they will continue in their education and become successful adults.

loans.use: to buy additional phone cards to sell.

loans.name: Bolingo 2 (#3) Group

texts.en:
Gabin, age 34, is single and has a two-year-old son. He sells phones cards in and around Brazzaville. Phone contracts are rarely used in Congo. Most people buy a phone from a local supplier and buy phones cards to put minutes on their phone. The phone cards are sold by vendors around the city. Gabin has been a phone card vendor for seven years. He will buy more phones cards with the loan. He is very grateful for the loans because they allow him to buy many phone cards at one time which lowers the price per card.

Gabin has received one previous loan from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. He maintains a good repayment record. Gabin would like to build a large shop to sell his phone cards in. He hopes his son will learn the phone card business and run it someday.

loans.use: to pay for phones cards to sell.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en: Maurice is a married man. He has five children with ages ranging from three years to eight years old. He describes himself as determined and ambitious. He operates a retail service shop where he provides motor vehicle repair. He has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs two staff members. His business is located within a busy and conducive business environment and his primary customers are drivers and motor vehicle owners. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of spare parts. He will use the loan of KES 20,000 to purchase spare parts. His business goal is to own a car that will provide transportation services to customers in his town.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motor vehicles.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.en:
Guillermina is one of our associates from the Hato Mayor branch, located in a rural town whose economy depends on agriculture. Guillermina makes homemade pastries using local ingredients like coconut, peanuts, and milk. She makes soft, cake-like coconut cookies called Coconetes, which are one of the most popular homemade cookies in the Dominican Republic. Guillermina also mixes fruits, such as pineapple, into some of her recipes. She will uses this loan to buy ingredients for her pastries, like coconut, flour, sugar, cinnamon, butter, and fruit.

Guillermina lives with her long term partner in one of the rural neighborhoods of Hato Mayor. She tells us that, for her, the most difficult challenge has been to take her business to the next level. She has been running her business for over 13 years, and she is receiving her 13th loan. Guillermina is very proud of how her business has been growing during these years because of the loan investments. In the future, she hopes to have a factory to produce more pastries. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Sara De Jesus

texts.es:
Sara, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de productos para fortalecer el negocio, comprando aceite, embutidos, maíz, frijoles, queso, ya que desea mantener todo lo más necesario y así mantener la preferencia de los clientes.
La condición económica de Sara ha cambiado, pues con el préstamo anterior logro que sus ganancias fueran mejor, viviendo en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Sara is requesting a new loan in order to purchase and stock necessary items for her business. She plans to purchase oil, sausages, corn, beans and cheese, so that she can offer greater variety to her customers.

Sara’s financial condition has changed, and as a result of her previous loan she was able to increase her earnings and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase oil, sausage, corn, beans and cheese.

loans.name: Jose Adan

texts.es:
José, necesita un nuevo préstamo para fortalecer el negocio, pues quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, jabón, detergentes, para surtir el negocio, ya que así sus clientes encuentran lo que necesitan en sus hogares.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo para invertir en el negocio, con el cual ha generado mejores ventas, y ganancias, apoyando de una mejor manera su familia.
texts.en:
José needs a new loan to strengthen his business. He wants to purchase rice, sugar, soap and detergents to stock his store and to offer greater variety for his customers.

His previous loan helped him invest in his store and increase his sales and earnings, which in turn allowed him to better support his family.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, soap and detergents.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para invertirlo en la compra de materiales para el cultivo, pagando el arrendamiento del terreno y comprando insumos como el abono y los herbicidas.
Ella espera que con este préstamo pueda realizarse un buen cultivo, que su producción se abundante, así como pudo realizar su trabajo anterior con la ayuda de un préstamo.
texts.en:
María is requesting this new loan to buy farming supplies, pay rent for some land, and buy supplies such as fertilizer and insecticide.

She expects to be able to have a good crop and bounty with the help of this loan, just as she was able to do a good job with the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies and rent some land.

loans.name: Talahatou

texts.fr:
Talahatou est une femme âgé(e) de 41ans. Elle 02 enfants qui ne vont plus à l’école. L’ainé a 24ans et le dernier a 21ans.
Talahatou travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes, des savons et des bazins depuis 2000. Elle vend des pagnes, des bazins à toutes personnes de façon ambulante. Sa difficulté principale est la concurrence sur le terrain.
Talahatou a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des savons, des pagnes, des bazins.
Dans les prochaines années, Talahatou voudrait réinvestir dans l’activité, l’agrandir plus et avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Talahatou is a 41-year-old woman with two children, who no longer go to school. The elder is 24 years old, and the younger is 21. Talahatou has been working as a retailer of <i>pagnes<i/> [the colorful cloth of western Africa], soaps, and damask fabrics since 2000. Going door to door, she sells <i>pagne<i/> and damask cloths to anyone. Her main difficulty is the actualities of competition. 

Talahatou has requested her second loan from WAGES for buying soaps, <i>pagnes<i/>, and damasks. In the next few years, Talahatou would like to reinvest in her business, to expand it further, and to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy traditional cloth, damask fabrics, and soaps

loans.name: La Fe 5, 6, 7 & 8 Group

texts.en:
Clemencia is a member of the group called La Fe "Faith" 5, 6, 7 & 8. This group is located in the city of Samana, in a rural community surrounded by mountains and the Atlantic Ocean. These twenty entrepreneurs are running their businesses in their community or in other communities nearby.

Clemencia makes her home here in a simple house with her long-term partner and their three children. She is selling clothes, but she wants to use this loan in order to buy more shirts, blouses, jeans and many other different pieces to sell. In the future she wants to continue working in order to overcome the difficulties in her life.  By working hard in her business and after eleven loans, it has been possible to grow her business and expand her clientele. Clemencia told us that she is working hard because she wants to have a successful business and to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell on.

loans.name: Saniya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Saniya, sont toutes des femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 31 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de N’Tjifina, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de beurre de karité, des produits cosmétique et du poisson.                                                                                                                         
Les femmes du groupe Saniya sont à leur premier prêt 
La cliente MAH, deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter 20 kilos de beurre de karité avec les revendeurs du village pour ensuite les vendre sur place au village et au marché de Nangola à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 5 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de beurre de karité.
texts.en:
The women of the group Saniya are all married, and they average 31 years of age and two children each, all living in traditional extended families in the village of N’Tjifina, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in shea butter, cosmetics, and fish. 

The members of the group Kounandia are on their first loan. 

This client, MAH, the second person standing from the right in the photo, intends to buy 20 kg of shea butter from village retailers and then sell it locally in the village and at the Nangola market to a customer base composed of men and women. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 5,000 francs CFA that will be used toward the needs of the family. Part of it will be reinvested in her shea butter business.

loans.use: to buy shea butter

loans.name: Nozim

texts.ru: Нозим добрый и трудолюбивый семьянин, который на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Более 10 лет он занимается выращиванием картофеля и пшеницы. Кроме того дополнительно занимается откормом и продажей скота. Отходы от выращивания сельхозкультур идут на корм скота. Нозим хотел бы получить займ для покупки минеральных удобрений. На полученную прибыль он намерен купить крупный рогатый скот с целью расширения своего бизнеса. Нозим надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Nozim is a kind and hardworking family man, who has two children.  He has been involved in growing potatoes and wheat for over ten years.  Besides this, he is also involved in fattening up and selling livestock.  The leftovers from growing agricultural crops are used as livestock feed.  Nozim wants to obtain this loan to buy mineral fertilizers.  He intends to use the resulting profit to buy cattle in order to expand his business.  Nozim relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Amor Y Amistad 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Paula is the coordinator of this group called Amor y Amistad 2, 3 & 4 (Love and Friendship). The area in which the borrowers live is a nascent tourist zone, surrounded by the Atlantic ocean and mountains, rivers and natural breezes. She is a married mother who lives in the beautiful town of Samana with her three children. Paula says her most important challenge is to keep her business stable and sustainable. She enjoys working and serving the needs of her family and friends.

Paula is receiving her 10th loan with Esperanza Internacional, having repaid all her previous loans, and after five-and-a-half years of investments, her business has been growing to the point where she is selling a greater range of products and acquiring more clients and communities. She will use this loan to purchase clothing such as pants, skirts, blouses, shirts, and shoes for both women and men. Paula will reinvest her profits in her business, and is also planning to add other high-demand products for Mother's Day gifts.

Thanks for supporting this group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for her business.

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is 40 years old. He lives in Gurjaani District with his family: wife – Ekaterina, two children (12 and 10 years old) and his elder sister. His children go to school. The family earns a living through agricultural business. They have a peach garden with a total area of 1.5 hectares. Gela sells his harvested peaches on the local market to fruit and vegetable retailers. As well the aforementioned fruit, the family has 100 sheep. Gela sells lambs in spring, as well as sheep cheese throughout the whole year. Gela and Ekaterina work hard in their garden, as well as on their sheep farm throughout the year. The total average monthly income for the family is 700 Laris.

Gela requested credit for purchasing drugs to treat his peach trees against parasites. After properly completing the seasonal works Gela will receive a quality harvest and sell his produce for a good price. The family will get a planned income and use it to finance the family's daily expenses during the year.

loans.use: to purchase drugs for treating his plants against parasites.

loans.name: Ganhuyag

texts.en:
Ganhuyag is a 46-year-old man who lives with his wife and two children in Arhangai province in Central Mongolia. He started his shoe repairing business in 2006 with his wife. They both have been running the business successfully. The local people have already found their business reliable and good quality. They run the business inside their fence and they plan to expand the business activity by building a new workplace and buying some necessary modern equipment. 

Ganhuyag is a hardworking man who says that "I would like to expand the business activity by having a new workplace for the shoe repairs and the equipment and machineries". The total amount he is requesting is 3,500,000 MNT to build the workplace and buy the shoe repairing equipment.

loans.use: to build a workplace and buy shoe repairing equipment.

loans.name: Wendy Arely

texts.es:
Wendy, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, porque quiere invertir en el negocio, comprándose tres cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos, este dinero le ayudara para aumentar la granja y tener el alimento necesario para sus cerdos.
Ella tuvo en efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, ya que compro cerdos para el negocio, pues la dinámica es comprarlos, engordarlos y ofrecerlos a la venta, dándole los recursos económicos para cancelar el préstamo y para el sustento del hogar, en su familia se mantienen los integrantes y gozan de buena salud.
texts.en:
Wendy has decided to apply for a new loan, because she wants to invest in her business and purchase three pigs and feed. This support will allow her to expand her farm and have the food necessary for her pigs.

She was successful with her previous loan, which also allowed her to purchase pigs for her business. Her business plan is to purchase pigs, feed them and fatten them up, and then to eventually sell them. The money from these sales gives her the economic resources to pay back the loan and provide for the needs of her home and family. The members of her family are well and in good health.

loans.use: to purchase three pigs and feed.

loans.name: Wilbert Alberto

texts.es:
Wilbert, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, pues quiere comprar los materiales necesarios para realizar la siembra de chile, pues adquiere 1000 plantas y el abono y herbicidas, que son lo que le ayudan a desarrollarse.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a que su cosecha de maiz y frijol fuera buena, ya que su familia depende de su trabajo para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Wilbert is requesting a new loan in order to purchase the necessary materials for planting chile plants. He plans to purchase 1000 plants, along with the fertilizer and herbicides to aid in the cultivation process.

The previous loan helped him to have a good harvest of corn and beans. His family depends on his work to survive and get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase 1000 chile plants, fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Tumenjargal

texts.en:
Tumenjargal is a 42-year-old woman who lives with her husband and son in Dornogobi province in Southern Mongolia. Her son goes to the kindergarden. She has been running a food retail business since 1996. She started trading dairy products but now she has two shop counters at the local trade center. At the second shop counter, she started selling CDs, DVDs with some cellphone and computer accessories. She found out that this would be the profitable business to start. Both business have been successful and her husband works at the CD counter. 

Tumenjargal is a good-natured woman who says that "I would like to expand the business by buying supplies for the second shop counter. I would like to start saving for my son and improve the household". The total amount she is requesting is 2,800,000 MNT to buy the computer and cellphone accessories.

loans.use: to buy computer and cellphone accessories.

loans.name: Azjargal

texts.en:
Azjargal is a 26-year-old man who lives with his wife and son in Hovd province in Western Mongolia. He started taxi service business 2 years ago with his small van. He has been improving the household little by little. Recently, he started milk retail and delivers the milk to the local kindergardens. The income is normal and enough for the family members. But his van has broken down due to the bad roads and needs to be repaired. He wants to continue the business activity in order to keep the food at home because the milk business does not provide a sufficient amount income for three of them. 

Azjargal is an ambitious man who says that "I would like to expand the business activity by buying the necessary spare parts for my van. Once I could afford the spare parts, I can fix the van on my own. I really want to continue the taxi service business to improve the household". The total amount he is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to buy spare parts for his van.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his van.

loans.name: Gulbubu

texts.ru:
Гулбубу 56 лет, замужем,  воспитала 4 детей.   В поисках дохода для своей семьи, в 1988 году Гулбубу начала свой бизнес в животноводстве, стартовав с  суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному и настойчивому труду Гулбубу, ее поголовье в хозяйстве на сегодня насчитывает 4 дойные коровы, 2 лошади и 25 овец, что приносит  около 10,000 сом (KGS) ежемесячной прибыли с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота на откорм и перепродажу. Доходы от кредита Гулбубу планирует вложить в увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en: Gulbubu is 56 years old, married and raised four children.  In search of a source of income for her family, she started her own business in animal husbandry in 1988 with an initial sum of 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Gulbubu's hard and persistent work, today her livestock headcount includes four dairy cows, two horses and twenty-five sheep, and yields about 10,000 som (KGS) in monthly profit from sales of milk and milk products.  In order to further develop her business, Gulbubu requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock for fattening up and resale.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Suhbat

texts.en:
Suhbat is a 60-year-old man who lives with his son in Arhangai province in Central Mongolia. He has been producing ovens, furnaces and some metal equipment since 1992. He has been increasing his income and at the same time improving the household. Since his wife died, he received all the responsibilities of taking care of his son and the business. Now his son has grown up and helps him in the business. He has been a good father and a talented man who is experienced in his field. 

Suhbat is a hardworking and good man who says that ""I would like to expand the business activities by purchasing the oven materials from the other province at wholesale and produce them in large numbers. I would like to save for my son's future"". The total amount he is requesting is 500,000 MNT to buy the necessary materials to make ovens and other equipment.

loans.use: to buy the necessary materials to make ovens.

loans.name: Alma Jeannette

texts.es:
Alma, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, porque quiere comprarse productos para el negocio, como plátanos verdes, aceite, también quiere comprar ropa nueva (blusas, faldas, camisetas) para salir a vender de forma ambulante, esto le ayudara a generar más ingresos.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a incrementar su mercadería, sus ingresos en las ventas, esto le da la oportunidad de ayudar a sus hijos en la educación.
texts.en:
Alma has decided to apply for a new loan because she wants to purchase products for her business, such as green bananas and oil. She also wants to purchase new clothing (blouses, skirts, t-shirts) so that she can sell it in street markets. These activities will help her generate more income.

She is grateful that the previous loan allowed her to increase the merchandise she offers her customers, leading to an increase in her sales and income. She works to provide her children the opportunity to get an education.

loans.use: to purchase green bananas and clothing such as blouses, skirts and t-shirts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a compressor and tubes of tires.

loans.name: Bobojon

texts.ru: Бобочон добрый и целеустремленный человек, который женат и на воспитании имеет четверых детей. Более 10 лет он занимается выращиванием картофеля и пшеницы. Ему нравится работать на земле и с удовольствием занимается этим бизнесом и его земля дает ему хорошие плоды. Бобочон также занимается скотоводством. Он держит скот за счет отходов от выращенных культур. Он хотел бы получить займ для покупки минеральных удобрений для обработки земли. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Bobojon is a kind and goal-oriented person, who is married and has four children.  He has been involved in growing potatoes and wheat for over ten years.  He likes to work on the land and runs this business with satisfaction, and his land provides him with good harvests.  Bobojon is also involved in animal husbandry.  He keeps livestock due to the leftovers from the grown crops.  He wants to obtain this loan to buy mineral fertilizers for treating the soil.  Bobojon relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Mirzosadilo

texts.ru: Мирзосадило женат и на воспитании имеет четверых детей. Более 15 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. Его трудолюбие помогает ему развивать свой бизнес и шаг за шагом продвигается вперед успешно. В основном Мирзосадило выращивает картофель и занимается купле- продажей скота. В бизнесе помогают дети. Мирзосадило запрашивает займ для покупки корма для скота. Он надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Mirzosadilo is married and has four children.  He has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over 15 years.  His love of hard work helps him to develop his business and successfully move forward step-by-step.  Mirzosadilo primarily grows potatoes and is involved in buying and selling livestock.  His children help him with the business.  Mirzosadilo is requesting this loan to buy livestock feed.  He relies on your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed

loans.name: Tukuz

texts.ru: Тукуз женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Более 8 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. Также занимается купле- продажей скота. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес, чтобы получить хорошую прибыль для улучшения жилищных условий семьи. В бизнесе помогают дети и невестка. Тукуз запрашивает займ для покупки бычка для откармливания. А также на остальную сумму хочет купит корм для скота. Он заранее благодарен всем, кто поддерживает его.
texts.en: Tukuz is married and has three children.  He has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over eight years.  He is also involved in buying and selling livestock.  Tukuz wants to expand his business in order to make a good profit and improve his family's living conditions.  His children and daughter-in-law help him with the business.  Tukuz is requesting this loan to buy a bull for fattening up.  He also wants to use the remaining amount to buy livestock feed.  He is grateful in advance to all who support him.

loans.use: to buy cattle and livestock feed

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлуба женщина в возрасте 48 лет.Она замужем и имеет двоих детей.Матлуба занимается этим видом деятельности болнн 20 лет. Она покупает товары с «Атуш базара» г. Кайраккума и с Истаравшана, и  продает их на  местном рынке. Её муж уехал на заработки в Россию. Матлуба сотрудничает с организацией  с 2004 года.Она очень довольна что есть такие организации,которые помогают среднем слоям населения. За полученную сумму Матлуба хочет расширить свой бизнес и увеличить свой оборот.
texts.en: Matluba is a 48 year-old woman.  She is married and has two children.  Matluba has been involved in this business for over 20 years.  She buys merchandise at the "Atush bazar" in the city of Kayrakkum and Istaravshan and sells it at the local market.  Her husband left to work in Russia.  Matluba has been partnering with the organization since 2004.  She is very glad that there are such organizations that help the middle class.  Matluba wants to use this loan to expand her business and increase her goods turnover.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Julien A.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Kenema, in eastern Sierra Leone. Teachers of this school have come to SMT for a loan of 9,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to improve their standards of living. Some of them will use this loan to buy house-building materials, some to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay school fees for their children. At the end of each month, the school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting their repayment amount and pays SMT. This is the first loan that this school has applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. 

Julien is the leader of this group of teachers, and he has been in the teaching profession for thirteen years now. The 45-year-old was born in Manowa, in eastern Sierra Leone, and is married with two children. Julien has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials like cement, iron corrugated zinc, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house for his family.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like cement, iron corrugated zinc, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house for his family.

loans.name: Gulsuma

texts.en:
Gulsuma is a kind, very polite 52-year-old woman who is married with three daughters. She is a market vendor and has been selling home products for the last 16 years. She is very experienced, and the products she sells are varied and can satisfy any taste. She sells kettles, cups, table sets, electric goods, and everything necessary for a good dowry. Her monthly income is 230 AZN.

Gulsuma's husband is taxi driver, and his income is very low and not permanent. Now her business is the only stable financial source in her family. Being a taxi driver, her husband helps by bringing her dishes from neighboring cities.

Gulsuma has applied for 1200 AZN to purchase and diversify merchandise to make her shop more attractive for young brides.

loans.use: to buy shop merchandise.

loans.name: Glady Mae

texts.en:
Glady Mae is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Glady Mae has a shop that sells cell phone accessories like cell phone chargers and cases. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy additional stocks of cell phone accessories like cell phone chargers.

Glady Mae has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of cell phone accessories like cell phone chargers.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. For the past 10 years, Virginia has operated a sari-sari (variety) store, buying and selling canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She also makes and sells viands. Virginia has requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Virginia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Eva Aracelli

texts.es:
Eva es una mujer muy luchadora, tiene 45 años de edad y desde pequeña aprendió a ganarse el pan con el sudor de sus frente ya que ellos tenían pocos recursos pero a pesar de ello supieron darle mucho amor y sacarla adelante, por ello Eva vive con sus padres, los ama mucho y cuida ahora que son adultos mayores, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por sus playas hermosas, por sus atractivos turísticos como las Islas Ballestas y el candelabro de Paracas; también es conocido por una de sus actividades principales como la pesca y la agricultura y sobre todo por la amabilidad de su gente. Desde hace 4 años Eva inicio su negocio de venta de productos de belleza como perfumes, maquillaje, cremas, entre otros, inicio este negocio por la necesidad que tenia de tener un ingreso para su hogar sobre todo para apoyar a sus padres y gracias a una amiga se animo totalmente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es carismática y porque le brinda facilidades de pago a sus clientes.

Eva agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al gran apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio como maquillaje, perfumes, entre otros; así ella podrá tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y seguir luchando día a día para hacer realidad sus gran sueño:” Crecer como microempresaria y darle una buena calidad de vida a sus padres”.
texts.en:
Eva is very hardworking, and 45 years of age.  Since she was small she learned to work hard to earn a living, even though she was from a humble family, they learned to prosper through love.  Eva lives with her parents, who she loves and cares for now that they are adults, in their home in the city of Pisco, known for its lovely beaches and attraction such as the Ballestas islands and natural site of Paracas.  This city is also known for its fishing and  agriculture industries as well as for its aimiable people. Four years ago Eva started selling beauty and cosmetic items such as perfumes, make-up, creams, etc.  She began this business to earn more money to support her household, and most importantly to care for her parents.  Thanks to a friend's kind support she believes that her business will prosper, as she enjoys interacting with her customers and extends payment plans to them.

Eva is very grateful to Kiva lenders, whose support will allow her to buy more merchandise such as make-up, perfumes, etc.  In this way she will have greater product variety to offer her clients and can continue working day by day to achieve her dream of growing her small business and providing a better quality of life to her parents.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (make-up, perfumes, etc.)

loans.name: Yesenia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yesenia, está solicitando un préstamo un nuevo préstamo, porque desea comprar elotes, plátanos, para hacer empanadas y tamales, esto le dará mayor solvencia para realizar la venta, ya que depende de este negocio para salir con los compromisos familiares.
Ella ha tenido un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, pues logro tener lo necesario y ha realizado una buena producción de tamales, considera que los ingresos familiares han mejorado, sin inconvenientes.
texts.en:
Yesenia is asking for a new loan because she wants to buy corn and bananas to make turnovers and tamales.  This will give her better solvency to do her sales since she depends on this business to take care of family obligations.

She’s had a positive result with the previous loan because she managed to have what was needed and she made a good production of tamales.  She considers that family income has improved problem-free.

loans.use: to buy corn and bananas.

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
Rosa, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para invertirlo al negocio, ya que las ventas han mejorado, comprara granos básicos, verduras y artículos para el hogar, para incrementar el inventario y tener más capacidad para vender.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo para mejorar las ventas y esto le ha beneficiado con mayores ganancias para mejorar también los ingresos del hogar.
texts.en: Rosa has decided on a new loan to invest in the business since sales have improved.  She will buy basic grains, vegetables and items for the home to increase inventory and have more sales capacity.  The previous loan helped her improve sales and this has benefitted her with higher profits to also improve household income.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, vegetables and items for the home.

loans.name: Jose Esteban

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, esto debido a la necesidad de mejorar y adquirir nuevos materiales que utiliza en la barbería, comprándose una nueva máquina para cortar pelo, talco, papel, loción, peines, esto le ayudara a tener mejor establecida la peluquería y atender mejor a la clientela.
José considera estar en mejores condiciones que antes de utilizar su primer préstamo, pues gracias a estos financiamientos se ha ido superando, cambiando las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
José is asking for la new loan because he needs to improve and acquire new tools he uses in his barber shop.  He will buy a new electric hair clipper, talc, paper, lotion and combs which will help him have a better established barber shop and to provide better customer service.

José believes that he’s in better conditions than before using his first loan because thanks to these loans he’s been improving and changing his family’s conditions.

loans.use: to buy an electric hair clipper, talc, paper, lotion and combs.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto, continúa realizando su labor agrícola, por eso está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, ya que pronto iniciara la siembra y quiere asegurar el terreno donde realizara dicha labor, este préstamo le servirá para pagar el alquiler y los insumos como el abono y herbicidas para aplicarlos a la siembra.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo para mejorar la producción de maíz, ya que compro los materiales necesarios y esto le dio buenos resultados, de donde su familia se ve beneficiada.
texts.en:
Gilberto continues with his farm work which is why he’s asking for a new loan because he will soon start a new crop and he wants to be sure to have land in which to do said work.  This loan will serve to pay for the lease and for the supplies like manure and herbicide to apply to the crops.

The previous loan helped him to improve corn production since he bought the necessary supplies and this led to good results that his family was able to benefit from.

loans.use: to lease land and to buy manure and herbicide.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis es una mujer de 55 años, casada con José con quien tiene un hijo de 24 años; juntos viven en "Santo Domingo" que es un cantón de la provincia de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas" el cual es uno de los más densamente poblados del Ecuador. Tiene un gran atractivo ya que posee varios monumentos distribuidos por toda la ciudad entre el que está el Monumento al Indio Colorado, sector conocido como la “Y del Colorado”.  Santo Domingo es un cantón privilegiado, con gente maravillosa, trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha incansablemente por el desarrollo y progreso, que recibe al turista siempre con los brazos abiertos y los lleva a conocer lo maravilloso de su cultura y entorno. 

Esta mujer emprendedora se dedica a la agricultura desde hace mucho tiempo; en este sector donde reside esta actividad es muy común. Pero Gladis quiere empezar una nueva actividad, la cual represente un nuevo ingreso para la economía familiar y no sea tan sacrificado como lo es la siembra y cosecha. Ella quiere abrir una pequeña tienda de víveres y abarrotes en general, pero para ello necesita de un crédito. Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución intermediaria entre Gladis y la comunidad KIVA ha visto en ella un potencial cliente; no solamente le brindará el capital que necesita sino que además le dará asesoría de tal manera que ella pueda crecer de una manera sustentable. Este no es su primer crédito, y siempre se ha destacado por sus pagos puntuales

Con este nuevo ingreso, Gladis podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gladis is a 55 year old woman married to José with whom she has a 24 year old son.  They live together in Santo Domingo which is a canton in Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas Province which is one of Ecuador’s most densely populated.  It is very popular because it has several monuments spread throughout the city among which is the Monument to the Red Indian, a sector known as the “Y del Colorado.”  Santo Domingo is a privileged canton with marvelous, hardworking and enterprising people who strive tirelessly for progress and development.   They always receive tourists with open arms and take them to experience the marvel of the culture and surroundings.

This enterprising woman has been a farmer for a long time; this activity is very common in the sector where she lives.  But Gladis wants to start a new activity that represents a new source of income for the family economy and that is less demanding than planting and harvesting.  She wants to open a small grocery and general store but needs a loan to do so.

Fundación Alternativa which is the intermediary institution between Gladis and the Kiva community sees a potential client in her.  Not only will it provide her with the capital she needs but it will also give her guidance so that she can grow in a sustainable way.  This isn’t her first loan; she’s always stood out for her punctual payments.  With this new income, Gladis will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to open a small grocery store.

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es:
Rosa, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de más inventario, para aumentar la disponibilidad, esta compra será en lociones, shampoo, talcos, faldas, pantalones, ropa para niños y ropa interior, con este nuevo préstamo le ayudara para mantener lo necesario y atender la demanda.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a generar mayores ventas, ya que lo invirtió en mercadería nueva, fue un efecto positivo, mejorando las condiciones tanto del negocio como de su familia.
texts.en: Rosa is requesting a new loan to buy more inventory to increase her sales.  She would like to purchase lotions, shampoos, talcum powders, skirts, pants, children's clothing and underwear.  This new loan will help her maintain her basic stock and take care of demand.  She used the last loan to help generate higher sales since she invested in new merchandise.  It had a positive effect, improving the condition of the business as well as that of her family.

loans.use: tp buy lotions, shampoos, talcum powders, skirt, pants and children's clothing

loans.name: Disenia Dolores

texts.es:
Disenia, comenta que está solicitando un préstamo, porque quiere comprar frutas y verduras frescas, papayas, mangos, manzanas, repollos, güisquiles, pepinos, esto le ayudara para mantener surtido el negocio de frutos frescos para atender mejor a los clientes.
 El préstamo anterior le ayudo a Disenia a crecer en el negocio, atendiendo a más clientes, teniendo una mejor solvencia en la vida cotidiana con su familia y generando mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
