Disenia comments that she’s asking for a new loan because she wants to buy fresh fruit and vegetables: papayas, mangoes, apples, cabbage, chayote and cucumbers.  This will help her keep her business stocked with fresh fruit to better serve her customers.  

Disenia’s previous loan helped her grow in business tending to more customers and having better daily solvency with her family and generating better profits.

loans.use: to buy strawberries, papayas, mangoes, apples, cabbage and cucumbers.

loans.name: Rhina Esmeralda

texts.es:
Rhina, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para continuar incrementando el negocio, comprando materiales como maíz, chicharrón, quesillo, repollo, tomates, gaseosas, chocolate, esta compra espera que le ayude a mejorar el negocio y salir con una mejor producción de pupusas y antojitos.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo  Rhina, pues a través de él creció en la producción, manteniéndose con su familia, generando lo necesario para la alimentación.
texts.en: Rhina has decided on a new loan to continue growing in business buying supplies like corn, pork rind, string cheese, cabbage, tomatoes, soft-drinks and chocolate.  She hopes this purchase will help her improve the business and have a better production of “pupusas” [grilled, stuffed corn cakes] and fast food snacks.  The previous loan helped Rhina because through it production grew and she was able to generate what was needed to feed her family and support them.

loans.use: to buy corn, pork rind, string cheese, cabbage, tomatoes, soft-drinks and chocolate.

loans.name: Nelly  Lucia

texts.es:
Nelly, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo,  ya que necesita invertir en el negocio, ella comprara productos como azúcar, frijoles, aceite, para mantener disponibilidad en la tienda, que sus clientes estén satisfechos con los productos que ofrece.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, permitiéndole fortalecerse y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Nelly decided on a new loan because she needs to invest in the business.  She will buy products like sugar, beans and oil to have stocked in her store and so that her customers will be satisfied with the products she offers.  

Her previous loan had a positive effect allowing her to strengthen and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans and oil.

loans.name: Veronica Guadalupe

texts.es:
Verónica, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque su negocio necesita volver a surtir de fruta fresca, este préstamo lo utilizara en naranjas, melones, papayas, manzanas, para mantener siempre la variedad.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo para mejorar la situación del negocio, dándole una mejor solvencia y capacidad para atender la demanda, disponiendo de más inventario.
texts.en: Verónica is asking for a new loan because she needs to stock her store once again with fresh fruit.  She will use the loan to buy oranges, melons, papayas and apples to always have variety.  The previous loan helped her improve the business’ situation giving her better solvency and capacity to meet demand since she had more inventory.

loans.use: to buy oranges, melons, papayas and apples.

loans.name: Alicia Esperanza

texts.es:
Alicia es una mujer de 52 años, es una madre soltera, su hijo tiene 20 años de edad. Juntos viven en "Santo Domingo" que es un cantón de la provincia de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas" el cual es uno de los más densamente poblados del Ecuador. Tiene un gran atractivo ya que posee varios monumentos distribuidos por toda la ciudad entre el que está el Monumento al Indio Colorado, sector conocido como la “Y del Colorado”.  Santo Domingo es un cantón privilegiado, con gente maravillosa, trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha incansablemente por el desarrollo y progreso, que recibe al turista siempre con los brazos abiertos y los lleva a conocer lo maravilloso de su cultura y entorno. 

Alicia es dueña de un pequeño jardín de infantes (centro de educación infantil) desde hace 15 años ubicado en la parroquia donde ella reside. Trabaja junto a una profesora parvularia a quien da empleo. Alicia desea renovar su inmobiliario ya que el que actualmente tiene ya tiene algunos años de uso. Con esto ella espera servir mejor a sus pequeños clientes, y así darles un buen trato.

Para esta renovación ella necesita un crédito con el cual pueda cumplir su objetivo. Este no es su primer crédito, ha tenido créditos grupales anteriormente sin embargo si es su primer crédito individual. Se puede ver que esta empresaria ha crecido gracias a las microfinanzas.

Su sueño es poder tener un masterado en educación y así poder tener un centro educativo con una mejor calidad y no solamente para tener mayores ingresos sino porque su vocación es dar a los infantes sus primeros conocimientos.
texts.en:
Alicia is a 52 year old woman.  She’s a single mother; her son is 20 years old.  They live together in Santo Domingo, a canton in Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas Province which is one of Ecuador’s most densely populated.  It is very popular in that it has several monuments spread through the city among which is the Monument to the Red Indian, a sector known as “Y del Colorado.”  Santo Domingo is a privileged canton with marvelous, hardworking, enterprising people who strive tirelessly to develop and make progress.  They always receive tourists with open arms and take them to visit the marvels of its culture and surroundings.

Alicia has owned a small kindergarten (educational center for infants) for 15 years located in the parish where she lives.  She works together with a preschool teacher she employs.  Alicia wants to upgrade the furniture because what she has now has several years of usage already.  With this, she hopes to better serve her little customers and thus give them good care.

She needs a loan to carry out this renovation.  This isn’t her first loan.  She’s had previous group loans but this will be her first individual loan.  One can see that this businesswoman has grown thanks to micro financing.

Her dream is to obtain a Master’s in Education to have a better quality educational center not only to earn higher income but because her vocation is providing children with their initial learning.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her kindergarten.

loans.name: Felipe Antonio

texts.es: Felipe Antonio es una persona luchadora que ha buscado como sacar a su familia adelante brindándole lo mejor, este emprendedor tiene una vivienda en el cual quiere realizarle algunas remodelaciones que por la falta de dinero no las ha realizado, uno de sus sueños es tener bien acondicionada  su vivienda. Felipe Antonio está solicitando financiamiento para comprar arena, zinc, cemento, entre otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en: Felipe Antonio is a determined person that has tried to find a way to get his family ahead and to give them the best.  This entrepreneur has a home which he wants to remodel.  But due to a lack of money, he has not been able to. One of his dreams is to have his home well-equipped.  Felipe Antonio is requesting the loan in order to purchase sand, zinc, cement and other construction materials.

loans.use: to purchase sand, zinc, cement and other construction materials.

loans.name: Rosalina Patricia

texts.es:
Rosalina, tiene la necesidad de invertir en el negocio, por la temporada del verano, él tiene la intensión de comprarse sandalias, short, trajes de baño, ya que se acerca el tiempo de la demanda de estos productos, y quiere estar preparada.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo para que sus ventas fueran mejor, tambien le ayudo para que su familia contara con un aporte más.
texts.en:
Rosalina needs to invest in the business for the summer season.  She intends to buy sandals, shorts and bathing suits because the season when these items are in demand is approaching and she wants to be prepared.

The previous loan helped her sales to be better and also helped her family to have a larger income.

loans.use: to buy sandals, shorts and bathing suits.

loans.name: Sonia Carolina

texts.es:
Sonia, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita más dinero para invertirlo en el negocio, comprándose zapatos, ropa nueva blusas, faldas, pantalones, vestidos, tambien zapatos y productos de primera necesidad como arroz, aceite, huevos, queso, para poder surtir el negocio.
El préstamo anterior le permitió a Sonia poder aumentar los productos en el negocio, dándoles una mejor atención a los clientes y mejorando las condiciones del hogar.
texts.en:
Sonia has decided to take out a new loan because she needs more money to invest in the business buying shoes, new clothes, blouses, pants, dresses and also shoes and basic staple items like rice, oil, eggs and cheese to stock the store.  

The previous loan allowed Sonia to increase products in the business providing better customer service and improving conditions at home.

loans.use: to buy clothes, basic staple items and shoes.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, ya que quiere comprar más ganado para engordarlo y aumentar la granja, invertirá en una vaca y dos chivos, esto le ayudar a tener más oportunidades de ganancia para una venta futura de estos animales.
El efecto que José tuvo con su préstamo anterior fue mejorar sus ingresos en la granja de cerdos y las condiciones familiares solventando las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
José is asking for a new loan because he wants to buy more livestock to fatten up and increase the size of his farm.  He will invest in one cow and two goats which will help him have more opportunities for profit in the future sale of these animals.

The effect José had from the previous loan was to improve his income in the pig farm and improve family conditions by being able to meet household needs.

loans.use: to buy one cow and two goats.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es: Adanely es miembro del Grupo Solidario Los Girasoles, tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y madre de cuatro hijos, su esposo trabaja en los E.U.A, es una familia muy unida y muy luchadora, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano y también a la venta de frutas. Adanely inicio a vender ropa usada hace 6 años atrás, trabaja en conjunto con sus hijos y lo hacen de forma ambulante. Todos los días muy temprano por las mañanas como a eso de las 7:00 a.m salen a las comunidades mas cercanas a realizar sus ventas y luego regresan a casa como a las 7:00 p.m. una de sus dificultades es que no tiene un medio de transporte y como ella trabaja de forma ambulante,  tiene que andar a jalón o en bus.  Adanely es una persona muy jovial, amable y muy conocida por sus vecinos. Ella solicita este préstamo para comprar un fardo de ropa usada y así surtir su negocio de estilos actuales y acordes a la temporada de verano, además de comprar sandias para vender. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá llamar la atención de más clientes y seguirá teniendo una actividad económica que le permita cubrir los gastos para la manutención de su familia. Su sueño es tener un local propio y ayudar a sus hijos a realizarse profesionalmente. Adanely tiene 10 ciclos de recibir financiamiento en FAMA y ha cumplido puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Adanely is a member of the “Los Girasoles” (The Sunflowers) communal bank.  She’s 46 years old and the mother of four children.  Her husband works in the United States.  They are a very united, hardworking family.  She sells second-hand clothes and also fruit.  Adanely started selling used clothes six years ago; she works together with her children and they do it in an ambulatory fashion.  Every morning around 7am they go out to the nearest communities to do their sales and return home around 7pm.  One of her difficulties is that she does not have a mode of transportation and since she works in an ambulatory way she either has to thumb rides or go by bus.

Adanely is a very jovial, kind person who is very well known by her neighbors.  She is asking for this loan to buy a bundle of used clothes to stock her business with current, summer season items; she also wants to buy watermelons to sell.

With support from this loan she will be able to tend to more customers and continue to have an economic activity that will permit her to meet expenses for her family’s support.  Her dream is to have a locale of her own and to help her children become fulfilled professionally.

Adanely has had 10 financing cycles with FAMA and has made all her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of used clothes and watermelons.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, quiere seguir creciendo en su granja y además se acerca la siembra de maíz, para esto solicita un nuevo préstamo, que le de los recursos económicos para la compra de lo necesario como dos cerdos, abono, herbicidas para establecerse mejor en el negocio.
Ella manifiesta haber realizado una buena inversión con su préstamo anterior, las condiciones han mejorado, los ingresos y la estabilidad.
texts.en:
María wants to continue to grow her farm.  In addition, the time for planting corn is approaching.  That is why she is requesting a new loan, to have more economic resources in order to purchase some necessary items like two pigs, fertilizer and herbicide.  Then she will be well-settled in the business.
María states that she made a good investment with her previous loan.  Her condition has improved as well as her income and her stability.

loans.use: to purchase two pigs, fertilizer and herbicide.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Rosa Candida

texts.es:
Rosa, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para aumentar el inventario del negocio, ya que desea compra mariscos en variedad, como pescado, camarones, langostas, que considera vender en esta época, ya que la demanda esta aumentado.
El préstamo anterior tambien fue empleado en la compra de mariscos y semilla, Rosa manifiesta que le fue muy bien con esta inversión y que le mejoro las ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa is requesting a new loan to increase her business's inventory.  She wants to purchase a variety of seafood, like fish, shrimp and lobster, which she plans to sell during this season.  The demand is going up.
The previous loan was used to purchase seafood and nuts.  Rosa states that the investment went very well for her and that it improved her sales.

loans.use: to purchase fish, shrimp and lobster.

loans.name: Manuel Mesías

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre soltero de 31 años que vive con su padre en la parroquia "Luz de América" de "Santo Domingo" que es una de las ciudades más jóvenes del Ecuador, actualmente se ha constituido en el punto de enlace entre las región Sierra y Costa del país. Es un sitio privilegiado, no solo por la riqueza étnica, sino también por los paisajes inusitados que se pueden encontrar desde el ingreso mismo a esta bella ciudad. Santo Domingo de los Colorados pertenece actualmente a la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, recientemente conformada.  La fiesta principal de Santo Domingo, se celebra con un movimiento intenso de visitantes, intercambio comercial y cultural. Una gran feria tiene lugar en las instalaciones de la Asociación de Ganaderos, allí se muestran y compiten los mejores ejemplares de las distintas razas y cruces que son criados en las haciendas de la región. 

Manuel se dedica junto a su padre a la agricultura desde hace 15 años y esta actividad es el sustento de su hogar. Le ha ido bien, ya que gracias a esto ha podido llevar una vida modesta. Tiene una oportunidad de comprar un terreno, con lo cual podrá ampliar sus cultivos y con ello sus ingresos; por ello desea obtener un crédito con el cual pueda crecer. 

Manuel sueña con un día poder construir su casa propia y su automóvil. También quisiera encontrar una mujer con la que pueda tener una buena familia. Y esta es su meta de vida y a la que considera más importante que su meta económica
texts.en:
Manuel is a single, 31 year old man living with his father in Luz de América parish in Santo Domingo one of Ecuador’s youngest cities.  It is at the point where the country’s mountains and coast regions meet.  It is a privileged spot not only for its ethnic richness but also for the unique scenes that can be found from the very entrance to this beautiful city.

Santo Domingo currently belongs to the recently formed Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas Province.  Santo Domingo’s main fiesta is celebrated with intense influx of visitors and much cultural and commercial interchange.  A great fair takes place at the cattlemen’s association grounds where the best examples of various breeds and crossbreeds created in regional haciendas are shown and compete.

Manuel and his father have been farming for 15 years; this activity is their home’s support.  He’s done well because thanks to this he’s been able to live a modest life.  He has the opportunity to buy a piece of land that would allow him to expand his crops and with them his income.  Because of this he’d like to get a loan so that he can grow.

Manuel dreams with one day being able to build his own house and have a car.  He’d also like to find a woman with whom to form a good family.  This is his life’s goal and he considers it to be even more important than his economic goal.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Sabas

texts.es:
Sabas, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, ya que será su apoyo para realizar la siembra de maíz, comprando abono, herbicidas, para una manzana de terreno en la que sembrara, tambien pagara mano de obra.
El préstamo anterior le dio una buena experiencia, obtuvo muchas ventajas para la  compra de cerdos, a través de este aporte ha incrementado sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Sabas is requesting a new loan, which will give him the help he needs to be able to plant corn and purchase fertilizer and herbicides for a block of land he plans to plant.  He will also be able to pay laborers.
Sabas had a good experience with the previous loan.  It gave him a lot of advantages in regard to purchasing pigs, and through the financial support, his earnings increased.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Jose Amadeo

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, pues él está realizando una nueva ocupación y es fabricación de uniformes escolares, José tiene la habilidad de costurar, actualmente tiene trabajo de unos centros escolares, aunque él aun continúa vendiendo mercadería pero le dedica menos tiempo. Este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de telas, hilos y una máquina de coser, con esto lograra mejorar el negocio, fortaleciéndolo de lo más necesario.
El considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo mucho en el negocio de mercadería, pues realizo una buena inversión, actualmente está mejorando y estabilizándose con esta nueva ocupación, con la que espera mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
José’s requesting a new loan because he’s starting a new occupation which is manufacturing school uniforms.  José has the ability to sew and he currently has orders from schools although he still works selling merchandise though he dedicates less time to this.  This loan will be used to buy fabric, thread and a sewing machine to improve the business strengthening it with what’s most necessary.

He considers that the previous loan helped his merchandise business very much because he made a good investment.  He’s currently improving and stabilizing in the new occupation which he hopes will improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es:
José, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita invertir en el negocio, comprando materia prima para la elaboración del pan como harina, azúcar, levadura, manteca, para continúar en la producción de pan, pues hoy en dia elabora su propio pan.
El tuvo un efecto positivo en el préstamo anterior, pues sus ganancias han sido mejor, su familia se mantiene, todos se encuentran bien y él sigue con deseos de superación.
texts.en:
José has decided on a new loan because he needs to invest in the business buying raw materials to make bread like flour, sugar, yeast and shortening to continue baking bread because at present he bakes his own bread.

The previous loan had a positive effect in that his profits improved and his family is supported; everyone is well and he continues with his wish for improvement.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast and shortening.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para invertir en más capital de trabajo, pues ha iniciado con un negocio para el cual comprara 60 pollos, pues es una granja que ha instalado en su vivienda, tambien comprara insumos agrícolas para iniciar la siembra de maíz y frijol.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue favorable, recolecto la cosecha del terreno donde sembró, su situación económica ha mejorado, creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Juan is asking for a new loan to invest in more working capital because he’s started a business for which he’ll buy 60 chicks; it’s a farm he’s installed at home.  He will also buy farm supplies to start growing corn and beans.

The previous loan’s effect was favorable.  He harvested from the field he planted.  His economic situation has improved and he’s grown in business.

loans.use: to buy 60 chicks and farm supplies.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Luis, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para comprarse más mercadería y surtir el negocio para la atención de los clientes, comprara lubricantes y un compresor, con lo que estará en mejores condiciones.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a mejorar la atención a los clientes, con la compra de otra máquina para lavar vehículos, esto le ha dado una mayor estabilidad y aumento en sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Luis has decided to get a new loan to buy more merchandise and stock the business for better customer service.  He will buy lubricants and a compressor which will give him better conditions.

The previous loan helped him improve customer service with the purchase of another machine to wash cars.  This helped him attain more stability and increased his income.

loans.use: to buy lubricants and a compressor.

loans.name: Evenilda

texts.es:
Evenilda, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, para la compra de materiales para el negocio, con el propósito de tener lo necesario para continuar elaborando la comida a los clientes, comprara maíz, pollo, aceite, condimentos, carne, vegetales y gaseosas, ya que esto le dará mayor seguridad para seguir trabajando.
Ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ayudo para poder ofrecer a la clientela los platillos ricos en sabor, variando el menú, esto le dio mas posibilidades para solventar algunos gastos familiares y poder pagar el préstamo.
texts.en:
Evenilda has decided on a new loan to buy supplies for the business in order to have what she needs to continue making meals for her customers.  She will buy corn, chicken, oil, condiments, meat, vegetables and soft-drinks since this will give her greater security to continue working.

She states that her previous loan helped her offer her customers the delicious, tasty dishes varying her menu which gave her more opportunities to cover some family expenses and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy corn, chicken, oil, condiments, meat, vegetables and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 65 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has four children. 

Estelita has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Estelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg is a 44-year-old woman who lives with her husband and five children in the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband works as a cook for a cafeteria. Two of the children study at the college and the other three children go to the secondary school. 

She started producing traditional clothes buttons and trading them at the trade center. She runs the business alone and purchases the materials in large quantities. She has a further plan to increase the volume and trade them in wholesale. 

Oyunchimeg is a diligent woman who says, "I would like to expand the business by purchasing the materials like coral and other precious stones in large quantities at a good price. I want to develop the business activity to raise the income and improve the household." The total amount she is requesting is 2,300,000 MNT to buy the coral and other materials for the buttons.

loans.use: to buy coral and other materials for the buttons.

loans.name: Yeredeme Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Yeredeme, sont toutes des femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de N’Tjifina, sous préfecture de Fana, 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de savon et de l’arachide.                                                                                                                         
Les femmes du groupe Yeredeme sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire 
La cliente MARIAM,  personne au milieu dans le rang des debout, compte acheter 5 kilos de sel de cuisine, deux boites de purée de tomate avec les revendeurs de Nangola pour ensuite les vendre sur place au village à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 4.500FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en:
The members of the Yeredeme group are all married women, averaging 42 years of age and 3 children each.  They all live in extended traditional families in the village of N'Tjifina, in the Fana sub-prefecture.

They know each other through family, friendship and neighborhood ties.  They sell condiments, soap and groundnuts.  This is their third solidarity loan.

Standing in the middle of the back row, Mariam is planning to buy 5 kilos of kitchen salt and 2 boxes of tomato purée from resellers in Nangola.  She will then resell these goods locally in her village to a customer base consisting of men and women.

Mariam is expecting average monthly profits to reach 4,500 CFA francs, which will be used to meet her family's needs, while a part will be reinvested in her condiment retail business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Melona

texts.en:
Melona is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.

Melona has a sari-sari store (or variety food/retail shop) where she sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Melona has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Inspired by her love of New Orleans and the French Quarter, Cynthia started Sugar Cane New Orleans Molasses Bakery, LLC.  Using only quality ingredients, she hopes to sell her cookies wholesale to many of the local retailers in the French Quarter.  

After Hurricane Katrina required the office that she worked in to relocate to the French Quarter, Cynthia had an opportunity to rediscover the city's famous cornerstone neighborhood.  Exploring the French Quarter on her lunch breaks, Cynthia, a New Orleans native, fell in love with the city all over again.  Wanting to start a business that celebrated the food and history of this unique city, she created the "NOMO" cookie.  A certified product of Louisiana, these New Orleans Molasses (NOMO) cookies are made with Steen's sugar cane syrup and each cookie is pressed with a vintage 18th century Louisiana antique mold.  The NOMO cookie is representative of the city and history that inspired it and the love that Cynthia has for creating them. 

After being unsuccessful in finding other options to fund her business, Cynthia turned to Kiva to help her grow her business.  With her Kiva loan Cynthia will purchase a professional dough sheeter that will allow her to create a consistent product.   

This loan has been made as a part of Kiva New Orleans and in partnership with Good Work Network and ASI Federal Credit Union. Kiva New Orleans is a part of Kiva City, a program where Kiva works with community organizations and field partners in the United States to provide local small businesses with microloans. Learn more at kiva.org/neworleans.

loans.use: To purchase baking equipment.

loans.name: Jessica Alexandra

texts.es: Jessica es Licenciada en Comercio Internacional, está solicitando el crédito para pagar una especialización en Marketing. Dentro de algunos años se ve desempeñándose como una especialista en una naviera, ganando dinero suficiente para solventar sus gastos y ayudar en algo a los que una vez le dieron la mano. Le inspiran su hija y su papá, para que su hija sepa que a pesar de las limitaciones que ha enfrentado ha podido salir adelante y que se sienta orgullosa de su mamá, y su papá por que le pudo cumplir en terminar su carrera.
texts.en: Jessica has a degree in International Business and is asking for a loan to get a specialization in Marketing. Within a few years she sees herself working as a specialist at a shipping company, making enough money to cover her costs and help those that have given her a hand along the way. Her daughter and her father are her inspirations. She wants her daughter to know that in spite of the challenges she has faced, she has been able to come out ahead. She wants her to feel proud of her mother and her father because they finished their degree.

loans.use: to get a degree in marketing.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis has been doing entrepreneurial freelance graphic design work for close to nine years. He gained experience in graphic design while still living in the Dominican Republic and continued to do this work after moving to the United States. Overall, he has acquired over 24 years of experience in this field. Just recently, he decided to take the final step in becoming self-reliant by incorporating his freelance work into a formal business. 

Last month, Luis founded a self-titled company that does all of the graphic design and printing work for books, brochures, letterheads, and more for clients that do not have the means to do this themselves. He is also still working part-time for a larger company, but has aspirations of making this business his sole means of income soon. Luis plans to use this loan to buy a new printer to maximize his output. He also would like to buy parts to repair some of his older equipment to make his business more efficient.

loans.use: to purchase a new printer and spare parts to fix and update his old equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Martha Aracely

texts.es: Martha está estudiando la carrera de Licenciatura en Contabiliada Pública y Finanzas, cursando el último año de la carrera, está solicitando el préstamo para pagar el curso de finalización de estudios. Actualmente está laborando, y con sus ingresos paga sus estudios. Su inspiración para alcanzar sus metas es su hija quien ve en mí un ejemplo a seguir y desea darle lo mejor y ser un modelo excelente para ella. Tiene una espíritu emprendendor que la mueve a alcanzar sus metas, se esfuerza por obtener excelente notas en sus clases.
texts.en: Martha is taking courses for a degree in Public Accounting and Finance. She is in the last year of the program. She is applying for the loan to pay the final registration fee to receive her degree.  She is now working, and she pays for her studies with her income. Her inspiration to to reach her goals is her daughter, who sees her as an example to follow and to whom she wants to give the best and be an excellent model for her. She has an entrepreneurial spirit, which moved her to reach her goals, and she strives to obtain excellent grades in her classes.

loans.use: to pay the final registration for her degree

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason has a heart for entrepreneurship, and after leaving the corporate world in 2010 he translated his science and creative skills to the art of soap making. From his kitchen, which he named 'the lab', he founded Monkey Bar Soap. Monkey Bar Soap is an unique artisan soap manufacturing company that is committed to 100% natural, vegan soaps that use no harmful chemicals in the manufacturing process. 

Jason produces a variety of different lines of soaps differing in color and fragrance. Currently, he has been selling his soaps on the website esty.com (http://www.etsy.com/people/monkeybarsoaps), however he much prefers selling in the open-air markets in his community. 

He is asking for a loan to help pay for entrance fees to these markets, as well as purchase the materials he will need to manufacture in bulk. Jason hopes to continue growing his business and would like to hire employees in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bulk materials for manufacturing and pay community market seller's fees.

Maylos is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child.

Maylos has a sari-sari store (or a variety food/retail shop) where she sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Maylos has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en:

Oyuntsetseg started a garment retail business in 2010 at the all mart center. She brings the supplies from China where she gets them at wholesale prices. Her business activities are normal and she is improving her household with the income. Oyuntsetseg is a diligent woman who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by purchasing garments in large quantities, saving the expenses of transportation." The total amount she is requesting is 1,800,000 MNT to buy more garments.

loans.use: To buy more garments.

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en:
Warlito is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has eight children.

Warlito has a hardware shop that sells a variety of lumber and timber. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of lumber and timber to sell.

Warlito has been a member of HSPFI for since 2011.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of lumber and timber to sell.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is a married woman who has three children. She is 32 years old and resides in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Jovelyn owns and operates a farm where she plants and harvests bananas to sell to earn a living.  She has been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of work. She requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Jovelyn has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. For the past 15 years, Ruth has a operated a meat shop, selling pork and beef per kilogram. She has requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy stocks of pork and beef to sell. Ruth has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of pork and beef to sell

loans.name: Johana Del Carmen

texts.es: Johana, desde hace algunos años es propietaria de un pequeño centro donde se imparte clase de computación, su esposo es el profesor; Johana solicita el crédito para compra de monitores(plasma) para actualizar los equipos de computo por orientaciones del ente regulador y asi brindar un servicio de mayor calidad a los estudiantes.   Se caracteriza por ser una señora emprendedora, trabajadora y muy reconocida en el municipio como una persona honesta, capaz y muy reponsable, lider, esta agradecida con la institucion por el servicio recibido.
texts.en: Johana owns a small centre where she offers computer classes. Her husband is a professor. Johana is requesting her second loan for the purchase of plasma computer monitors in order to update her equipment as required by to update the computers in accordance with the regulatory body [that oversees her business]. This way, she will be offer a better quality service to her students. She is an enterprising, hard-working woman who is very well-known in her area as an honest, capable and very responsible leader. She is grateful to the institution for this service.

loans.use: to buy computer monitors.

loans.name: Rotha

texts.en:
Rotha, 33, is single and resides with his brother in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. He and his brother have been working in public transportation for over ten years, earning approximately US $8 per day. 

Rotha wants to build a new house. With this goal in mind, Rotha is requesting a loan of US $600 to purchase construction materials to construct the house. By doing so, he will be able to provide convenient living conditions for his family. In the future, he would like to run a coffee shop to generate more income to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to construct a house.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has two children.

Grace has a pigpen and sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy animal feed for her pigs.

Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

Jeckie provides motorela or motorcycle services and her husband is the driver. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for her transportation services.

Jeckie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for her transportation services.

Marissa has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, where she sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Marissa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks such as canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester, age 31, has been in business for four years. She sells different products including native cakes such as puto and bibingka. She also cares for pigs as an additional source of income. With these various kinds of business, she is in need of additional capital to offer more foods to her customers, as well as to provide for the needs of her pigs. 

Therefore, Ester is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy malagkit rice, milk, sugar, and feed for her pigs. She hopes that this loan will help out with the household expenses and that she can save for the continued education of her two children.

loans.use: to buy malagkit rice, milk, sugar, and feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. For the past 11 years, Arlyn has operated a food shop, making and selling snacks such as rice cakes, pan cakes and binignit (a vegetable soup). She also sells breads, hot coffee and milk.  Arlyn has requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. Arlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok, 60, is widowed and resides with five children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice, vegetables, and fattening up cattle for over twenty years, earning approximately US $4 per day. All of her children are employed in garment factories. They earn approximately US $15 per day. 

Due to the difficulty of the family’s transportation, Sok is requesting a loan of US $900 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional animal husbandry business and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute.

loans.name: Janalyn

texts.en:
Janalyn is from Calamba, Misamis, Occidental. She is 30 years old. Janalyn is a widow and has three children. 

To make a living, Janalyn owns farm land where she plants and harvests bananas to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Janalyn is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In 2010, Janalyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Sok Chan

texts.en:
Sok Chan, 33, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over five years, earning approximately US $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about US $4 per day. 

Due to the difficulty of her family’s transportation, Sok Chan is requesting a loan of US $800 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to run an agricultural business to generate more income to support her family and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is 53 years old and married with six children. For the past six years, she has run a business selling banana cue and rice cakes to earn a living. Epifania has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.

Epifania is requesting a loan to buy raw ingredients to make and sell her snacks. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients

loans.name: Evelina

Evelina is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.

Evelina has a pigpen and she sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy animal feed for her pigs.

Evelina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

texts.en: Elenita is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. For the past 10 years, Elenita has operated a sari-sari (variety) store, buying and selling canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Fidela has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Sam Un

texts.en:
Sam Un, 44, is married and resides with her husband and one school-aged child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over ten years, earning approximately US $25 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman who can earn about US $13 per day. 

Due to the difficulty of the family’s transportation, Sam Un is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her child get a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute.

loans.name: Elena

Elena is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child.

Elena has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, where she sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Elena has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks such as canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Lilia

Lilia is a married woman who has one child. She is 47 years old and resides at Calamba, Misamis, Occidental, Philippines. 

Lilia owns and operates a farm where she plants and harvests bananas to sell to earn a living.  She has been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Lilia has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon is 47 years old and married. She resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. For the past ten years, she has been involved with rice farming and fishing and she earns 5 USD per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Two of Thon's children are employed in a garment factory and earn approximately 5 USD daily. 

Thon is requesting a 1,500 USD loan to purchase a walking tractor to use on her farm. Her loan would allow her to complete her work faster. In the future, Thon would like to expand her business and help her children get their bachelors degrees. She also would like to purchase timber to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor to use on her farm

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 42 years old and married with four children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past three years, Delia has a sari-sari (variety) store and works buying and selling canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. Delia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  

Delia is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Vy

texts.en: Vy, 41, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been producing fried dough strips to sell for over ten years, earning approximately USD 10 per day. Her husband runs a public transportation service to generate more income to support the family. Approximately, he earns USD 3 per day. Vy is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase doors and windows to install in her house. This money will help her finish her house construction. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get a Bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase doors and windows to install in her house

loans.name: Alghzlan Group

texts.en:
The members of the "ALGHZLAN" group are all married women, they are Shwayh, Khmisa, Fatima, Shwayh, Rahma and Nadia averaging 30 to 50 years of age with five children. They all live in traditional extended families in the Sana`a, Yemen. They know each other through family, friendship and neighborhood ties. They requested a loan of 270,000 Yemeni Rial (YER). 

Shwayh is a leader of the group and is 50 years old. She belongs to the "ALGHZLAN" group. (She is the woman wearing glasses.) She's been selling bread for many years. She says that she does very well with the business. She goes out into the town with a basket to sell bread and also sells it on order which she says she does well; she sells three times a week. 

She applied for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB. She hopes that she'll do better and will use the loan to buy the ingredients she uses to make the bread, such as: flour, oil, shortening, salt, etc. She is happy and hopes to get a lot out of the loan. She hopes the business will continue growing like it's done to date. She is grateful for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, oil, shortening, salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Sivatha

texts.en:
Sivatha, 31, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling grilled beef, meat balls and boiled eggs for over two years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a motorbike mechanic who earns about $7 per day. 

In order to improve her husband's business, Sivatha is requesting a loan of $1000 US to purchase spare motorbike parts for her husband to resell. By doing so, he would be able to earn more money to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the further profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase spare motorbike parts for her husband to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, & beverages for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Leonora has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 17,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Leonora has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Leonora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Arcely

texts.en:
Arcely  is a person who has had to overcome a lot of hardship in life. However, she remains strong and inspired to provide the necessities for her children.  With the desire to experience a good quality of life, she is engaging in a hog fattening business as a source of income. 



She has been in this business for 10 years and is longing for a better income through this business. Now, she is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy feed, vitamins and medicine to make them well-nourished and healthy.  Hopefully, she can sell the pigs at a profitable price soon.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and medicine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands to sell

loans.name: Regie

texts.en:
Regie is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Regie has a food/retail shop (sari-sari store) where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Regie has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.  In the future, Regie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is a married woman with one child. Maricel is 29 years old, and comes from Calamba, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Maricel is breeding & fattening pigs for sale to earn a living and she's been 5 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase breeding livestock. Maricel is been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Maricel wants to make improvements on her house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Cesario

texts.en:
Cesario is married with three children and he is 53 years old. He resides at Sapang Dalga, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Cesario is operating a coconut production business to earn a living and he has been six years in this business. Each month, he earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of business.

He requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Earlier this year, Cesario joined GDMPC. In the future, Cesario wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase another plot of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en: Evelina is a married woman with two children. She is 44 years old and lives in La Ezperanza, Rizal, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Evelina owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years and earns 3,000 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Evelina has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future, Evelina plans to save her returns in order to buy another plot of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

location.town: La Esperanza, Rizal, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn has been engaged in her piggery business for three years. She is 43 years old and married with three children. She is thankful because her husband has been helping her to earn their living and provide the necessities for her school-aged children.


Currently she is raising four piglets to whom she devotes her time. She wishes to make them healthier and nourish them well, so Juvelyn is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy feed and vitamins. Hopefully, she can make her business bigger to make their lifestyle wealthier.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old and is a married with two children. She has run a sari-sari store business for six years. She sells soft drinks, biscuits, vinegar, oil, soy sauce and other variety of items. She chose to engage in this business to look after her children. 

Elizabeth is requesting a loan amount of 10,000 pesos to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, salt and spices. She hopes to earn more and be able to save and sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, salt and spices.

loans.name: Paulino Antonio

texts.es:
Paulino, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, pues quiere comprarse algunas herramientas para su trabajo como electricista, comprara una escalera de dos bandos, cables, poliductos, que son necesarios para realizar sus actividades.
Él ha mejorado en su servicio a la clientela, obteniendo mas ganancia para colaborar en los gastos del hogar, su condición de vida está mejorando, esto debido a su dedicación y esfuerzo en el trabajo.
texts.en: Paulino has decided to request a new loan because he wants to buy some tools for his job as an electrician.  He will buy a ladder, wiring, and cables, which are necessary to do his work.  He has improved his service to his customers, obtaining more profits to contribute to his home's expenses.  His living conditions are improving due to his dedication and effort in his work.

loans.use: to buy a ladder, wiring, and cables.

loans.name: Sok Pheim

texts.en: Sok Pheim, 30, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is employed in a garment factory. He earns about USD 4 per day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sok Pheim is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a small pig farm to generate extra income to support the family and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en:
Filipina, aged 60, is a hardworking woman who lives with her husband and children. At her age she is still capable of caring for two pigs. This is profitable work, and it serves as her pastime for the whole day. She farms pigs to save funds for her and her husband to use as they get older. 

Filipina is asking for support in the form of a loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. She will use the loan to purchase necessary supplies, such as feed, vitamins, medicines, and wood for a new pig shelter.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Tsetsegmaa, 43, runs a grocery store in addition to her clothing business, which she started in 2010. She lives with her husband and her two daughters in a ger, a traditional Mongolian dwelling, in the suburbs of Ulaanbaatar. Her husband makes a living transporting freight. 

Tsetsegmaa is requesting a loan to buy additional stock for her grocery store. She believes that this will increase her sales volume and earnings. This her second loan, and she successfully repaid her previous loan on time.

loans.use: to buy stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda is from the village of Tinacla-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, married, and has two children. Merlinda used her last loan to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Her business has been successful, and she's taking a new loan to pay labor costs for farm maintenance. In the future, she hopes to be able to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: to pay labor costs for farm maintenance.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo, separated with 3 children, is 53 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Alfredo provides transportation services to earn a living. He has been doing this for 15 years, and every month he earn 3,000 PHP. He has requested a loan of 6,700 PHP to repair his vehicle so that he can provide better service.

Alfredo has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, he hopes to help his children finish their studies and to double the income from his business.

loans.use: to repair his transportation service vehicle.

loans.name: Ines

texts.en:
Ines is married and blessed with ten children. She is 52 years old and lives in Tabid, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Ines owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for nine years and earns 2,400 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals to help increase production. 

Ines has been a member of GDMPC, a KIVA partner, for a year. She hopes to save the returns from her loan in order to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals to increase production

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is a 50-year-old resident of Tabid, Ozamis City. She provides for the needs of her seven children using the small amount--6,000 PHP--that she earns every month by raising pigs. She has been running this business for nine years in order to add to her husband's earnings. 

In 2011, Mary Jean became a member of GDMPC, and she is applying for a microfinance loan of 8,109 PHP to buy feeding supplies for her pigs. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a responsible and loving mother to her four children. She is grateful because three of her children are working and the fourth is a third-year college student majoring in Hotel and Restaurant Management at UP Baguio. Two years ago, her husband unexpectedly departed from her life. Despite the situation of her family, still she stands firm and tries to let go of her pains and sorrows. Rosemarie would like to live independently from her children because soon they will have their own families. She would like to earn her own income so that she will be able to take care of herself. 

Rice farming has been the main source of income for Rosemarie's family. Since her farming has been successful, she decided to also raise hogs. She is currently raising one sow and fattening three hogs. She would like to nourish them well so that she can generate more income. She regrets that her income is not sufficient, due to the high cost of basic commodities and the high price of the feed and vaccines needed in her hog-raising business. For this reason, she would like to ask for financial assistance in the amount of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs. She hopes that her request will be granted.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccine for her hogs.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sonia, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para ser invertido en productos de primera necesidad, con la intensión de surtir el negocio, comprara arroz, azúcar, aceite, sal, entre otros productos que le servirán para atender las necesidades de los clientes.
Ella considera que su condición ha mejorado, incrementado el inventario con la inversión del préstamo anterior, su familia se encuentra estable y Sonia ha tenido un mayor ingreso por su negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia is requesting a new loan to invest in basic needs products. Her intention is to supply her business in purchasing rice, sugar, oil, and salt, among other products that will allow her to attend to er customers' needs. 

She believes that her situation has improved after having increased her inventory through the investment of the previous loan. Her family is stable and Sonia has had increased income through her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, and salt.

loans.name: Neyda Narcisa

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo encontramos un lugar conocido como los Arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Fe y Esperanza, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Neyda, tiene 50 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos aun viven en su casa y el menor estudia en universidad. El marido se dedica a la pesca.
 
Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica a la cría pollos y gallinas criollas, en temporadas tiene hasta cien pollos los cuales los cría durante tres meses que es el tiempo que se demoran para listos para la venta, después de este tiempo  cuando ya están listos los pela y vende por libras a los conocidos que llegan hasta su casa comprar sus productos, ella también se dedica a realizar trabajos de limpieza de pinchaguas (pescados),  lleva más de 15 años con esta actividad y le va bien.
 
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar la mayor cantidad de pollos, alimentos y medicinas para sus animalitos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 8 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en: In the parish of Crucita in the canton of Portoviejo, one can find a place known as Arenales. It is here that every 15 days the members of the communal bank Fe y Esperanza meet. This place is known for its beautiful beaches, as well as it's food and the warmth of its people. Neyda lives in this place. She is 50 years old and is in a civil union from which she has four adult children. Three of them still live in her house and the youngest is studying at university. Her partner makes a living fishing. To earn some of her own money she works raising chickens and hens. At times she has as many as 100 chickens which she raises for three months, the time it takes for them to be ready to be sold. After this amount of time, when they are ready, she plucks them and sells them by the pound to those she knows who come to her house to buy her products. She also works cleaning pinchaguas (sardines). She has spent more than 15 years at this work and it has gone well for her. She will use this new loan to purchase a larger quantity of chickens, feed, and medicines for her little animals. She has been with the communal bank for eight years and she likes it because of the help the loans afford her. Her dream is to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy chicken, feed and medicines for them.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma, who is married and has 4 children, is 32 years old and resides at Tabid, Ozamis City, Philippines. Norma plants, harvests and sell bananas for a living. She's been in this business for eight years, and each month, she earns 1,200. Norma requested a loan of 3,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2011, Norma joined GDMPC. In the future, Norma wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is from Hinagdong, Ozamiz City. She is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children. Rebecca owns and operates a farming business, planting, harvesting and selling bananas. Rebecca has been active in her business for 7 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month from it. In 2009, Rebecca joined GDMPC to access financial services and business activities that could help improve her living situation. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 5,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 12 children. 
Erlinda has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 9,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Erlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. Nenita has a shop that sells ready-to-wear clothes, shoes, bags and dresses. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 18,000 to buy merchandise, such as ready-to-wear clothes.

Nenita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Nenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as ready-to-wear clothes.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is a 39-year-old married mom of 6 children. She is living in Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where her wide array of rice production is located. She has been cultivating this land since she was 20 years of age and until the present time. She normally receives PHP 2,000 a month. In 2011, Vilma joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 2,800 to purchase fertilizers such as manure to increase production. When the crop gets realized, the revenue will be allotted to expanding the business area to earn more income and to sustain her daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a fifty-eight-year-old man. He is married and has six children. Joseph has a farming business in Emali. He has been in the business for sixteen years now and gets a monthly income of two thousand shillings.

This will be Joseph’s first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy farm inputs. With the profit that he will get, he wants buy a goat. 

In the future, he wants to improve his chicken preservation.

loans.use: to  buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Krissia Noemy

texts.es:
Krissia, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para la compra de más ropa interior para damas y caballeros, pues su objetivo es que su negocio se mantenga estable, para esto deberá realizar inversiones periódicas que le ayuden a ofrecer nueva mercadería a los clientes.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo para tener una buena apariencia con los clientes, y obtener un mejor porcentaje de ganancias.
texts.en: Krissia has decided to request a new loan to buy more men and women's underwear.  Her goal is that her business stays stable.  For this, she should make periodic investments that help her offer new merchandise to her customers.  She thinks her previous loan helped her have a good appearance with her customers and obtain a better percentage of profits.

loans.use: to buy men and women's underwear.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción, se  decidió por un nuevo préstamo, ya que con este aporte puede seguir creciendo, en esta ocasión quiere pagar la mano de obra para la temporada de molienda de caña de azúcar, ya que necesita contratar varias personas para realizar este trabajo.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo para realizar esta misma labor, saliendo bien con la elaboración del dulce de panela y además logro poner a la venta los productos, esto le ha ayudado a cambiar las circunstancias familiares, aumentado los ingresos para poder subsistir con su familia.
texts.en:
Concepción has decided to take out a new loan, as with this he will be able to continue growing.  On this occasion, he wants to pay for manual labor during the milling season for sugar cane, as he needs to hire several people to do this work.

The previous loan helped him to do this same work, which went well in terms of getting the sugar from the unrefined cane.  He was also able to sell his sugar products, which helped him to change his family circumstances and increased his income so that he could survive with his family.

loans.use: to pay for manual labor during the milling season for sugar cane.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is married and has 10 children. She is 40 years old, and resides at Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Catherine manages a gardening business as their source of income and she's been in this business for 15 years. Each month, she earns 2,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 3,100 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In 2011, Catherine joined GDMPC. In the future, Catherine wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Alberto solicita un crédito con KIVA para poder poner las instalaciones eléctricas, ya que por temas de gastos no ha podido juntar el dinero necesario para hacer mejoras a su casa. 
Don Alberto es una persona responsable y trabajadora, es empleado de las oficinas del gobierno jurídico, tiene ya más de dos años en este empleo. 
Desea mejorar el patrimonio de su familia y que tengan un lugar más seguro y cómodo, ya que tiene dos hijos pequeños de edad.
texts.en: Señor Alberto is requesting a loan with Kiva to be able to install electricity in his home.  Because of fear of expenses, he hasn't been able to gather the necessary money to make improvements to his home.  Alberto is a responsible and hard-working person.  He is an employee in the government legal offices, and he has done this work for more than two years.  He hopes to improve his family's wealth, and he wants them to have a safer and more comfortable place.  He has two small children.

loans.use: to install electricity in his home.

loans.name: Santiago Antonio

texts.es:
Santiago, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, pues quiere invertir más en el negocio, comprara productos para la tienda como huevos, aceite, queso, arroz, boquitas, galletas, y otros productos que son de la necesidad de  los clientes.
Él considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a tener nueva refrigeradora, permitiéndole crecer y generar mayores ventas, comenta que hasta el momento no ha enfrentado ningún inconveniente.
texts.en:
Santiago is requesting a new loan because he wants to buy more products for his business such as eggs, oil, cheese, rice, snacks, cookies and other items that his customers need.
He says that the previous loan helped him get a new refrigerator, allowing his business to grow and generate higher sales. He says that up to this point, he hasn’t had any problems.

loans.use: to buy eggs, oil, cheese, rice, snacks and cookies

loans.name: Onsinyo

texts.en:
Job is 30 years married to Stella and they are blessed with three children. He runs a retail shop in Kitengela. He has been in this business for the last three years and has an income of KES 20,000 per month.

He is applying for his first loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD, with which he plans to purchase more food stuff like maize flour, wheat flour and rice. He will use the extra profit to pay fees.

He hopes to start wholesaling and to have happy and successful life.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food stuff, like maize flour, wheat flour, and rice for sale.

loans.name: Doris Azucena

texts.es:
Doris, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, por la necesidad de invertir en el cafetín y tambien está atendiendo la venta de ropa, pero esta inversión la hará específicamente en pan, refrescos, galletas, dulces, papas, entre otros que son necesarios para atender la demanda de los clientes.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior es  que ha mejorado su condición en el negocio de ropa, contando un nuevo aporte a través de la venta de ropa, sus ingresos son mejores y su familia se encuentra estable.
texts.en: Doris has decided to request a new loan because of the need to invest in her small café.  She also sells clothing, but she will make this investment specifically in bread, soft drinks, cookies, sweets, potatoes, and other items that are necessary to attend to her customers' demands.  The effect that her previous loan had was that it improved the condition of her clothing business.  She now has new support through her clothing sales, her income is higher, and her family is stable.

loans.use: to buy bread, soft drinks, cookies, sweets, and potatoes.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is married with 4 children. Nona is 42 years old. She sells variety of viands to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan to buy raw ingredients to make viands and sell them.
Nona has been a member of HSPFI for 1 years. Nona hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make viands and sell.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en: Adelina is a married woman who has an only child. She is 45 years old and lives in Gotokan Daku, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Adelina owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 7 years and earns PHP 7,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 12,544 to purchase farm chemicals. Adelina became a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, in 2007. Adelina hopes to expand of her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina, a widow who has two children, is 42 years old and resides at Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Gina owns and operates farmland, planting & harvesting corn for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 2,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 3,000 to purchase fertilizer. In 2008, Gina joined GDMPC. In the future, Gina wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Erick Tomas Antonio

texts.es:
Erick, por la necesidad de comprar más insumos para una nueva siembra, solicita este préstamo para poder obtener el abono, insecticidas, semilla mejorada, para dar inicio a la siembra del invierno, con la esperanza de que sea abundante.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a Erick a contar con lo necesario  para su trabajo agrícola, de la cual saco provecho, ayudando más a su familia con la alimentación y los ingresos para el hogar.
texts.en: Erick needs to buy more supplies for his new planting.  He is requesting this loan to be able to obtain manure, insecticides, and improved seeds to start his winter planting, with the hope that it will be abundant.  His previous loan helped him have what was necessary for his agricultural work, which was beneficial to him.  It helped his family with their food costs and to have income for their home.

loans.use: to buy manure, insecticides, and improved seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de cadenas, aretes, pulseras, anillos.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés, quiere seguir trabajando con préstamos para el fortalecimiento del negocio, ya que quiere comprarse una novilla, para aumentar el número de ganado, aprovechando la oportunidad de la venta.
El considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a comprarse una vaquilla, a través de este aporte está creciendo como ganadero.
texts.en:
Andrés wants to continue working with loans to strengthen his business.  He wants to buy himself a young bull to increase the number of cattle he owns, taking advantage of the opportunity of the sale.

He considers that the previous loan helped him to buy a heifer.  With this contribution he is growing as a rancher.

loans.use: to buy a young bull.

loans.name: Divino Niño De Tohalla (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Divino Niño de Tohalla se  reúne cada quince días en el sitio del mismo  nombre en el Cantón Montecristi,  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse hace un tiempo atrás  y formar este banco comunal, el cual les ha ayudado mucho ya que con los créditos que recibieron de la institución  han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios, ellos se dedican a varias actividades pero en su mayoría a la elaboración de ladrillos y a la agricultura.
 
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora María Edulfa, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo el cual ya es mayor de edad y estudia medicina en una universidad en Manta.

Ella ha tenido que luchar muy duro para sacar adelante a su hijo y darle la mejor educación para su futuro, con la ayuda de sus padres hace mas de 18 años decidió emprender una pequeña empresa de fabricación de ladrillos (material utilizado para la construcción), en la actualidad con ella trabajan más de 25 personas a quienes les paga un sueldo semanal,  los ladrillos  entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su localidad, los embarcan y llevan  a distribuir a otras ciudades.

Este crédito es para comprar madera y arcilla para la elaboración de los ladrillos, esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal,  es la presidenta del mismo y está muy contenta porque el grupo es muy unido.
