Su sueño es tener un camión para entregar sus productos.
texts.en:
The "Divino Niño de Tohalla" ["Divine Baby of Tohalla"] communal bank meets every two weeks at the site of the same name in Montecristi canton.  This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts which are recognized at a national and international level.  It is where the famous straw sombreros come from.

This is a group of people who decided to join together some time ago to form this communal bank.  The communal bank has helped them greatly, as the loans that they have received from the lending institution have allowed them to improve their small businesses.  They work in various activities, but the majority work making bricks or in agriculture.

One of the members of this group is Señora María Edulfa.  She is 53 years old, and is the single mother of one grown son who is studying medicine at a university in Manta.

She has had to strive very hard to move her son ahead in life and to provide him with the best education for his future.  With the help of her parents, she decided more than 18 years ago to set up a small business making bricks (used as a construction material).  She currently has more than 25 people who work with her, whom she pays a weekly salary.  The bricks are delivered to retailers who come to her location, load them up, and take them to other cities for distribution.

This loan is to purchase wood and clay for making the bricks.  María has been the president of the communal bank since it began, and is very happy because the group is very united.

Her dream is to have a truck for delivering her products.

loans.use: to purchase clay and wood.

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr:
Massan est une femme âgé(e) de 53ans. Elle est mariée å un sociologue et a 05 enfants dont 02 à l’école. Le premier a 27ans et le dernier 11ans.  
Massan travaille comme revendeuse de gravier depuis 2008. Elle vend seule à ses clients à l’entrée d’un collège.
Massan a requis son second  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du gravier. Elle veut réinvestir et agrandir son activité. Elle souhaite avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Massan is 53 years old and married to a sociologist.  She has five children, two of whom attend school.  Her oldest child is 27 years old, the youngest is 11.  

Massan has been reselling gravel since 2008.  She sells alone to her customers, in front of a middle school.

Massan has requested a second loan from WAGES in order to buy some gravel.  She wants to reinvest and expand her business.  She wants her family to be happy.

loans.use: to buy gravel.

loans.name: Regina Despertina

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo encontramos un lugar conocido como los Arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Fe y Esperanza, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Regina, tiene 31 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 14 y 11  años  de edad, ambos  estudian en colegio. El marido se dedica a la pesca.
 
Ella realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo, él se dedica a la pesca y utiliza el crédito para sus faenas en alta mar,  ella se dedica tareas de limpieza de los peces una vez que desembarcan en las playas de su localidad. Su esposo sale desde la madrugada para regresar por las tardes, es allí donde nuestra amiga entra en acción y empieza con su labor de limpieza de los peces para entregarlos a los comerciantes que llegan hasta los Arenales a recoger los productos y luego llevarlos a las grandes empresas en la ciudad de Manta. Llevan más de 13 años dedicados a esta labor y es así como han sacado adelante a su familia.
p>
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar materiales para la pesca como combustibles, redes, piolas y varias cosas necesarias para la pesca. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de 2 años, es la secretaria del banco y le gusta por los beneficios y créditos que ofrece la institución. 

Sus sueños son tener un carro para distribuir sus productos directamente a las empresas
texts.en:
In Crucita Parish, which is in Portoviejo Canton, we find a place known as Los Arenales. Here, every fifteen days, the members of Banco Comunal Fe y Esperanza (Faith and Hope Communal Bank) meet. This place is known for its beautiful beaches, gastronomy and the quality of people.

Regina lives here and is 31 years old. She is in a common law marriage, from which she has two children who are 14 and 11 years old. Both go to school. Her husband is a fisherman.

She is taking out the loan to help her husband, who is a fisherman and utilizes the credit for his high seas fishing, while Regina cleans the fish once they dock in her town. Her husband leaves at dawn to return in the afternoon. It is then that she goes into action and starts her work cleaning the fish to sell them to the shopkeepers that go to Los Arenales to buy the fish and bring them to large businesses in the city of Manta. They have been doing this work for more than 13 years and in this way have been able to get ahead in life with their family.  

She will use this loan to purchase materials for fishing such as gas, nets, cords and various items necessary for fishing. She has been a member of the communal bank for more than two years. She is the secretary of the bank and she likes the institution for the benefits and loans that it offers.

Her dreams are to have a car to distribute her fish directly to the businesses.

loans.use: purchase gas, nets, cords and other materials for fishing.

loans.name: Jessica Jenny

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo encontramos un lugar conocido como los Arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Fe y Esperanza, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Jessica, tiene  31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 12, 9 y 2 años de edad, los mayores  estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido se dedica a la pesca.

Ella se dedica a la cría de chanchos y  pollos, tiene una pequeña granja en su casa, en temporadas compra de cien a doscientos pollos los cuales los cría durante dos a tres meses que es el tiempo que se demoran en estar listos para la venta, después de este tiempo  cuando ya están listos los entrega a  algunas tiendas en la localidad. Ella también utiliza parte del crédito para el negocio de su esposo el cual se dedica a la pesca y requiere de materiales para realizar su labor, él lleva más de 14 años dedicado a la pesca y le va muy bien.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar la mayor cantidad de pollos, alimento para animales y materiales para la pesca. Lleva más de dos años  en el Banco, es la tesorera del grupo y está muy contenta porque  le han ayudado mucho.
 
Sus sueños son tener un barco para que su esposo salga a realizar sus faenas de pesca.
texts.en:
In the Crucita Parish of Portoviejo Canton we find a place known as Los Arenales, where every 15 days the members of the communal bank "Fe y Esperanza" hold a meeting.  This location is well known for its beautiful beaches, its gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

This is where 31-year-old Jessica lives, with her common-law husband and their three children, aged 12, 9 and 2.  The eldest are in school.  Her husband is a fisherman.

She raises pigs and chickens and has a small farm at home.  Periodically, she buys 100 to 200 chickens which she feeds for three months getting them ready for sale to stores around where she lives.  She also uses part of the loan for her husband's business.  He is a fisherman and requires supplies for his work.  He has been in the business for 14 years and it is going well.

This new loan will be used to buy more chickens, animal feed and fishing supplies.  She has been in the communal bank for over two years and is the acting Treasurer of the group.  She is content because of all the help she has received.

Her goal is to own a boat so her husband can go out and fish.

loans.use: To buy chickens, animal feed and fishing supplies.

loans.name: Ayda Merelin

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ayda, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  tres años y de un año y medio. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que para ganar algo por su cuenta y ayudar con esto en los gastos del hogar se dedica a varias actividades, ella se dedica  la venta de ropa de todo tipo y bisutería, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta. También cría pollos en su casa, lugar donde tiene un pequeño galpón adecuado para esto,  los mismos que entrega a comerciantes en su  casa cuando ya están listos. Trabaja tres  días a la semana más que todo en las noches cuando su esposo llega del trabajo y puede quedarse con los niños, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada fin de semana. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Portoviejo  cada vez  que necesita.   Empezó con su negocio con el primer crédito que recibió del banco.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde del inicio y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito empezó en su negocio.

Sus sueños tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es de su mamá.
texts.en:
The communal bank "María Inmaculada" meets every fifteen days in the parish of La Sequita de Montecristi.  This canton is famous for its straw hats, which are appreciated both nationally and internationally.

Here we meet Mrs. Ayda, 24, who is married and has two children, aged 13 and one and a half.  Her husband works at a factory in Manta.

She is a very good homemaker who carries out several activities in order to earn an income and contribute to the household expenses.  She sells all kinds of clothing and costume jewellery on a door-to-door basis.  She also raises chickens at home where she has a small coop for this purpose.  When the chickens are fully grown she sells them to merchants.  She works three days a week, especially at night when her husband comes home from work and takes care of the children.  Her sales are made on a credit basis; and she collects payment every weekend.  When she is in need of merchandise, she travels to Portoviejo to buy it.  She started up her business with her first loan through the communal bank.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.  She has been a member of the communal bank since it began, and likes it because thanks to her first loan she was able to start her business.

Her goal is to have her own house, since she now lives with her mother.

loans.use: To buy trousers, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Mayra Janeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mayra, tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  tres y un años de edad. Su esposo es albañil.
 
Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc. De a poco su tienda ha ido mejorando y esto gracias a los créditos recibidos en el banco comunal, nos cuenta que le han  ayudado mucho y mucho mas en esta temporada que todo ha estado muy difícil por el invierno, ella trabaja desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su esposo le ayuda cuando está desocupado. Tiene más de dos años  con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad que necesita para aumentar su negocio. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.

Sus metas son seguir adelante y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The communal bank "María Inmaculada" meets every 15 days in the parish of La Sequita de Montecristi, a canton known for its famous straw hats which are appreciated both nationally and internationally.

Here we meet Mrs. Mayra, 22, who is married and has two children, aged three and one.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

She runs a grocery store out of her home, where she sells all kinds of products, such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, etc.  Her store has improved little by little thanks to the loans she has received from the communal bank.  She claims they have helped her a lot, especially now when everything is more difficult because of the winter season.  She works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. and sometimes later.  Her husband helps out when he can.  She has been in business for over two years and it is going well.

This loan is to restock the store with rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other essential products needed to increase sales.  She has been in the communal bank since its beginning and she likes it because of the easy loan terms.

Her goal for the future is to increase business daily.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oils, detergents, sausages and other essential products.

loans.name: Paul Muchira

texts.en: Paul is applying for his fifth loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Paul will use this loan to buy timber and paint for his furniture making business.  With the anticipated profit from the loan, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a pickup for transporting timber.

loans.use: buy timber and paint

loans.name: Amigos Por Siempre (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  la ciudadela Municipal en la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Banco Comunal Amigos Por Siempre. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, servicios, entre otras cosas. Ellos ya realizaron un crédito y les fue muy bien, ahora esperan seguir adelante mejorando aun más su vida y sus negocios.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Marlene, tiene 36 años  de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de años de 14 y 13 años de edad. Su marido es albañil.

Ella además de ser una gran ama de casa también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta,  sale a recorrer la ciudad de lunes a viernes ya sea en las mañanas o en las tardes, deja  sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Para comprar su mercadería y surtirse de productos se traslada hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil cada fin de mes o cuando necesita mercadería, Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas y ropa interior sobre todo de niños ya que es época de entrada a clases y sus clientes le piden estas prendas. Este es el tercer  ciclo en el Banco Comunal, es la tesorera y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda.
 
Su sueño es tener una boutique.

Las tres fotos pequeñas son de dos socias y un socio que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
In the municipal community in the city of Portoviejo, every 15 days the members of the communal bank "Amigos Por Siempre" hold a meeting.  They are involved in different business activities such as commerce in general, services, and other areas.  They already received one loan and it went well for them, and now they hope to continue improving their lifestyles and businesses.

One of the members of this group is Mrs. Marlene, 36, who is married and has two children, aged 14 and 13.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

Apart from being a great homemaker, she also sells all kinds of clothing on a door-to-door basis.  She works throughout the city, Monday through Friday, in the mornings and afternoons.  She delivers her products on a credit basis and collects payment every week.  To buy her merchandise and products she travels to the city of Guayaquil at the end of every month or whenever she needs to.  She has been in business for four years and it has gone very well.

This loan is to buy trousers, shirts and underwear, especially for children, since this is when school starts and her customers are requesting these items.  This is her third loan through the communal bank.  She is the Treasurer and enjoys the bank because the loans are very helpful.

Her goal is to have her own boutique.

The three small photos are of members who could not be present for the group picture.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shirts and underwear.

loans.name: Sandra Virginia

texts.es: Sandra con su anterior credikiva, compró materias prima e insumos al por mayor, 2 lavadoras y mercancía con la cual fortaleció su negocio de venta de mercancía mediante guías especializadas de productos. Ella ganó porque encontró buenos descuentos y vendió rápidamente a su clientela. Hoy está aplicando a un credikiva con el cual aprovechará para comprar artículos de la oferta, que ya solicitó en su catalogo y venderá a un buen precio a su mejor clientela. Así mismo, provisionará de materias primas, el negocio de comidas rápidas y hará mantenimiento a todas sus lavadoras. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva: “Estoy muy agradecida con a Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con todos los que me apoyan, por ayudar a personas como nosotros que no tenemos quien nos apruebe un crédito bajo las condiciones existentes”.
texts.en: Sandra used her previous CrediKiva loan to buy wholesale raw materials and supplies, two washing machines and catalogue merchandise.  She was able to profit by finding good discounts and selling quickly to her customers.  Today she is requesting a loan to buy goods on sale, which she has already ordered by catalogue and will sell at a good price to her best customers.  She also plans to buy ingredients for her fast food business and pay for maintenance for her washing machines.  She sends the following message to Kiva lenders: "I am very grateful to the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and everyone who has helped me, for the support given to people like us who have no way of getting approval for a regular loan in today's market conditions".

loans.use: To buy catalogue sale items, ingredients for her fast food business and pay for maintenance for her washing machines.

loans.name: Zunilda Maria

texts.es: Zunilda vive al sur Occidente  de la ciudad con su cónyuge y tienen 4 hijos en las edades de 3 a 14 años; allí mismo  tiene un negocio donde vende comidas rápidas, que funciona los fines de semana. Este negocio lo inició desde hace 4 años, vendiendo perros calientes y hamburguesas  con una mesa 1 horno, y $300.000 COP. Los cuales ubicó en la terraza de su casa, aprovechando que   por allí transitan moradores del sector, que se dirigen a sus hogares. Su sueño es tener una segunda planta, para separar su vida familiar de la empresarial, adecuando su negocio con toda la infraestructura, que le permita a sus clientes, disfrutar de un ambiente confortable y a ella condiciones productivas optimas, donde desarrollar efectivamente su actividad y comprar materias primas. Su poco espacio se convierte en un desafió, así como su insuficiente capital de trabajo, para hacer adecuaciones pertinentes. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materiales para construcción, con el fin de adecuar los pisos de la terraza donde funciona su negocio. Con esta inversión logrará empezar a cumplir su propósito y sus clientes estarán mas satisfechos con un sitio elegante donde tomar sus alimentos.
texts.en: Zunilda lives in the southwest part of town with her spouse. They have 4 children, aged 3 to 14.  She has a business in her house where she sells fast food on weekends. She started this business 4 years ago, selling hot dogs and hamburgers with one table and one stove and $300,000 COP. She put them on the terrace of her house to take advantage of the fact that residents pass by there on their way home. Her dream is to have a second floor to separate her family life from the business, setting up her business with all of its infrastructure. This would allow her customers to enjoy a comfortable ambience and her to have optimal production conditions where she could do her activities and buy ingredients. Her small space is becoming a challenge, as well as her insufficient working capital for making needed changes. This is why she is turning to a Kiva loan, the first loan she has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy construction materials so she can remodel the floor on the terrace where she runs her business. With this investment, she will be able to achieve her goal and her customers will be more satisfied with an elegant area to eat their food.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to remodel his locale and buy ingredients.

loans.name: Nelis Estela

texts.es:
Nelis, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque se acerca el tiempo de preparar la tierra para los cultivos, ella comprara nuevamente los insumos como el abono, insecticidas y pesticidas, para aplicarlos y poder tener un proceso adecuado de siembra.
El préstamo anterior le permitió realizar un buen cultivo, obteniendo una cosecha abundante,  con lo que pudo pagar el préstamo, sus condiciones han sido más solventes frente a las obligaciones del hogar.
texts.en:
Nelis is asking for a new loan because the time to prepare the land for planting is drawing near. She will buy materials again such as fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides to apply them and have a good planting process.

The previous loan allowed her to have a good crop and obtain an abundant harvest. She was able to pay off the loan and she is more solvent to face her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge, se ha decidió por un nuevo préstamo, para seguir fortaleciendo la panadería comprara harina, huevos, azúcar, jaleas, levadura, que le permitirán elaborar una mayor producción de pan, su objetivo es crecer y espera lograrlo a través del aporte de estos préstamos.
El efecto que tuvo con su préstamo anterior fue positivo, aumentando la producción con los materiales que compro, cambiando sus ingresos y las condiciones para su familia, ahora tiene una mejor condición.
texts.en:
Jorge has decided to take out a new loan to keep strengthening his bread bakery. He will buy flour, eggs, sugar, jellies, and yeast. This will allow him to increase his bread production. His objective is to grow and he hopes to do it with the contribution of these loans. 

The effect that his previous loan had was positive, increasing production with the materials that he bought, changing his income and his family's living condition, which are now better.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, sugar, jellies and yeast.

loans.name: Safadur

texts.en:
Safadur is a 60-year-old man, married with 10 children!  Safadur has been breeding calves and cows for the last 10 years. After he retired, he decided to start his own business because his pension was too small.

Safadur usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then resells for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is about 140 AZN and this business is the only source of financial income in his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, as people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma.  

He wants to expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family. He applied for this 1,500 AZN loan in order to purchase two calves, one milk cow and fodder.  This will be his 4th loan from AqroInvest CU and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy two calves, one milk cow and fodder.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is 46 years old and lives in the town of Soroti in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children, with 4 of them currently in school. For the past 14 years, Micheal has been working hard to manage his retail shop which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Micheal has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities, and will help Micheal to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Micheal hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Micheal is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Micheal who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities.

loans.name: Sinignessigui Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sinignessigui, sont toutes des femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 33 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de N’Tjifina, sous préfecture de Fana.
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de l’arachide, du savon et des gâteaux.                                                                                                                         
Les femmes du groupe Sinignessigui sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter de l’arachide, du savon et de la farine de blé.                                                                                                                                                                                                    
La cliente GNESSOU, première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter 20 kilos d’arachide avec les revendeurs du village pour ensuite les vendre sur place au village et au marché de Nangola à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 7.500FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce d’arachide.
texts.en:
The women belonging to the Sinignessigui group are all married, averaging 33 years of age with two children each, and they all live in traditional extended families in the village of N'Tjifina in the sub-prefecture of Fana. They got to know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They buy and sell groundnuts, soap and cakes.

The women in the Sinignessigue group are on their first group loan, which will be used to buy groundnuts, soap and flour. 

The customer, Gnessou, who is on the far right of the row of women who are standing in the photo, is planning to buy 20 kilos of groundnuts with retailers in the village for resale in the village square and at the market in Nangola to a customer base made of men and women.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 7,500FCFA which will be used for her family's needs, although part will be reinvested in her groundnut trading activity.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts

loans.name: Regzenlham

texts.en:
Regzenlham is a 57-year-old woman who lives with her daughter in the Arhangai province in Central Mongolia. Her daughter studies at the college. She started a business in the chalk industry in 1998. She expanded the business by selling beauty products in 2008. These two business activities are the main income sources for her and her daughter. She is trying really hard to continue the business successfully. She needs to pay for her daughter's college and other expenses by having successful business activities. 

She is a humble woman who says,"I would like to request this loan to expand the business by purchasing the necessary materials for my beauty supply business."  The total amount she is requesting is 2,500,000 MNT to buy beauty supplies.

loans.use: To buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en: Boniface is 37 years old and married with 2 children. He does motor vehicle repairs to earn a living. He has been in the business for 13 years and has employed one person. To earn extra income he sells motor vehicle spare parts. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 60,000 Kenya Shillings to buy auto bearings, car tires and side mirrors.

loans.use: To buy auto bearings, car tires and side mirrors.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées et vivant exclusivement dans des familles nucléaires, les cinq femmes du groupe  Atechi ont  en moyenne 41 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier Bagadadji de la ville de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles font l’achat et la vente de céréales, des produits de beauté et des habillements. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 10 eme  prêt solidaire. Tous les neuf prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté
Madame, Koumba (la première femme assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de  céréales. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 sacs de mil et 6 sacs d’arachide à la foire de Cinzana Gare. Elle effectue ses ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au marché de Ségou et à domicile. 
Avec ce prêt, Koumba espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins du foyer en condiments, en frais scolaire et sanitaire. 
A l’image de Koumba les autres membres du groupe ont pour ambition de construire une maison à usage d’habitation à Ségou.
texts.en:
All of them married and living exclusively in nuclear families, the five women of the group Atechi average 41 years of age and five children each. The women all live in the Bagadadji district of Ségou City (4th administrative region of Mali) and know one another through ties of community, kinship, and marriage. They buy and sell grain, beauty products, and clothing. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their tenth solidarity loan. The previous nine loan were all repaid without any problems at all.

Ms. Koumba (the woman seated first from right to left in the photo) is a major seller of grain. She intends to use her loan to buy 20 sacks of millet and 6 sacks of peanuts at the Cinzana Gare fair. Accepting cash or credit, she sells retail to a customer base composed of men and women at the Ségou market and out of her home.

With this loan, Koumba hopes to make an average monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and meeting household needs in terms of condiments, schooling, and health care for the children.

Just like Koumba, the other members of the group have the ambition to build a house in which to live in Ségou.

loans.use: to buy grain

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées et vivant exclusivement dans des familles traditionnelles, les quatre femmes du groupe Sabougnouman ont  en moyenne 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la commune rurale de Konodomini préfecture de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, de leurs activités professionnelles et de mariage. Elles font l’achat et la vente de  poissons, des condiments alimentaires et de la restauration. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  deuxième  prêt solidaire. Le premier prêt  a été remboursé sans aucune difficulté
Madame, Fatoumata (la première femme assise de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de  poissons de toutes sortes. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 200 kilos de poissons auprès des pêcheurs de village de Konodimini. Elle effectue ses ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs, au marché de Ségou et à domicile. 
Avec ce prêt, Fatoumata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 26.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins du foyer en condiments, en frais scolaire et sanitaire des enfants.
texts.en:
All of them married and living in traditional families, the four women of the group Sabougnouman average 41 years of age and four children each. The women all live in the Commune Rurale of Konodomini in Ségou prefecture (4th administrative region of Mali). They know one another through ties of community, kinship, professional work, and marriage. They buy and sell fish and condiments, and they work in food service. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan. The first loan was repaid without any problems at all.

Ms. Fatoumata (the woman seated first from right to left in the photo) is a major seller of fish of all kinds. She intends to use her loan to buy 200 kg of fish from fisherfolk from the village of Konodimini. Accepting cash or credit, she sells retail to a customer base composed of retailers and consumers at the Ségou market and out of her home.

With this loan, Fatoumata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 26,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and meeting the needs of the household in terms of condiments, schooling, and health care for the children.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Elisse

texts.en: Elisse is 42 years old. He is married to a businesswoman. They have seven children aged between 19 and three, six of whom attend school. He has been selling vegetables for five years. With the loan he wants to buy more tomatoes, carrots and eggplant. He plans to use the profits to pay his children's school fees. In the future, he would like his business to prosper at a high level.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables such as tomatoes, carrots and eggplant to sell.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en: Lea is aged sixty. She has nine children between the ages of thirty-seven and sixteen. All of them have attended school. The oldest is enrolled in the vocational training school for adults. She has been running an art craft business for the past twenty years. With the loan she wants to add more art crafts to sell. She plans to use the profits to pay the children's school fees. In the picture, Lea is at the head office of the bank in parking yard.

loans.use: To buy more arts crafts to sell.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is an entrepreneur who, despite his young age, already owns his business and has formed a family that’s always by his side. He is 27 years old, married, and has a two-year-old child who has always been his motivation to work hard in his business. He started working in grocery stores because his family has had that type of business and he acquired experience there. 

One day he decided to open his own grocery store where he sells basic staple items and thanks to this he contributes to his home’s income. Because he set up the store with very little capital, Ibrahim does not have sufficient money so he can’t offer his customers more products that need to be kept. Because of this, he is requested a youth loan of 250,000 YER from AMB to be able to buy soft drinks and canned foods  to increase the variety of items he offers his customers.

Ibrahim hopes that in this way his customers will find his store still more attractive thus increasing his sales considerably. Also, he hopes that with higher income his family will be able to enjoy a better quality of life. He dreams of having a large grocery distributorship where he can generate employment for people most in need.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and canned foods  to increase the variety of items he offers his customers.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a 27-year-old married man and the father of two children. They live in Sana'a, Yemen. He has been selling phone accessories for three years. This business is improving but, at the same time, competition is increasing. That's why everyone must find a specialty and that's what he is doing. He is a man with very good communication skills who treats his customers in a very attractive and elegant way. He makes special offers all the time to attract new customers and to keep current customers. 

To keep up to date with the new technologies, Ahmed is requesting a youth loan of 100,000 Yemeni rials from AMB to add new mobile phones and special accessories to his merchandise. He hopes to improve and expand his business more and more in the future.

loans.use: to buy new mobile phones for his business.

loans.name: Sultan

texts.en:
Sultan is a 27-year-old married man. He has a child. He operates a grocery business and sells his goods in a shop. He's worked in this business for a few years. His primary customers are neighbors. He describes his greatest business challenge to be fluctuations of market prices. 

Sultan asked for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to purchase bags of sugar and rice, cooking oil and flour. He aspires to open a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bags of sugar, rice, cooking oil and flour for his business.

loans.name: Munkhtulga

texts.en:
Mr. Munkhtulga is a 22-year-old single man who lives with his parents and his sister in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent, in the suburban district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since last autumn Munkhtulga has been offering passenger transportation services with his minivan around the districts, having purchased his vehicle from the market of used cars.

Because he still has not been paid for its entire cost, he is requesting a loan of MNT 2.500.000 to do so. His parents report that Munkhtulga’s new business has been helping to increase their family income day by day.

loans.use: to cover the cost of his minivan.

loans.name: Hammier

texts.en:
Hammier is a 28-year-old married man, the father of a child. He has been working in home products sales, a gas cylinders store, for eight years. He lives in Sana'a, Yemen. In 2004, he opened his present shop and since then has been expanding it gradually. He is a hardworking man who seeks perfection in his business, especially by responding to almost all of his customers' needs. He provides excellent customer service which he believes is the main source of improvement for his business.

Hammier is applying for a youth loan of 400,000 Yemeni rials from AMB in order to increase his merchandise of gas cylinders with special prices. This is his third cycle as an AMB borrower. His previous loan helped a lot in improving his business. He is a borrower in good standing. He hopes he can open new branches in the future.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise of gas cylinders.

loans.name: Evie

texts.en:
A 33-year-old married mother of three children, Evie lives in the Philippines where she has operated a sari-sari store selling canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home-use products and beverages for three years.

Evie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011 and is now requesting a loan for PHP11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Lyan

texts.en: Lyan is a 29-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and has two siblings. In order to satisfy his family's needs, Lyan’s father works non-stop. As for Lyan, he started his career as a musician since 2004. He plays music with high professionalism. Today, he wants to borrow a youth loan from Kiva Partners Ameen s.a.l to purchase a sound mixer for his business. This will improve his show and allow him to attract new customers, as he works on a freelance basis. In the future, he plans to open his own musical equipment shop.

loans.use: purchase a sound mixer

loans.name: Elie

texts.en: Elie is a 29-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and is the only working sibling. His father is the one responsible for covering all their needs, even though they are all cooperating together in order to live a better life. Despite his young age, Elie was capable of starting his own work as a farmer in 2004.  He has many years of experience in this domain. Today, he’s in need of a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase fertilizers, seeds and new agricultural supplies. This loan will improve his productivity, therefore his revenues and thus his way of living. In the future, he plans to buy more land and increase his cultivations.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, seeds and agricultural supplies

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa, 61 years old, lives in the Philippines where she is the married mother of 10 children. For the past five years she has operated a sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, personal-care products, home-use products and beverages.

A member of HSPFI since 2011, Felipa is requesting a loan for PHP15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony, a 30-year-old married father of two, has been welding to earn a living for five years, employing two people in his busy business. He also farms.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Antony has been able to save his income, and hopes to expand his business in the future. He is now requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Eddah

texts.en: Eddah, a 62-year-old married mother of three children, has run a retail business selling general merchandise in Emali for six years now, earning a monthly income of 9,800 shillings. Now requesting her first loan from KADET LTD, she plans to buy more stock including tissues, pampers, basins, plastic jugs, and thermos container for her store. With the resulting  additional profits she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as tissues, pampers, basins, plastic jugs and thermos containers for her store.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

She has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. 

She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Marina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. She has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 2 years. 

She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, breads & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Merlina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, bread & beverages.

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en:
Khitam, 54 years old widowed. She has dedicated herself to the business that she started two years ago, which is a small grocery and food store.

During these two years she has been able to add new items using the profit she makes, but now she has applied for this loan to enhance the store and buy a second refrigerator to prepare for the summer season and fill it with refreshing drinks.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for her store.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is fifty-four years old and married to Nancy. They have four children, all of whom are working except one who is in college. He has been managing rental houses and doing farming for eleven years.

He plans to use the loan to purchase rental house renovation materials. He plans to use the anticipated profit from the business to pay school fees. His hope and dream for the future is to build more rental houses.

loans.use: To buy renovation materials for his rental houses.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is 31 years old and married with two children. She runs a grocery store to earn a living. She has been in the business for 10 years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to pay school fees for her children, and she hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 80,000 Kenya Shillings to buy tomatoes, potatoes, peas and onions to sell.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, potatoes, peas and onions to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 34-year-old married man and the father of three children. In 2008 Ali opened his own patisserie where he bakes & sells his delicious sweets. He has thirteen years of experience in this field, which helped him a lot in starting his own business and gaining customers' trust & support. His sweets are very tasty, and highly recommended by his customers. 

Ali is applying for a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary raw materials to increase his production. This is his first time as an Al Majmoua borrower, and he hopes that the future experiences will bring him future success and happiness to his family.

loans.use: To buy necessary raw materials to increase his production.

loans.name: Talent Group

texts.fr:
Mme AMINA  est la représentante du groupe TALENT. Elle est mariée  et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 16ans et le moins âgé a 03ans.  02  vont à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des pagnes et draps de lit depuis  08ans. Elle s’approvisionne  à LOME au TOGO. Ses clients sont  les  femmes et hommes.
Elle veut  s’acheter  50 pièces de pagne.

Elle utilise  ses bénéfices pour la scolarité de ses enfants à école supérieure. Elle ambitionne aider son mari pour l’électrification de leur maison.
texts.en:
Amina is the representative of the TALENT group.  She is married and the mother of three children.  Her oldest child is 16 years old, the youngest is 3.  Two of her children attend school.  She is financially responsible for three people.

Amina has been selling pagnes (colorful West-African fabrics) and bed sheets for 8 years.  She buys her merchandise in Lomé, Togo.  Her clients are men and women.  She would like to buy 50 sets of pagnes.

Amina uses her profits to pay for her children's higher education fees.  Her goal is to be able to help her husband install electricity inside their house.

loans.use: to buy 50 pagnes (colorful West-African fabrics)

loans.name: Joner

texts.en:
Joner is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 4 children. He has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. He has had this business for 3 years. 

He requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Joner has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is married with 4 children. She is 44 years old. She sells a variety of meals to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan to buy raw ingredients to make a variety of viands to sell.

She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Genara hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make a variety of viands to sell.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 52 years old, married, and has eight children, three of whom are attending school. She and her spouse operate a small eatery business in front of a school. This way, they generate about P5,000 each month. Aside from cooking and selling meals, Tessie is also raising hogs to sell. All they want is to make the family financially stable and have a better way of living. 

She would like to borrow a loan of P20,000 to buy ingredients used in cooking meals and supplies for the maintenance of the hog raising business. With the help of this additional capital, she will ensure good growth of her hogs and make improvements in the eatery business.

Tessie would like to keep providing good service to her customers and gradually save funds for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients used in cooking meals and supplies for the maintenance of her hog raising business.

loans.name: Anwi

texts.en:
Anwi is married with one child and they live in Nitop One, a quarter in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon and do her business at the food market Bamenda where many people go to get  their food items . The main challenges she has faced in life include ill health in her family, poverty and not being able to provide basic necessities for her family:  all these things she hates thinking about.

Anwi joined GHAPE in the year 2000 and has taken out and successfully repaid her loans 10 times. With this new loan she will buy foodstuffs like beans, palm oil, corn, groundnuts and salt for resale.  To make further profit and as an addition to her business, she will buy and rear piglets and chicks for resale. She thinks her business will succeed because of its longevity. She also has a good business site and the community will benefit from this activity from the animal droppings and also the supply of foodstuff at all times.

The profit from the loan will be used for her child's education, the provision of family needs and to also expand her business. Anwi says that GHAPE loans are preferable because of the low interest with a convenient repayment time.

loans.use: to pay for groundnuts, corn, salt, beans, palm oil, piglets, fowls and feed

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is patiently selling fruits and vegetables to the people in the village where her family lives. She is married to Rex and he is her partner in the business. Together, they are raising four children. The couple wants to provide a good education for their children, so they have been running this business for over 10 years now and earn about P6,000 monthly.
 
This time, Irene is borrowing a loan of P23,000 to buy tomatoes, cabbages, eggplant, bananas and mangoes to sell. She would like to increase their sales. The couple is working toward the diversification of their business and to keep providing better service to their customers.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbages, eggplant, bananas and mangoes to sell

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is married and blessed with three children. To provide sustenance for the family, she is selling fruits and vegetables to the people in her neighborhood. She had been doing it for over 10 years now. She is happy with the kind of business she has even though she only generates minimal income from it. She usually acquires about P3,000 each month selling fruits and vegetables.
  
She would like to increase her sales capacity to improve her income, but she has insufficient funds now. She would like to borrow a loan of P14,000 to buy cabbages, bananas, tomatoes and squash to sell.

With continuous patience and hard work, Mary Rose's family will achieve a better way of living someday.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, bananas, tomatoes and squash to sell.

loans.name: Che

texts.en:
Che is a widow with five children and they live in Ntambessi, a quarter in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced challenges in life such as the death of her husband, poverty and sickness in the family.

Che joined GHAPE in the year 2003 and has taken out and repaid her loans successfully five times with the most recent loan amount being 150.000 FRS. With the new loan she will buy farm seedlings like beans, maize, yams and cocoyams and she also intends to undertake the sale of cooked food (koki). She is positive that her business will succeed because of its longevity and because she has regular customers who always buy her cooked food in larger quantities. The community will benefit from this activity by having a regular supply of cooked food at all times and she will be able to sell to them at low prices.

Che says that, with the profit from the loan, she will help her family by providing them with the basic necessities of life like food, clothing and shelter, and will also provide medication and, in addition, will educate her children and assist her grandchildren.

loans.use: To pay for farm seedlings e.g. beans, cocoyams, yams and maize, and for ingredients for cooked food, e.g. koki beans and palm oil

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Rosalinda has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Rosalinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Vergenia

texts.en:
Vergenia is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children.

Vergenia has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for threeyears. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Vergenia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Vergenia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 40 years old. She is a widow with two children and is from Dela Paz, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Jane used her last loan to purchase additional mobile phones to sell. Her business has grown and become successful. 

Now she's taking a new loan to purchase additional retailer SIM cards to sell. She hopes to be able to grow her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase additional retailer sim cards to sell.

loans.name: Ankadignonye Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Ankadignonye, sont toutes des femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Barouéli. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de l’arachide, des habillements et des bijoux.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Ankadignonye sont à leur septième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                         
La cliente FANTA,  assise au milieu, compte acheter 5 sacs de 100 kilos d’arachide avec les revendeurs de Fana et de Konobougou, pour ensuite les vendre à Tamani et sur place à domicile et en ambulante dans la ville de Konobougou à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de l’arachide.
texts.en:
The members of the group Ankadignonye are married women who, on average, are 35 years old and have three children each, and live in extended traditional families in the city of Barouéli.

They know one another as neighbors and through ties of friendship and kinship. They sell groundnuts, clothing, and jewelry, and they are seeking their seventh group loan.

FANTA, sitting in the center of the photo, plans to use her loan to buy five 100 kg bags of groundnuts from resellers in Fana and Konobougou for resale in Tamani and on site at home, as well as door to door in Konobougou, to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 10,000CFAF, which she will use to provide for the needs of the family. A portion will be reinvested in her activity.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Sebekai Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sebekai, sont toutes des femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 34 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Barouéli 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de tubercules, de fruits, d’habillement, des fruits et légumes et de bijoux.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Sebekai sont à leur seizième prêt solidaire 
La cliente ATOUMATA, deuxième personne à partir de la droite, compte acheter quatre sacs d’igname de 140 kilos, cinq sacs de pomme de terre de 80 kilos, quatre sacs d’oignon de 50 kilos et de la banane Plantain pour 20 000F CFA avec les grossistes de Bamako pour ensuite les vendre sur place à domicile et en ambulante dans la ville de Baroueli à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de tubercules et de fruits.
texts.en:
The women of the Sebekai group are all married. On average, they are 34 years old with 3 children each, and all of them live in traditional extended families in the town of Barouéli. 
They met through connections with family and friends, and in the neighborhood. The women sell tubers, fruit, clothing, vegetables and jewelry.                                                                                                                          
This is the group's sixteenth solidarity loan. 
Atoumata, second from the right, plans to buy four 140-kilo sacks of yams, five 80-kilo sacks of potatoes, four 50-kilo sacks of onions and plantain bananas for 20,000 CFA francs from the wholesalers in Bamako. She will then sell the goods locally from her home and on foot in the town of Barouéli to customers who are both men and women.
She expects to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 CFA francs, which she will use to pay for her family's expenses. Some of the profit will be reinvested in her business selling tubers and fruit.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Marionito

texts.en: Marionito is a married man with two children. Marionito is 40 years old and resides at Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He used his last loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. His business is successful, and he is taking out a new loan to pay for labor costs in farm maintenance. In the future he hopes to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs in farm maintenance

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 32-year-old married man, father of two children. In 2008 Hassan opened his own business, which deals with selling bed shields and blankets necessary to every house.

Hassan is a hardworking man. He seeks perfection in his life and business. His quality of products is very good and affordable to almost everyone.

Hassan applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to open a new lingerie business that will help in improving his social and financial situations.

Hassan's reputation helps him a lot in attracting new customers and keeping old ones.

Hassan hopes to keep on expanding his business as much as he can.

loans.use: To open a new lingerie business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane  is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Mary Jane  is providing "motorela" or motorcycle services. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service.

Mary Jane  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Mary Jane  hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to buy  motor parts and gasoline for the service

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Lolo, composé de femmes mariées et de veuves, ont en moyenne 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Konobougou
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, d’habits, de tabac et des céréales.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Lolo sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire                                                                                                                                                                                                    
La cliente FANTA, deuxième personne à partir de la droite, compte acheter 3 paniers de tomate, 50 kilos d’oignon avec les fournisseurs de Konobougou pour ensuite les vendre sur place à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en:
The women of the Lolo group are either married or widowed. On average, they are 40 years old with 4 children each, and all of them live in traditional extended families in the town of Konobougou.
They met through connections with family and friends, and in the neighborhood. The women sell condiments, clothing, tobacco, and grains.                                                                                                                          
The women in the Lolo group are on their sixth solidarity loan.                                                                                                                                                                                                    
Fanta, second from the right, plans to buy 3 baskets of tomatoes and 50 kilos of onions from sellers in Konobougou. Then she will re-sell these items locally to customers who are both men and women.
She expects to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs, which she will use to pay for her family's expenses. Some of the profit will be reinvested in her business selling condiments.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma, 38, is married and has three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, the Philippines. 

Elma used her last loan to purchase additional fertilizers for her farm. Her business has grown and become successful. 

Now she's taking a new loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She hopes to be able to grow her business more.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Pacencia

texts.en: Pacencia is from the village of Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old, widowed, and has four children. Pacencia used her last loan to purchase additional fish to sell. Her business has grown and become successful. Now, she's taking a new loan to purchase additional fish to sell. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow her business further.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 48 years old and married with four children. He runs a cafeteria to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and has employed three people. He describes his business environment as very busy because many people do business in that environment. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy wheat flour, cooking oil and rice.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, cooking oil and rice

loans.name: Ricci

texts.en:
Ricci is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Ricci has a food/retail shop (sari-sari store) where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy stocks like snacks, canned goods, noodles & beverages.

Ricci has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Ricci hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as snacks, canned goods, noodles & beverages

loans.name: Comfort Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth, who is in her mid 30s, is married with three children who go to school. She has been sewing bedsheets for decoration, and selling sarongs and fabrics for two years now.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she wants to use for buying more bedsheet materials for decoration, sarongs and fabrics to resell.  Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house

She will share this loan with her loan group "Comfort" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more bedsheet materials, sarongs and fabrics.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Nena has a piggery and she sells grown & matured pigs. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Nena has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Nena  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of animal feed and vitamins

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en: Avelino is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 47 years old. Avelino is married and has four children. Avelino used his last loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. His business is successful, and he is taking out a new loan to pay for the irrigation of the farm. In the future he hopes to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to pay for the irrigation of the farm

loans.name: Express Group

texts.en:
Halima, who is in her mid 20s, is married and has two children. One is in school and the other is still a baby. She has been running a business of selling tomatoes for two years now. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 11:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more tomatoes to resell and has paid back her loan successfully. She wants a loan to further increase her tomato stock to resell. Her dream is to one day able sell clothes.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Express," which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase her stock of tomatoes to resell.

loans.name: Safi

texts.en:
Safi is 32 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, with three of them currently in school. 

For the past 10 years, Safi has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Safi has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and it will help Safi to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Safi hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Safi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Safi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Benvenida

texts.en:
Benvenida is a widow with six children. She currently lives in Guba, Clarin Misamis Occidental. 

She used her last loan to purchase corn fertilizer for her farm. 

Now she's taking a new loan to buy another bundle of fertilizer for her farm. She hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy another bundle of fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Hamidi

texts.en:
Hamidi is a 52-year-old married man, father of five children. He has worked in fixing and selling diesel generators since 2000. Hamidi is a hardworking man with a special talent in his business.

He is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy diesel generators to trade with. This is Hamidi's first time as a Kiva borrower. He hopes this loan will bring him more success in the future.

He hopes to provide his family with the best living ever, and to expand his business more and more to provide them with everything they need.

loans.use: To buy diesel generators to fix and sell.

loans.name: Pho

texts.en: Pho, 53, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for over 10 years, earning approximately 3 USD per day. Her husband is a basket producer who earns about 2 USD per day. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about 9 USD per day. Pho wants to build a new house. With this goal in mind, Pho is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to pay for the construction of her house. By doing so, she will be able to provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children obtain a specific skill.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of her house

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a 51-year-old livestock seller in Majaoni, Mombasa. He is married. He has been selling livestock for the past 20 years successfully. 

This is his second loan from KADET LTD. He plans to buy more cows, goats, and sheep to resell to his customers. He will use the proceeds to buy more livestock and use the rest of the money to repay his loan. 

He hopes to have a successful business and a financially stable family.

loans.use: to buy more cows, goats, and sheep

loans.name: Ada Cristela

texts.es:
Ada, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para invertirlo en el negocio, pues comprara 4 cerdos más, con la intensión de crecer en su granja, pues entre mas disponga de cerdos, será mejor la disponibilidad para ofrecer a los clientes.
Ella ha tenido un efecto positivo en su granja, ya que las compras le han dado la oportunidad de tener para la venta, sus ingresos han mejorado, esta junto a su familia prosperando en el comercio de los cerdos.
texts.en:
Ada has decided on a new loan to invest in her business.  She will buy four more pigs in order to expand her farm.  The more pigs that she has ready will improve the availability to offer her customers.

She has had a positive effect on her farm.  The purchases have given her the opportunity to make sales, her income has improved, and she is prospering together with her family  in the business of selling pigs.

loans.use: to buy four pigs.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
 
Julie has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. Julie requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Julie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Julie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married. She has three children. Jocelyn is 35 years old and she lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

She used her last loan to purchase additional stock for her store. Her business is successful, and she's taking a new loan to purchase new items to expand her product offering. 

In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha, who has six children, lives in Kinuman Norte, Ozamis City. She is 48 years old and married. Editha has owned and operated a coconut-production business for four years and gains 7,000 Philippine pesos doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 to pay for the labor cost in coconut harvesting. In 2010, Editha joined GDMPC. In the future, Editha wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost in coconut harvesting

loans.name: Timinadja Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Timinadja, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 46 ans et 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce d’habits et d’arachide.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Timinadja sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente SITAN,  première personne à partir de la gauche, dans le rang des debouts, compte acheter 3 sacs de 100 kilos d’arachide avec les revendeurs de la ville pour ensuite les vendre sur place dans la ville à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce d’arachide.
texts.en:
The members of the group Timinadja are married women who on average are 46 years old and have five children each, and who live in extended traditional families in the city of Fana. They know one another as neighbors and through ties of friendship and kinship. They work in food services, clothing sales and groundnut sales. This is their fifth group loan. 

SITAN, standing first from the left, plans to buy three 100 kg bags of groundnuts from local resellers to sell on site, in the city, to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000CFAF, which she will use to provide for the needs of the family. A portion will be reinvested in her activity.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is married and raising his only child. He has been involved in caring for pigs to sell for over a year. Since his parents raised him through this kind of business, he gained plenty of experience. Now, he is currently caring for two piglets. 

A 27-year-old man, he also works in his neighbor's field. It was his extra occupation, as he could not sell his pigs. In order to dispose of his pigs at a higher price, he is requesting a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos to buy feed and vitamins. He hopes to gain profitable sales in order to save for the educational purposes of his child and future children.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins

loans.name: Fanice

texts.en: Fanice is 44 years old and married with three children. She runs a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in business for six years and has employed two people. She describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a hair drier, hair chemicals, and a blow dry machine.

loans.use: to buy a hair drier, hair chemicals, and a blow dry machine.

loans.name: Yesenia Beatriz

texts.es:
Yesenia, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para ampliar el negocio, comprándose frutas frescas como papayas, sandias, piñas, jocotes, melón, pues quiere mantener una variedad de frutas para aprovechar a vender más.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le sirvió mucho, pues logro salir con sus ventas y tener dinero para las necesidades del hogar, así como para pagar el préstamo.
texts.en:
Yesenia has decided on a new loan in order to expand her business.  She will do this by purchasing fresh fruit like papayas, watermelon, pineapples, plums, and melons.  She wants to maintain a variety of fruit in order to sell more.

She feels that the previous loan was of great use to her.  She managed to make her sales, have money for the household necessities and to pay down the loan.

loans.use: to buy papayas, watermelon, pineapples, plums, and melons.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia, solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de verduras y frutas frescas: papas, güisquiles, yuca, plátano, manzanas, papayas, piña, mangos, con esto lograra surtir el negocio, para poder ofrecer a los clientes producto de calidad.
Ella manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior, logro realizar una buena inversión, esto le genero mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Emilia is requesting a new loan to buy fresh vegetables and fruit: potatoes, chayote, yucca, bananas, apples, papaya, pineapple, and mangoes.  With this she will supply her business and be able to sell her customers a quality product.

She says that with the previous loan she managed to make a good investment, which generated her better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, chayote, yucca, bananas, apples, papaya, pineapple, and mangoes.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 35 years old, married and has three children.  She works in the souvenir and pottery business, which she has been doing since 1995.

Amina has much experience in this field and her pottery is highly requested since few people still do this kind of work.  She is very talented in her domain and most of he customers are very loyal. Amina works hard to improve her business, update her designs, and keep her customers pleased with the requested items.

To improve her work, Amina is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, which she will use to buy necessary raw materials for her business and to increase her merchandise with special souvenirs designs. Amina hopes to keep on improving her business to provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase necessary raw materials for her business

loans.name: Hosbon

texts.en:
Hosbon is a 24-year-old retail shop proprietor in Kilifi. He is a married father of one. He has been a shopkeeper for the past two years and he is doing great. 

This marks his second business loan from KADET to finance his business. He plans to purchase more stock of sugar, cooking fat, washing detergents and rice. He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan. He hopes to do well in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of sugar, cooking fat, washing detergents and rice

loans.name: Koku

texts.fr:
Koku est  un homme âgé de 31 ans. Il est marié  å une  revendeuse.
Koku travaille comme revendeur de produits congelés depuis 2010. Il sert ses clients dans une boutique et s’approvisionne dans un magasin de produits congelés.
