Koku a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits congelés pour satisfaire ses clients.Il veut élargir son activité en ayant une chambre froide afin d'acheter les marchandises en quantités.
texts.en:
Koku is a 31-year-old man. He is married to a retailer.

Koku has been selling frozen goods since 2010. He serves his clients in a boutique and buys his goods from a frozen goods store.

Koku sought his first loan from WAGES in order to buy frozen goods to satisfy his customers. He wants to expand his business by acquiring a cold storage unit so that he can buy his goods in bulk.

loans.use: to buy frozen goods

loans.name: Virah

texts.en: Virah is 30 years old, married, and has two children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in this business for two years and describes her customers as low income earners because they live in slums. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy sodas, sugar, maize flour, and rice to sell.

loans.use: To buy sodas, sugar, maize flour, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is 68 years old, married to Priscah and blessed with 9 children between the ages of 6 and 18 years. Albert owns a boutique, a business he started five years ago and earns a monthly income of 4,000 KES. 

He has requested a loan of 100,000 KES to purchase 10 pieces of leather jackets, clothes materials, lady's skirt suits and trousers for sale. 

The profit he makes will help him educate his children and buy a milk cow. His dream is to buy a plot and build rental houses on it and a posho mill for additional income. This is his sixth loan.

loans.use: to purchase leather jackets, clothes materials, lady's skirt suits and trousers.

loans.name: Haidee

texts.en:
The primary source of income of Haidee is caring for pigs. Her husband also helps her in this business in order to promote better lives. She is very hardworking, as well as her three children and they all work together well. Haidee is dreaming for a better quality of life, so she trained her children to be industrious and helpful.

In accordance to her dream, she is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is very hopeful that through this loan and their teamwork, they will achieve a better life soon.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is a hardworking father and responsible husband to Juliet. They live within the village of Villa Marzo. The couple has been blessed with two children. The eldest is in primary school while the youngest is still an infant.

Romeo has been a hog raiser for more than seven years. Aside from his livestock business, he is also engaged in the rice farming business. Romeo aims to improve his livestock business in order to gain more profits to sustain his family's needs. He is currently raising one sow and ten piglets. According to him, raising large number of piglets requires more capital because of the livestock feed that they will consume day by day. With this in mind, he is asking for a loan amount of PHP 15,000 which will be used to buy livestock feed and vaccines. Romeo expects that the requested loan amount will be granted so that he can save some for his children's education and improve their living condition.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and vaccines for his hog-raising business.

loans.name: Fanis Maritza

texts.es:
Fany, está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales para iniciar la nueva siembra, pues comprara abono, semilla, que es lo necesario para que su cultivo de pipián pueda dar inicio.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo para mejorar la calidad de la cosecha, aumentando la producción, con esto Fany ha podido mejorar los ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Fany is requesting a loan to buy materials to start the new planting.  She will buy fertilizer and seed, which is what is necessary to start her pipian squash crop.

The previous loan helped her improve the quality of her crop, increasing the production.  With this Fany has been able to improve her family's income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, pues quiere comprarse más mercadería (licores), ya que esto le ayudara para tener más capacidad para atender a los clientes.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo con respecto al negocio, porque logro realizar la inversión, en su caso particular, tuvo algunos inconvenientes de salud, pero que están siendo superados.
texts.en:
José has decided to get another loan because he wants to buy more merchandise (liquor).  This will help him be better able to serve his customers.

The previous loan helped him with his business because he managed to make the investment.  In his particular case, he had some health problems, but that are now being overcome.

loans.use: to buy liquor.

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
Ana, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, porque sus deseos de seguir superándose la motivan, para realizar una nueva inversión en la compra de perfumería, este préstamo le ayudara para tener nuevos perfumes que sean del agrado de los clientes.
El efecto que tuvo el préstamo anterior en el negocio, fue positivo, pues sus ventas aumentaron, así logro tener más ingresos para sus necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
Ana has decided to ask for a new loan, because her desire to continue succeeding is motivating her to undertake a new investment into purchasing perfumes.

This loan will help her to have new perfumes which will be to the liking of her customers.

The effect of the earlier loan on her business was positive, as her sales increased, and so she was able to have more income for her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase perfume.

loans.name: Yamila Jeanneth

texts.es:
Yamila, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para mejorar la tienda que ha instalado, ella comprara más mercadería como boquitas, gaseosas, pastas, harina, condimentos, pues su aspiración es variar los productos y mantener de aquellos que sus clientes necesiten más.
El préstamo anterior le dio a Yamila, una mayor seguridad para atender los trabajos de sastreria a la clientela, pues obtuvo los materiales necesarios para confeccion, dándole mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Yamila has decided to ask for a new loan to improve the store that she has set up.  She will purchase more merchandise such as snacks, pasta, flour, and spices, as her goal is to vary her products and keep those that her customers need most.

The previous loan gave Yamila greater security in her work providing tailoring services for customers, as she obtained the necessary materials for doing it, providing her with improved earnings.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, sodas, pasta, flour and spices.

loans.name: Esmeralda Guadalupe

texts.es:
Esmeralda, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para seguir trabajando en su negocio, comprara pollos de engorde y concentrado, para crecer en la granja y multiplicar sus ganancias. 
Ella tuvo una experiencia positiva de los préstamos anteriores, aumentando las ventas en el negocio, esto le ha permitido que su familia cuente con mejores ingresos todo debido al buen manejo del dinero del préstamo.
texts.en:
Esmeralda has decided to ask for a new loan to continue working in her business.  She will purchase broiler chickens and concentrated feed, to raise them in her farmyard and multiply her earnings.

She had a positive experience with her previous loans, which increased her business' sales.  This allowed her family to have greater income, all thanks to good management of the money from the loan.

loans.use: to purchase broiler chickens and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Cesar Tulio

texts.es: César de 45 años vive en el sur occidente de la ciudad con su esposa, de oficio confeccionista,  y sus  3 hijos en las edades de 8 a 15 años. Oriundo de Palmito, población del departamento de Sucre, llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde vive hace 22 años y hace 10 se dedicó a la venta de comidas rápidas, pues anteriormente se dedicaba a la albañilería.  Él aprovecha muy bien su clientela usual, porque allí mismo, vende minutos a celulares y esto le oxigena los dos negocios, ubicados en su propia casa. Su meta mas adelante es ampliarlos, adecuando sus instalaciones locativas. Así mismo sueña con ver convertidos a sus hijos en profesionales exitosos y esto lo mueve día a día.   En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará comidas rápidas, butifarras, chorizo, etc., pues requiere aumentar su oferta productiva, en tanto su clientela ha aumentado y cada día exige mucha variedad y esta son justamente las razones por las cuales acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará sus materias primas y será exitosa su inversión, porque lo hará fundamentado en su experiencia  y en la demanda actual de su mercado.
texts.en:
César, age 45, lives in the southwest part of the city.  He lives with his wife, a seamstress, and their three children between the ages of 8 and 15.  Coming from Palmito, a town in the Sucre department, he arrived at the city of Barranquilla.  

He has lived in Barranquilla for 22 years, and he has been selling fast food for 10 years.  He previously worked as a bricklayer.  He takes very good advantage of having regular clientel because he sells minutes for cell phones right where he sells fast food.  This puts new life in both businesses, which are located in his house.

His goal for later on is to expand them by adapting his business site.  He dreams of seeing his children become successful professionals.  This encourages him every day.

He is currently applying for a Kiva loan.  He will use the loan to buy fast food and sausages.  He needs to increase his production because his clientele has increased.  They require a lot of variety.  

These are the exact reasons that he requests a Kiva loan, which is the first financing he has had with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use the loan to buy raw materials.  His investment will be successful because it will be based on his experience and the current demand of his market.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make fast food.

loans.name: Talal

texts.en:
Talal is a 39-year-old married man who is the father of two children. Since 2008, he has provided transportation services, moving water, pebbles, and other agricultural items. His work is going just fine, but his tractor needs necessary maintenance to keep it in good operating condition. His tractor is important to provide his family with an income for their everyday living expenses. That's why he applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. He will also use part of the loan to invest in starting a new business that will positively impact his financial and social situations.

Talal is a hardworking man, with a very good reputation. He works hard to please his family and customers as much as he can. This will all be done with the help of the loan he hopes to receive.

loans.use: To perform necessary maintenance to his tractor and to invest in a new business

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Chin, 43, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than five years, earning approximately 3 USD per day. Her husband provides public transportation services (motor taxi). He earns about 3 USD per day.

Due to the difficulty of her family’s personal transportation situation, Chin is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase will help her reduce her transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to run a poultry farm and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to build a new wooden house to provide convenient living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
Feliza, age 57, is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase feed and vitamins for her livestock. She is hoping to increase her pig headcount and expand the business with the increased profits. With the help of her three children and her husband, she is hoping for higher yields of income as she sells her pigs. 

In the future, she knows that she will achieve a comfortable life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es: José recibió anteriormente su credikiva con el cual compró panes, frutas legumbres y verduras en una buena proporción y las vendió rápidamente. Hoy quiere invertir nuevamente en panes, tambien incursionará  en el comercio de artesanías como hamacas, bolsos, sandalias, adornos, y accesorios femeninos; él tiene muchos pedidos de sus clientes  y está fortaleciendo este mercado. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Gracias a su apoyo, mi negocio ha crecido, me ha generado ingresos, con los cuales he mejorado de gran manera mi casa. Los bendigo, en el nombre de Dios y los felicito por su buena labor humanitaria”.
texts.en: José previously received a credikiva with which he purchased bread, fruit, pulses and vegetables in large quantities and he sold them quickly. Today he would like to invest in bread again. He will also enter the market of handcrafts such as hammocks, bags, sandals, ornaments and women's accessories. He has many customer orders and this market is growing. His message for the Kiva's financial backers is the following: "Thank you for your support. My business has grown and I have generated an income which which I have greatly improved my house. God bless you and I praise you for your good humanitarian work".

loans.use: to buy crafts such as hammocks, bags, sandals, ornaments and women's accessories

loans.name: Eugenio De Jesus

texts.es:
Eugenio, quiere seguir cultivando, para solicita un préstamo que le ayude a realizar la compra de los insumos como el abono, herbicidas y preparación del terreno, pues su trabajo continuo en la tierra es el que le permite mantener a su familia.
Él manifiesta que su experiencia con el préstamo anterior fue positiva, ya que obtuvo una buena cosecha, para la alimentación de la familia y cancelo su préstamo sin ningún inconveniente e instalo la energía en la vivienda. De esta misma manera espera trabajar este nuevo financiamiento.
texts.en:
Eugenio wants to continue farming and is asking for a loan that will help him buy supplies like manure, herbicide and to prepare the parcel of land because his continuous work in the fields is what allows him to support his family.

He states that his experience with the previous loan was positive because he obtained a good harvest to feed his family and he repaid the loan problem free and installed electricity in his house.  He expects to work with this new loan the same way.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicide and to prepare the parcel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron, wire and metal sheets.

loans.name: Feiruz

texts.en: Feiruz is a 24-year-old business lady who sells shoes in Mombasa. She is a married mother of one and has been selling shoes for the past two years with success. This marks her first business loan from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase more shoes to sell to her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and expand her business further. She hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Mr Kokou est un homme âgé de 36ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse et a un enfant de 03ans. Il est revendeur de bouteilles de gaz et divers dans une boutique de la place. Il s’approvisionne à Lomé. Il est à son second crédit à WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des bouteilles de gaz. Il veut multiplier son lieu d’activité, et être en mesure de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr. Kokou is  36 years old. His wife is a vendor, and they have a 3-year old child. He sells gas bottles and miscellaneous items in a local store. He stocks up in Lomé. He is on his second loan from WAGES and is seeking this loan in order to buy more gas bottles. He would like to have several vending points and be able to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy gas bottles and miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Mauricio Antonio

texts.es: Mauricio es un hombre de 44 años, que vive al sur de la ciudad con su esposa y su hijo de 13 años; allí se dedica al comercio de autopartes de toda clase, su ubicación en un sitio muy cercano a talleres automotriz, hace que fluyan sus ventas día a día. De esta manera su capital de trabajo se convierte en su principal desafío para tener surtido su negocio. Su meta mas adelante, es tener puntos comerciales o almacenes en varios sectores de la ciudad, para abordar gran parte del mercado que no es atendido. Mauricio está aplicando a su primer credikiva, porque invertirá en accesorios y repuestos de vehículos, rines suspensiones etc,, pues aprovechará las oportunidades de comprar en mayor volumen, para poner en marcha sus habilidades de comerciante, aprendidas desde antes de emprender su negocio, cuando era el agente vendedor de una empresa que manejaba la misma línea de productos,  que hoy él  tiene, en su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Mauricio is a 44-year-old man who lives in the southern part of the city with his wife and 13-year-old child.  There he works selling all types of auto parts.

His location in a place very close to automotive shops influences his sales from day to day.  In this way his working capital turns into his main challenge, to have his business stocked.  His long-term goal is to have commercial areas or stores in various parts of the city, to reach a large part of the market that is not served.

Mauricio is requesting his first Kiva loan because he will invest in car parts and accessories, rims, suspensions, etc.  He will take advantage of opportunities to buy in quantity to use his abilities as a dealer.  He learned this before he set up his business, when he was the sales agent for a company that handled the same line of products that he has today in his own business.

loans.use: to invest in automobile accessories and parts, rims, suspensions, etc.

loans.name: Marta Lorena

texts.es:
Marta, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para darle continuidad al negocio de los mariscos y quiere invertir en frutas, comprara pescado fresco, conchas, mandarinas, naranjas, mangos, bananos, esto con la esperanza de tener demanda de los clientes para sacarle ganancia al préstamo.
Ella manifiesta que la inversión anterior le dio un efecto positivo, ya que agrego otro rubro más al negocio con las frutas, el buen manejo del préstamo y de la inversión, le han dado a la familia de Marta de gozar de mejoras en sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Marta is asking for a new loan to give her seafood business continuity and she also wants to invest in fruit.  She will buy fresh fish, conchs, mandarins, oranges, mangoes and bananas hoping to have customer demand to earn profits on the loan.

She states that her previous loan had positive effects in that she added another line of work with the fruit.  Managing the loan and her investment well allowed Marta’s family to enjoy improved income.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish, conchs, mandarins, oranges, mangoes and bananas.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
Juan, está animado por seguir trabajando, pues su familia depende mucho de él, por esta razón solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de cremas, y artículos eléctricos, tambien zapatos, sandalias, cepillos, y más para poder surtir el negocio y disponer de mucha mercadería.
El considera que a través del préstamo anterior ha logrado mantenerse, pues realizo una buena inversión, dándole una mejor capacidad y solvencia económica con las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is encouraged to continue working because his family depends on him very much.  Because of this he’s asking for a new loan to buy creams, electrical devices and also shoes, sandals and brushes to be able to stock his business and have much merchandise available.

He feels that through the previous loan he was able to stay in business because he made a good investment resulting in better capacity and economic solvency with respect to his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy creams, electrical items, shoes, sandals and brushes.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin, quiere seguir invirtiendo en el negocio de la sastrería, comprara telas, hilos, boches, botones, con esto estará en mejor condición para continuar fabricando las prendas de vestir de su familia.
Su efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior le ha dado mejoras en sus ingresos, la construcción de un muro en su vivienda, y que sus clientes estén satisfechos con su trabajo realizado, tambien a adquirido una máquina de coser nueva, para mejorar y agilizar el trabajo.
texts.en:
Martín wants to continue investing in his tailor shop buying fabric, thread, fasteners and buttons.  With this, he’ll be in better condition to continue manufacturing his family’s clothes.

The positive effect from his previous loan was improved income, erecting a wall at home and his satisfied customers with the work he did.  He also acquired a new sewing machine to improve and speed up his work.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, fasteners and buttons.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro, necesita comprar más mercadería para el negocio, por eso solicita este préstamo para poder realizar la inversión en zapatos de vestir y deportivos para ambos sexos, con esto lograra mantenerse competente en el mercado.
Él considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo para comprarse mercadería y mantener lo necesario para la venta.
texts.en:
Ramiro needs to buy more merchandise for his business.  He is requesting this loan to be able to make the investment in dress shoes and casual shoes for both sexes.  With this he will be able to maintain himself competently in the market.

He considers that the previous loan helped him buy himself merchandise and keep what was necessary for the business.

loans.use: to buy dress shoes and casual shoes.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
Carlota, solicita un nuevo préstamo, para la compra de materia prima, además considera que estos préstamos son un medio de mucha ayuda para prosperar en el negocio y aportar a sus hijos para la educación. Ella comprara leña, barro, nacazcol y pago de transporte, además quiere construirse un rancho para proteger el horno donde cocina la loza.
El efecto del préstamo anterior fue positivo, ayudándole a obtener lo necesario para la elaboración de loza, su nucleó familiar se mantiene, su negocio se encuentra estable, tiene a sus dos hijos estudiando.
texts.en:
Carlota is requesting a new loan to purchase raw materials. She also regards these loans as a great source of help in the growth of her business and contributing to her children's education. She will buy wood, clay, nacazcol seeds and pay for transport. She would also like to build a hut to shelter the oven where she makes the crockery.

Her previous loan had a positive effect by helping her to get what she need to make the crockery and to support her family unit. Her business is also stable and her two children are studying.

loans.use: to buy wood, clay, nacazcol seeds and pay for transportation

loans.name: Erika Margarita

texts.es:
Erika, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder fortalecer el negocio, pues la temporada de semana santa aprovecha a vender más productos, comprara camarones, pescado, gaseosas, para la venta, pues en esta temporada muchos turistas llegan a degustar de mariscos.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a incrementar el negocio, obteniendo productos frescos, esto le permitió  tener mas oportunidades de venta.
texts.en:
Erika is asking for a new loan to strengthen her business because Holy Week is a time when she can make more sales.  She will buy shrimp, fish and soft-drinks to sell because during this season many tourists come by to enjoy seafood.

Her previous loan helped her increase business obtaining fresh products which provided her with more sales opportunities.

loans.use: to buy shrimp, fish and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora y empeñosa que está logrando salir adelante poco a poco. Ella se convirtió en microempresaria en el instante en que empezó a vender ropa como recorredora, actividad a la que viene dedicándose unos cuantos años, fue gracias a su trabajo en un fundo, que ha logrado juntar poco a poco los ahorros necesarios para la compra de sus productos.

María desea que su negocio salga adelante y poco a poco pueda empezar a construir la pequeña boutique que ha anhelado desde hace mucho tiempo, ella sabe que si llega a lograrlo podrá tener un ingreso seguro y ya no tendrá que caminar diariamente bajo el inmenso sol que acompaña a la ciudad de Ica, Perú y a todos sus habitantes.

Con un poco de ayuda, Maria podrá comprar mucha más ropa (Polos, Shorts, Pantalones, etc.), ya que no solo se le están acabando los que actualmente vende, sino que también podrá compra la ropa de otoño que necesita para sus clientes. Con este apoyo, maría se sienta capaz de lograr el éxito y así mejorar mucho más su calidad de vida, para que en el algún momento logre lo que tanto ha deseado, “Su propia Boutique”.
texts.en:
María’s a hardworking, enterprising woman who is managing to get ahead little by little.  She became a micro businesswoman at the instant she started selling clothes from place to place, an activity she’s been doing now for about four years.  Thanks to her work in a large agricultural plantation she was able to gradually save up enough to be able to buy her merchandise.

María is hoping that the business will gradually make progress so that she can start to build a small boutique which she’s dreamed of for a long time.  She knows that if she manages to do so she will have a secure source of income and will no longer have to go out on foot every day under the huge sun that’s always above the city of Ica, Perú and all its inhabitants.

With a little bit of help, María will be able to buy much more clothing (polo shirts, shorts, pants, etc.) because not only is she running out of the ones she currently sells but  she will also be able to stock up on fall clothes her customers are needing.  With this support, María feels capable of attaining success and thus improve her quality of life much more so that at some point she will attain what she’s so desired: “Her own boutique.”

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Mendieta Lijeron

texts.es: La Sra. Cesia tiene 22 años y es madre soltera tiene un hijo que tiene la edad de 2 años, se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y bebidas su tienda se e encuentran ubicada en la zona primero  de Septiembre,  Este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Cesia utilizara  este préstamo  para la compra de material de construcción para el techado de su negocio ya que esta época de lluvias le perjudica en sus ventas, la Sra. Cesia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son atraer mas clientes y utilizara los beneficios para tener mayores ingresos para su familia. El deseo de la Sra.  Cesia es ampliar la construcción de un local más grande y contratar más empleados que le ayuden a ir mejorando cada día, la Sra. Cesia se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Cesia, 22, is a single mother of a two year old son.  She sells soft-drinks and beverages in her store located in the Primero de Septiembre zone.  This loan is her second cycle within the institution.  Cesia will use this loan to buy building materials and supplies to roof her business because the rainy season negatively affects her sales.  

Cesia’s business challenge is to attract more customers and will use the benefits to have increased income for her family.  Cesia’s wish is to expand the construction into a larger site and to hire employees to help her improve each day.  Cesia feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy building supplies to roof her store.

loans.name: Tariro Group

texts.en:
This is 54-year-old Ellen from Harare. She is married with three children. Ellen runs a retail business selling clothes in the form of baby-wear and school uniforms. The business has been in operation for 3 years. She has requested a loan of $500 to buy baby wear and school uniforms.

With the extra income generated from this loan, Ellen will be able to improve the welfare of her family. She says the main challenges faced are too much competition. In the future Ellen plans to have a self-sustainable project.

loans.use: to buy baby-wear  and school uniforms for resale

loans.name: Takura Group

texts.en: This is 27-year-old Spiwe from Harare. She is single with two children. She also cares for two dependents. Spiwe runs a retail business selling clothes and electrical appliances. The business has been in operation for 3 years. She says the main challenge faced is stiff competition. Spiwe has requested a loan of $400 to buy electrical gadgets for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her improve the living standards of the family. In the future Spiwe plans to own a shop.

loans.use: to buy electrical gadgets for resale

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es:
Timotea, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de mercadería, porque la demanda de los clientes aun sigue, comprara medicina antibióticos, vitaminas, analgésicos, elaborados con hierbas, tambien comprara una parte de ropa para revender más que todo blusas y ropa interior.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a surtir la venta de ropa, mejorando las ventas y ha logrado aumentar los clientes, las condiciones con su familia se mantienen, pero ella cuenta con un negocio más estable.
texts.en:
Timotea is requesting a new loan to buy merchandise because demand from her customers still continues.  She will buy medicine: antibiotics, vitamins, and analgesics made with herbs.  She also will buy a batch of clothing to resell, blouses and underwear more than anything else.

The previous loan helped her to stock her clothing store, improving her sales.  She has increased her customers.  The conditions with her family are the same, but she has a more stable business.

loans.use: to buy medicine: antibiotics, vitamins, and analgesics.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban, trabaja como mecánico y no cuenta con muchos ingresos ya que  comparte el taller con su amigo.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de herramientas (un par de máquinas para levantar el vehiculo y cambiar ruedas; una soldadora y un juego de llaves para entornillar y desentorinillar)ya que con esto realizara trabajos extras para tener más ingresos para mantener a sus hijos.
Esteban, es divorciado y tiene cinco hijos con los cuales vive en una casa en alquiler en la zona Villa Nueva Potosí en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Esteban works as a mechanic but does not earn much income because he shares the shop with his friend.  He needs the loan to buy tools (a pair of machines to raise the vehicle to replace the tires, a welder and a set of wrenches to attach and remove screws) because with this he will be able to do extra jobs and earn more income to support his children.

Esteban is divorced and has five children he lives with in a rented house in the city of La Paz’s Nueva Potosí zone.  It’s the second time he’s worked with IMPRO and second with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy two jacks, a welder and a wrench set.

loans.name: Amalia Sarai

texts.es:
Amalia, se ha decidido por solicitar un nuevo préstamo, el cual piensa invertir en el negocio, comprando mas materiales para la elaboración de las pupusas, como el quesillo, maíz, aceite, condimentos, gas, esto le permitirá mantener lo necesario para continuar en sus ventas.
Las condiciones de Amalia y su familia han cambiado, esto por la buena administración del préstamo anterior, pues logro mejorar el negocio.
texts.en: Amalia has decided to request a new loan, which she plans to invest in the business. She will buy more materials for the production of pupusas (stuffed tortillas or tortillas rellenas), like cheese, corn, oil, seasonings and soft drinks. This will permit her to maintain what is necessary to continue with her sales. Amalia and her family's conditions have changed, and this is due to good management of the previous loan. They were able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy cheese, corn, oil, seasonings and soft drinks.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
La señora Jacqueline trabaja en un instituto privado dictando clases de Gastronomía  y también cuenta con la renta de viuda.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora ya que esto le será de mucha ayuda en su trabajo, tanto para preparar sus clases y llevar registro de sus alumnos.
Jacqueline es viuda y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en la casa de sus abuelos en la zona Norte de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Jacqueline works in a private institute teaching cooking classes and she also gets a widow’s pension.  She needs the loan to buy a computer which will be of great help to her in her job both to prepare her classes and to keep her students’ records.

Jacqueline is a widow and has two children she lives with in their grandparents’ house in the city of La Paz's Norte zone.  It’s the first time she’s worked with IMPRO and with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Nelly Ernestina

texts.es:
Nelly, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, para invertir más en el negocio, comprándose tres cerdos más para aumentar la granja, esto es un avance para Nelly, pues la tenencia de cerdos le incrementa la oportunidad de obtener ganancias a futuro.
El efecto que tuvo Nelly con el préstamo anterior fue muy favorable, ya que invirtió en cerdos y creció en el negocio, las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia están cambiando, viviendo mejor en la actualidad.
texts.en:
Nelly decided to get a new loan to invest in the business buying three more pigs to increase the herd size.  This is a step forward for Nelly because having the pigs increases her opportunity for future profits.

The effect Nelly’s previous loan had was very favorable in that she bought pigs and enlarged the business.  Her and her family’s living conditions are also changing; they are living better at present.

loans.use: to buy three pigs.

loans.name: Evergreen Ladies Group

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Letween from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe, which means 'he who does not sleep". She is widowed with one child, who attends school. She also cares for one dependent. 

Letween runs a business producing clothes. The business has been in operation for 8 years. She says the main challenges faced are frequent power cuts which slow down business. Letween has requested a loan of $800 to buy sewing machines and cloth. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to help with family upkeep. In the future Letween plans to own a clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 44-year-old married man, who has been working in wholesale clothing sales since 1994. Hassan's business is going on fine but needs some effort to improve it, that's why he applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to expand his spring/summer collection.

Hassan has three children; he works hard to provide them with good and healthy living. His business is unique since it's a mobile wholesale trade, he uses his car to pass along through many different villages and search for new customers in order to improve his work.

He hopes to keep on expanding his business as much as he can, and to keep on gaining customers' trust and support.

loans.use: To expand his spring/summer collection

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 37 years old. She is separated with six children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past one year.

This is her first loan with  KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a client. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

She hopes to buy another piece of land to expand her farming.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Ederlina

texts.en:
Ederlina is a hardworking and diligent person. She is married and raising four children. Her husband operates a motorcycle transportation while she is involved in a hog fattening business and in household work. They are helping each other to provide their children a comfortable life.


Presently, Ederlina is asking for 14,000 pesos to buy new tires and paint for their motorcycle as well as feed for her pigs. She hopes for great improvement to the transportation business of her husband and, at the same time, her business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and paint for their motorcycle as well as feed for her pigs

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is 52 years old, and she has been selling charcoal in Mombasa. She is married and a mother of four children. She has been doing this business for the last one year with great success. 

This is her first loan from KADET LTD, to finance her business. She plans to purchase more sacks of charcoal to resell to her customers. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and expand her business further. She hopes have a successful business and thus live a happier and comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Hamamaoko Group

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Precious from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe. She is married with three children, two attending school. Precious runs a retail business selling clothes and footwear. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says the main challenge faced is market liquidity. 

Precious has requested a loan of $500 to purchase footwear and clothes. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to enhance the family welfare. In the future Precious plans to open a shop in town.

loans.use: to buy clothes and footwear for resale

loans.name: Rakhat

texts.ru:
Рахат 20 лет, воспитывает годовалого сына.   В поисках дохода для своей семьи, 2 года назад Рахат начала свой бизнес в животноводстве, стартовав с  суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному и настойчивому труду Рахат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодня имеется 1 дойная корова и 1 бычок, что приносит  около 5,000 сом (KGS) ежемесячной прибыли с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рахат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота на откорм и перепродажу. Доходы от кредита Рахат планирует вложить в увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en: Rakhat is 20 years old and raising a one-year-old son.  In search of a source of income for her family, Rakhat started her own business in animal husbandry two years ago with an initial sum of 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her persistent and hard work, her business now contains one dairy cow and one bull and yields about 5,000 som (KGS) in monthly profit from sales of milk and milk products.  In order to further develop her business, Rakhat requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock for fattening up and resale.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Edwin Manfredis

texts.es:
Edwin, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, con la intención de seguir trabajando, pues se dispone a relizar el nuevo cultivo, para esto necesita pagar el arrendamiento del terreno y la compra de abono para aplicarlo al cultivo de maíz, frijol y canela.
El considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo para comprarse los insumos que aplico a la siembra anterior, con esto pudo sacar una buena cosecha para el sustento familiar.
texts.en: Edwin has decided on a new loan intending to continue working because he’s planning to start a new crop and to do so needs to pay to lease the land and to buy manure to apply to his corn, bean and cinnamon crops.  He feels that the previous loan helped him to buy supplies he applied to his previous crops which led to a good harvest to support his family.

loans.use: to lease the land and to buy manure.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.es:
Apolinaria, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para el fortalecimiento del negocio, comprara materiales para la elaboración de tamales y tortillas, como el maíz que es el principal, los condimentos, hojas de banano, pollo, aceite, leña, con estará en la disposición de continuar elaborando sus productos.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo para mantener lo necesario en el negocio, pues considera que su vida personal está mejorando a través de las ganancias que le quedan.
texts.en: Apolinaria’s asking for a new loan to strengthen the business.  She will buy supplies to make tamales and tortillas like corn, which is the main one, condiments, banana leaves, chicken, oil and firewood which will set her up to continue making her products.  She feels that the previous loan helped her to have everything necessary in the business and feels her personal life is also improving thanks to the profits she’s earning.

loans.use: to buy condiments, banana leaves, chicken, oil and firewood.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José, quiere seguir trabajando, por eso está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque considera que son su alternativa para ejecutar mejor su trabajo, con este dinero comprara tubos pvc, las conecciones de agua al interior le vivienda.
El manifiesta que el préstamo anterior, le ayudo a solventar la necesidad de la bomba para el agua  y algunas circunstancias en la familia,pues con la bomba solo instalara la tuberia para tener agua al alcance dentro de la casa, está agradecido por este aporte, que le ha permitido arreglar la casa, para que su familia se sienta más cómoda.
texts.en:
José wants to continue working which is why he’s asked for a new loan because he feels it’s his alternative to better do his work.  With this money he will buy PVC tubing and connections to install water inside the house.

He states that the previous loan helped him cover the need for a water pump and for some family needs because with the pump he now just still needs to install the tubing to have water available inside his house.

He’s grateful for this contribution that has made it possible for him to fix his house so that his family will feel more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy pvc tubing.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos, se ha decidido por mejorar su cosecha, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para la compra de los insumos necesarios, como el abono, herbicidas, semilla, con lo que espera tener una buena cosecha.
El considera que a través de este medio, ha logrado crecer en sus cultivos y ganado, ya que esto le da una mejor condición junto a su familia.
texts.en: Carlos has decided to improve his crops so is asking for a loan to buy the necessary supplies like manure, herbicide and seeds that he hopes will lead to a good harvest.  He feels that through this means he’s managed to grow in his crops and his cattle since it’s given him and his family a better condition.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicide and seeds.

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es:
Deysi, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo, por el buen servicio que ha recibido y porque quiere comprar mas materiales como pollo, azúcar, arroz, huevos, para surtir el negocio, ofreciéndoles a los clientes lo necesario para el hogar.
Ella considera que a través del préstamo anterior, logro surtir el negocio y mejorar los ingresos para la familia, también a mejorado las instalaciones de la vivienda.
texts.en: Deysi is asking for a new loan because of the good service she’s received and because she wants to buy supplies like chicken, sugar, rice and eggs to stock the store thereby offering her customers what they need for the home.  She feels that thanks to the previous loan she was able to stock the store and improve family income; she also did some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy chicken, sugar, rice and eggs.

loans.name: Kurbon

texts.ru: Курбон женат и на воспитании имеет четверых детей. Более 16 лет она занимается откармливанием и продажей скота. Он хочет получить хорошую прибыль, чтобы улучшить жилищные условия семьи. В бизнесе помогают ему его семья. Они очень дружно работают. Курбон запрашивает займ для покупки 3-х голов крупного рогатого скота. Он надеется на вашу поддержку и щедрость.
texts.en: Kurbon is married and has four children.  He has been involved in fattening up and selling livestock for over 16 years.  He wants to make a good profit in order to improve his family's living conditions.  His family helps him with the business.  They work very well together.  Kurbon is requesting this loan to buy three heads of cattle.  He relies on your support and generosity.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Jose Celin

texts.es:
José, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para la compra de ropa nueva para salir a vender, blusas, faldas, ropa interior, ropa para niños, este préstamo le va a permitir tener un nuevo jiro surtido de productos para poder atender la demanda.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a crecer en mercadería de medicamentos, manteniendo  surtido el negocio y mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia, por el aumento de sus ventas.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan to purchase new clothes. He will go out and sell blouses, skirts, underwear, and children's clothing. This loan will allow him to go into a new line of business and have a variety of products to supply demand.
The previous loan helped him increase his merchandise of medicines, by keeping the business stocked and improving his family's quality of life, due to increased sales.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, skirts, underwear, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Isroiljon

texts.ru: Исроилчон женат и ответственный отец двоих детей. Более 10 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. Также занимается откормом скота. Отходы от выращивания сельхозкультур идут на корм скота. Исроилчон запрашивает займ в размере 4000 сомони, и он намерен использовать займ для покупки 2-х голов крупного рогатого скота и семян пшеницы и ячменя для посева. Он надеется на вашу поддержку и милосердие.
texts.en: Isroiljon is married and a responsible father of two children.  He has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over ten years.  He is also involved in fattening up livestock.  The leftovers from growing agricultural crops go toward feeding livestock.  Isroiljon is requesting a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni and intends to use the loan to buy two heads of cattle and wheat and barley seeds for sowing.  He relies on your support and mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle and seeds

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима занимается торговлей продуктами питания на рынке. Ей 43 года,она замужем и  имеет троих детей, которые помогают ей в этом виде деятельности.Уже несколько  лет Фотима занимается этой торговлей . Она покупает товары с рынка «Авган базара» г. Худжанда и продает их на  местном рынке. Ей помогает его сын Фуркатжон. Его жена домохозяйка.Фотима берет кредит с 2007 года.Она никогда  не нарушала условия организации и целенаправленно использует полученные кредиты.На полученный кредит клиент хочет купит строительные материалы.В связи с тем что ее дом нуждается в обновлении она решила сделать ремонт.
texts.en: Fotima is involved in selling food products at a market.  She is 43 years old, married and has three children, who help her with this business.  Fotima has been involved in sales for several years.  She buys products at the "Afgan bazar" in the city of Khujand and sells them at the local market.  Her son, Furkatjon, helps her.  His wife is a homemaker.  Fotima has been obtaining financing since 2007.  She never violated the terms of the organization and used obtained loans as intended.  She wants to use this loan to buy construction materials.  Because her house needs updating, Fotima decided to make repairs to it.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca, trabaja como secretaria dentro de un club deportivo y también cuenta con el dinero que su esposo le envía del interior.
El crédito lo requiere para  pagar la operación de vesícula de su hermano ya que el no cuenta con ingresos, pues no está trabajando.
Francisca, es casada y tiene dos hijos, viven en casa propia en la zona Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Francisca works as a secretary at a sports club and also gets money her husband sends her from abroad.  She needs the loan to pay for her brother’s gall bladder surgery because he has no source of income because he’s not working.

Francisca is married and has two children.  She lives in her own house located in the city of La Paz’s Alto San Pedro zone.  This is the first time she’s worked with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to pay for her brother's gall bladder surgery.

loans.name: La Libertad Group

texts.es: Doña Bertha es miembro del Grupo Solidario La Libertad, tiene 44 años de edad, es casada, es madre de dos hijos, y reside en Barrio Santa Clara, Salama, Olancho. Su esposo trabaja en la agricultura. Doña Bertha es propietaria de una pulpería, la cual inicio cuando el esposo de su hija se quedo sin trabajo por la situación económica del país, el con un pequeño crédito que recibió logro comprar lo básico y lo que mas se vende para el uso del hogar, luego el le dejo el negocio a doña Bertha cuando este consiguió trabajo, ella continua con el mismo negocio pero ahora un poco mas surtido. Doña Bertha trabaja en conjunto con su hijo y tiene un horario de atención de 7:00 am a 9:00 pm. Es una familia luchadora y honesta, en lo personal dice que se enfrenta a problemas de competencia con  los demás negocios y enfrenta problemas con la pobreza que hay en todo el país. Tiene como meta ver a su hijo profesional, mantener un negocio bien surtido y mas grande para tener una mejor calidad de vida. El préstamo que solicita lo necesita para surtir más su negocio con productos como ser: azúcar, jabones, manteca, arroz, refrescos, entre otros. Los desafíos que enfrenta en el negocio son porque cada día el precio de la canasta básica es más alto. Es el primer crédito que doña Bertha tiene con Fama y espera cancelar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the “La Libertad” communal bank.  She’s 44 years old, married and the mother of two children.  She lives in Barrio Santa Clara in Salama, Olancho.  Her husband works in agriculture.

Bertha owns a grocery store that she started when her daughter’s husband lost his job due to the country’s economic situation.  With a small loan he was able to get he bought the basics and what sells most is home use items.  Later, when he got a job, he left the store to Bertha and she continues with it although it’s now a little better stocked.

Bertha works with her son and is open from 7am until 9pm.  This is a hardworking, honest family.  She says that on a personal level she faces problems with competition from other businesses and she also faces the problem of widespread poverty in the country.

Her goal is to see her son become a professional, to keep the store well-stocked and to enlarge it in order to improve her quality of life.

The loan she’s requesting is to stock her store with more products like: sugar, soap, lard, rice and soft-drinks, among other.  The challenge the business faces is that prices of basic staples rise daily.  

This is Bertha’s first Fama loan and she expects to make her installment payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Emprendedoras Del Valle El Triunfo Group

texts.es: Emprendedoras del valle triunfo a si se llama este grupo de mujeres luchadoras y optimistas para los negocios propios que tiene como fuente de ingresos para ella y sus familias. Este grupo lleva ya formado 2 años, de muy buenas expectativas de negocio, conformado por 8 integrantes, el cual todas con una historia en particular, tal es así el caso de la señora Gumercinda de 41 años de edad madre de 3 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad. Ella se dedica todos los días a la venta de preparacion de productos naturales hace mas de 18 años, el cual le ha generado ganancias para sustentar los gastos en el hogar a su vez también se dedica por las tardes a la venta de comida. Con el reciente préstamo piensa invertirlo en la compra de mercadería para su negocio. Como la señora Gumercinda, cada integrante del grupo tiene una historia en particular pero entre todas coinciden en el deseo y el esfuerzo de salir siempre adelante por el bienestar de ellas y sus familias.
texts.en:
"Emprendedoras del Valle Triunfo" ["Entrepreneurs of the Triunfo Valley"] is the name this group of hard-working and optimistic women has given to their own businesses which are a source of income for them and their families.  This group was formed two years ago with many good business expectations.  It is made up of eight members, all of whom have their own story.

This is the case with Señora Gumercinda, aged 41, who is the mother of three grown children.  For more than 18 years, she has been working everyday selling a preparation of natural products.  This has earned her profits to cover her household expenses.  At the same time, she also works in the evenings selling food.  She is planning on investing the new loan in purchasing merchandise for her business.

As with Señora Gumercinda, each member of the group has their own story, but they all share in the desire and the efforts to always move ahead in life for the well-being of themselves and their families.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Jose Reyneri

texts.es:
José, necesita de un préstamo para poder iniciar con su trabajo agrícola, pues arrendara el terreno donde se dispone a sembrar el maíz y los frijoles, este préstamo le facilitara el dinero para poder realizar lo que necesita y asegurar el lugar.
Él considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo para comprarse los insumos agrícolas, los cuales aplico y le ayudaron a que su cultivo fuera mas productivo, con ello pudo tener lo necesario para alimentar a su familia, él ha mejorado las instalaciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
José needs a loan to enable him to start his farming work as he hires the plot of land where he is preparing to sow corn and bean crops. This loan will provide him with money to make his preparations and to secure the location.

The previous loan helped him to buy the farming supplies that he used and these helped him to yield a more productive crop, which enabled him to feed his family and he has also improved the facilities in his home.

loans.use: to rent the land on which he will plant his crops

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more honey, fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque quiere invertir nuevamente en el negocio, comprándose maíz y leña para  elaborar tortillas, pues este negocio considera que le dara la oportunidad de cubrirse sus gastos.
Manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ayudo, propiciándole lo necesario para mantenerse en actividad de la venta de tamales y atol  y así que su negocio no se reduzca.
texts.en:
María is requesting a new loan because she wants to re-invest in her business. She will purchase corn and firewood for making tortillas, because she considers this business will give her the opportunity to cover her expenses. 
She states that the previous loan helped her by supplying her with what she needed to stay in business selling tamales and cornflour drinks, so that her business wouldn't decrease.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood.

loans.name: Chido Group

texts.en:
This is 52-year-old Gilbert from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe. He is single with five children, one attending school.

Gilbert runs a retail business selling clothes and footwear. The business has been in operation for 32 years. He says the main challenges faced are stiff competition. Gilbert has requested a loan of $600 to buy clothes for resale. With the extra income generated as a result of this loan, Gilbert will be able improve the general welfare of his family. In the future Gilbert plans to own an number of clothing shops in and around the capital city Harare.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix, a 37-year old father of three children, one of whom is enrolled in school, is married to Grace. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

For 15 years now, Felix has operated a shop selling a variety of goods, his primary customers the general public. His greatest challenges are stiff competition and price fluctuations, and school fees are his highest monthly expense.

Having joined Yehu for their good lending policies, Felix is requesting a loan of Ksh 40,000 to purchase a stock of beans and sugar. He aspires to open a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of beans and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for more honey to sell

loans.name: Abubakir

texts.ru: Абубакир добрый и трудолюбивый человек, который женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Имеет богатый опыт по животноводству и выращивания сельхозкультур. Более 15 лет он занимается купле- продажей скота. Абубакир мечтает расширить свой бизнес для того чтобы улучшить благосостояния семьи. Он хотел бы получить займ 5 голов крупного рогатого скота, и на остальную сумму намерен закупить семян пшеницы и ячменя для посева.
texts.en: Abubakir is a kind and hardworking person, who is married and raising two children.  He has a rich experience in animal husbandry and growing agricultural crops.  He has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over 15 years.  Abubakir dreams of expanding his business in order to improve his family's welfare.  He wants to obtain this loan to buy five heads of cattle and use the rest of the loan amount to buy wheat and barley seeds for sowing.

loans.use: to buy cattle and seeds

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Она очень трудолюбивая и добрая женщина. Более 20 лет она занимается купле- продажей скота и выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. В бизнесе помогают муж. Мавлуда запрашивает займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки 2-голов крупного рогатого скота и семян ячменя для посева. Мавлуда надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Mavluda is married and a loving mother of three children.  She is a very hardworking and kind woman.  She has been involved in buying and selling livestock and growing agricultural crops for over 20 years.  Her husband helps her with the business.  Mavluda is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 Somoni to buy two heads of cattle and barley seeds for sowing.  Mavluda relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle and seeds

loans.name: Renie

texts.en:
Renie is 35 years old and loves to cook snacks. With the ability to cook delicious food, he built a small stand beside his store in their house. As he sells groceries, he also sells snacks such as banana cue (banana on a stick) and juice. 


To make his business prosper, he is requesting a loan of 10,000 pesos to buy groceries, bananas, "camote" root (sweet potatoes) and sugar.  He hopes to save enough money for his parents as well as his future.

loans.use: to buy groceries, bananas, "camote" (sweet potatoes) and sugar

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a 50-year-old married man. He has six children and all are enrolled in school. His wife's name is Fatuma. Hamisi operates a tailoring business and sells his goods from home. He's worked in this business for 20 years. His primary customers are the community at large. 

Hamisi's other source of income includes farming. He describes his greatest business challenge to be seasonality and his highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Hamisi will use the Kes 10,000 loan to add cloth materials. Hamisi aspires to open a tailoring school in the future. He joined Yehu for their good services.

loans.use: to add cloth materials.

loans.name: La Arnie Lee

texts.en:
La Arnie Lee is full of hope in life. She is 26 years old and married with one child. Her family is currently living in the village of Gundaway Cabarroguis.

La Arnie Lee has is operating a business known as "EB cycle Parts" where she offers different kinds of motorcycle parts and car parts. She has been in this kind of business for five years. She started with PHP 20,000 in capital. With her small capital, she was able to improve her spare parts business. La Arnie Lee is really grateful because her grandmother-in-law is supportive about making the business more productive. The income generated from her business is used for their daily basic needs, allowances, monthly electric bill and school fees for her daughter.

La Arnie Lee has been doing her best in order to obtain success in life. Though she has only one child, her expenses are still too high because her child is studying at a private school. She wants this for her only child because she was not able to finish her studies due to an early marriage. At this time, she would like to buy mufflers, oil, tires and other kinds of spare parts for motorcycles because the products immediately sell out. With her goal of having a high income and providing her customers with quality products, she is requesting a bigger loan amount of PHP 40,000 this time. She hopes that she can obtain this loan amount. This would be a big help in making her business expand.

loans.use: to buy mufflers, oil ,tires and other kinds of motorcycle parts

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a 36-year-old single man. He operates a farming business and sells his products from home. He has worked in the business for 10 years. His primary customers are the villagers in his rural area. His greatest challenge is seasonality and his greatest monthly expense is food. Michael owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. He will use the KES 40,000 to purchase farm equipment and some seedlings. Michael aspires to open a new shop in the future. He joined Yehu for their low interest rates and good services.

loans.use: to purchase farm equipment and some seedlings.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a married man who sells tap water and juice. He has two children who are both enrolled in school. His wife is a business woman. Musa’s other source of income is his wife's earnings. He has worked in the business for seven years. His primary customers are his neighbors. His major challenge is seasonality, especially during the rainy season. His greatest monthly expense is food. Musa owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. He will use the loan of 30,000 KES to purchase ingredients for making juice. He aspires to open a hotel in the future. He joined Yehu because it has a good reputation of offering good services.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making juice

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Esta señora es originaria del poblado de san Jacinto se desempeña como maestra de primaria con 28 años de laborar impartiendo clases en un colegio de la localidad, en caso de su núcleo familiar no tiene hijos a su cargo, ya son independiente, esta señora está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de Perlin, Zinc, Cemento, Hierro, Goloso y Mano de Obra, Para mejorar el techo y pared de su vivienda actualmente está solicitando el tercer financiamiento atravez del convenio firmado con dicho colegio, dicho financiamiento le ayudara a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida, por eso es que se ha mantenido fiel a ceprodel como cliente activo siendo beneficiada con los créditos los que le han sido de gran impacto en su desarrollo y condiciones familiares.
texts.en:
This woman is originally from the town of San Jacinto where she works as an elementary school teacher. For the past 28 years, she has taught classes at the local school. Regarding her family, she has no dependent children since they are already independent.

This woman is requesting a loan in order to buy crossbeams, zinc, cement, iron, screws, and to pay for labor so that she can make improvements to the roof and the walls of her home. She is currently seeking her third loan which is being offered through a signed agreement with her school. She says the loans have helped improve the standard of her living conditions. For this reason, she has remained a loyal and active client of CEPRODEL. The benefits from these loans have had a positive impact on the development of her family's conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for home improvements and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Daynor

texts.es:
Daynor, trabaja como chofer asalariado en un sindicato de trufis en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para pagar la operación de su sobrina ya que tiene el labio leporino y sus papás son de muy bajos recursos y notienen dinero para dicha operación.
Daynor es casado y tiene un hijo con el cual vive en una  casa alquilada en la zona Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Daynor works as a salaried driver in a minibus drivers' union in the city of La Paz.

The loan that he is requesting is to pay for an operation for his niece who has a cleft palate.  Her parents have very few resources and need money for this operation.

Daynor is married and has a son with whom he lives in a rented home in the Achachicala neighborhood of La Paz.

This is his second time working with IMPRO, and his second time with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for an operation to fix his niece's cleft palate.

loans.name: Mbusa

texts.en: Mbusa is 37 years old and married man with six children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has been teaching for 16 years. His personal goals are educating children and building a permanent home. His other goal is being a head teacher. Mbusa wants money to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: to buy land and construct a house

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha is a 40-year old married woman. She operates a café and sells her goods from home. She has worked in the business for five years. Her primary customers are her villagers. The major challenge is stiff competition, and her greatest monthly expense is school fees. Mwanasha owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She will use the loan of KES 15,000 to pay for school fees. She aspires to open a restaurant in the future. She joined Yehu because of their good services and low interest rate.

loans.use: to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for honey in bulk

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en: Sharon is a 35-year-old married woman. She has three children ranging from 5 to 16 years old. She describes herself to be an outgoing innovative go-getter. She operates a restaurant where she sells food, tea, snacks and fruit. She has been involved in this business for five years and employs three staff members. Her business is located at a strategic business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of ingredients. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase a tent for outside catering. Her business goal is to run a big hotel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be the best outside caterer.

loans.use: to pay for a tent for outside catering.

loans.name: Muhindo

texts.en:
Muhindo is a fifty-year-old married man with eight children. He has been operating a retail general store for twelve years in which he started with a capital of 30,000 shillings and now has 2,500,000 shillings as working capital. His hardships are customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to purchase stock. His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent house.

Muhindo's business goals are diversifying his business, expanding to new markets, and moving his business to a more permanent location. Muhindo wants money to buy bread and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy bread and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is 42 years old and started his photography business just one year ago.  He plans to use this loan to purchase a new camera, which will enable him to take higher quality photographs for clients.  He dreams one day of expanding his business to include his own studio.

loans.use: to pay for a new camera for his photography work

loans.name: Hery

texts.en:
Hery is a married man who operates a poultry business and sells his products from home. He has three children and all are in school. His wife is a business-woman. His other sources of income include earnings from his wife. 

He intends to use the loan of KSH 35,000 to purchase chicks and poultry feed. He has been in the business for six months and his primary customers are his neighbors. He describes his greatest challenge to be seasonality. He aspires to be a supplier of chicken meat in the future. He joined Yehu for their fair policies. Hery owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Bayartsetseg

texts.en:
Bayartsetseg is a twenty-six years old woman who lives with her parents in Dornogobi province in Southern Mongolia. Her parents are retirees. She started running taxi service in 2011 with an Elantra car. This has been source of income for her and she has used it to improve the standards of living of the household. As she is a local person, she knows the routes well. 

Due to the bad roads in Mongolia, her car has broken down and needs to be repaired. In order to continue doing her business, she needs the loan. Bayartsetseg is an active woman who says that "I would like to develop the business by having my car repaired. I wish to increase my income and start a new business activity". The total amount she is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to purchase window-panes for her car and her ger, a Mongolian traditional house.

loans.use: To purchase window-panes for her car and ger.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a married man. He has three children and all are enrolled in school. His wife is a business-woman. 

Mohammed operates a fish and poultry-selling business. With the KES 30,000, he will purchase chicks and poultry feed. He has been in the business for three years. His other sources of income include his wife’s earnings. He sells his products from home. His primary customers are his neighbors, and he describes his main challenge to be seasonality. Mohammed aspires to be the leading supplier for broilers in the area. 

He joined Yehu for their good services. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
La señora Feliciana Irene es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 62 años de edad quien se dedica al comercio general. Ella vende desde ropa usada, nueva, pinol y pasteles desde hace 6 años. 
Feliciana tiene 9 hijos ya mayores quienes le ayudan en el negocio principalmente sus hijas. El crédito lo invertirá en pinol, pinolillo, cereal…etc. Ya que son productos de gran demanda en semana santa.
texts.en:
Sra. Feliciana is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is 62 years old and works as a general merchant. Feliciana has been selling new and used clothing, "pinol" (a beverage made with cornmeal), and desserts for six years. She has nine grown children who help with her business, mainly her daughters.

This loan will be invested in "pinol", cacao mix, grain, and other products. There will be great demand for her merchandise during Holy Week.

loans.use: to buy corn, cacao, firewood, and other products.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin is twenty-five years old and is a very friendly and vigorous man. He is married and has two sons. His primarily business is selling accessories for mobile phones. He has five years of experience in this field. Having been in this business for quite long time, he knows the best places to buy accessories for the lowest prices. 

He applied for a 1,000 AZN loan in order to purchase a diversified variety of accessories as there is high demand for this kind of product.

loans.use: to buy a variety of mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Ilaha

texts.en:
Ilaha is a forty-six-year-old woman, married, with two sons. She sells women's clothes from her house. She has three years of experience. She sells clothes at home because many female neighbors likes to come to her place, drink some tea, try on clothes and finally buy them.  It is very popular practice for Azerbaijani women to buy clothes from trader's homes, rather going to the clothes bazaar, which is usually far from residential neighborhoods.

Ilaha's monthly profit is 250 AZN and she would like to increase it. For this purpose she has applied for a 1,200 AZN loan. She will use it to buy seasonal clothes. This will be her second loan and with the first loan she was able to start her business. Now she is a trusted client of AqroInvest CU.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Hokume

texts.en:
Hokume is fifty-four years old married woman with six children. Hokume has bred cattle and cows for the last ten years. Her husband is builder of houses, and his work is not permanent, hence his earnings are not enough to maintain the family. 

Hokume usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then resells them for more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 100 AZN; this business is only one of the sources of income for her family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. 

She wants to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She has applied for a 1,200 AZN loan to purchase a calf and a milker cow. This will be her second loan and she has a positive credit history.

loans.use: to buy a calf and a milker cow.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a married man who is also a fish vendor. He has five children and all are enrolled in school. His wife is a businesswoman. His other source of income includes earnings from his spouse. He has worked in the business for three years. His primary customers are the general public. He describes his major challenge to be seasonality and perishability of his goods since he has no refrigerator and his greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food. Omar owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. With the loan of KES 30,000, he will be able to purchase a refrigerator. He aspires to be a leading fish supplier in the area. He joined Yehu due to their fair policies.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Munhsuren

texts.en: Munhsuren is a man who lives with his wife and two children in the second largest city in Mongolia. He first learned to make blocks in 2008. Later, he started making them alone at home with his new equipment. He has been supplying the blocks to the local jails and other organizations. He is an experienced trader in his field. Many people from different areas come to him to buy his high quality blocks. Munhsuren is a hardworking and good man who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by purchasing the cement, gravel and sand in large quantities. I have a further plan to make my business bigger than this with the high volume". The total amount he is requesting is 1,200,000 MNT to buy the necessary raw materials such as cement, gravel, sand for the block producing business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as cement, gravel, and sand

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, pues comprara más concentrado para los cerdos, tambien mejorara el corral con madera nueva, y como se encuentra iniciando sus labores agrícolas, comprara abono, herbicidas, para aplicarlos al cultivo.
El efecto que tuvo con su préstamo anterior le ayudo para mejorar sus ingresos y el numero de ganado, manteniendo estable su situación y mejoro en la producción de maíz, su familia se ha mantenido y ahora cuenta con una mejor condición.
texts.en: Manuel has decided to request a new loan so that he can buy more concentrated feed for his pigs.  He will also make improvements to his animal pens by purchasing new wood.  In addition, the work on his farmland has started, so he needs to buy compost and herbicides to apply on his crops.  The effect of his previous loan helped to improve his income and the number of livestock that he owns.  His situation has remained stable and he has improved his corn production.  Manuel is able to support his family and now they are in a better condition.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed, compost, herbicides, and wood for making renovations to his animal pens.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Hem is a public school professional teacher living in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham. She provides education to young children between the ages of seven and ten. She teaches a maximum of four hours a day and switches between morning and afternoon shifts every other month. From this valued work, she can earn a decent income to live on. So she decided to get involved in another business, raising pigs, in order to make additional income for the household. Now she is forty-one years old, married, and has two school-age children. Hem has been a client of HKL for two years and it’ll be her second loan. 

She would like to use the loan to purchase an additional plot of rice field to so she can expand and increase her rice production in the coming years. She can sell her rice for profit if she is able to maintain a fruitful harvest annually. Hen will save her increased income for her children's future education and for family emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase an additional plot of rice field so she can expand and increase her rice production in the coming years.
